Flawless representation of the most influential styles. Plus a full portfolio of permanent, perennials, and limited editions that ever-explore our globe's limitless range of brew styles and accents. So set aside any preconceived notions about beer, and Raze Expectations!

name: Anderson Valley Brewing Company
description: We carefully craft our world-class ales using only the finest ingredients; premium malted and roasted grains, hops, yeast, and pristine Boonville water straight from our own unique aquifer, and we never heat pasteurize or sterile filter our beers. Our tradition of carefully crafting inspired, flavorful, ales of the highest caliber has earned numerous awards, a loyal following, and our two-time placement among the World Beer Championships® as well as a 2011 Gold Medal at the GABF® for our Brother David's Double.

name: The Bruery
description: A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue. Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

name: 7 Mile Brewery
description: We are a craft brewery that seeks to produce great beers. We make recipes with all kinds of malts, grains, hops sugars and other flavorings. Our goal is make great beer as interesting as the people who drink it . We focus on delivering a product that reflects the tastes of the community that we serve. Something for everybody.

name: First Magnitude Brewing Company
description: In March 2012, four friends came together with the concept of opening a brewery in our hometown of Gainesville. We all had great jobs and young kids, so the idea of changing our lives and opening a brewery was truly a leap of faith. As we discussed our reasons for going into the beer business, we realized that each of us offers different perspective and unique experience but that we all want the same thing: make excellent beer, have a great space for people to come and enjoy a pint, be an exceptional place to work, and be a big part of our local community. These ideas are what we bring to the table (and taps) at First Magnitude. This is the reason why we’re here – we hope you’ll join us in our vision and passion for great beer and great community.

name: Altitude Chophouse & Brewery
description: Our brewery, which is nestled inside of our dining room walls, is primarily an ale producing brewery. Ninety five percent of all the beer we brew at Altitude is ale, including our award winning 7200’ Stout and Rosebud Strong Ale. Our beer is brewed using single step and multi-step infusion mashing, which is patterned off the British brewing tradition. All of our beer is made from four basic ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and water. Our recipes use American malts, hops from Europe and America, and yeast cultured from the traditional yeast stocks found throughout the world. We do not filter our beer. We brew over 20 styles of beer throughout the year. We offer eight beers on tap year round and we pour up to three specialty beers at any given time. We invite you to try Altitude’s microbrews and we hope you’ll like them as much as we do!

name: Elevation Beer Company
description: Elevation Beer Co. is an artisan microbrewery located in Poncha Springs, Colorado just outside Salida. Elevation Beer Company specializes in adventurous seasonal barrel-aged beers for the craft beer fanatic.

name: Nola Brewing Company
description: NOLA Brewing – New Orleans Lager & Ale – represents the creation of refreshing high-quality beer in the heart of New Orleans. Located in the Irish Channel, we provide locally produced products and are sensitive to the taste, look, and feel of great beer. Founded in 2008 by Kirk Coco & Peter Caddoo, NOLA Brewing is providing quality lagers and ales for you to enjoy. Check out our current selections and locations proudly serving our fine ales and go enjoy one!

name: Tallgrass Brewing Company
description: Tallgrass Brewing Company was founded by Jeff Gill in 2007 and now offers a full line of award-winning craft beers produced in a 60,000-square-foot facility located near the Flint Hills in Manhattan, Kansas. Through its Grain-to-Glass™ program, the brewery is dedicated to providing consistently remarkable beers by emphasizing quality in every aspect of production. As the largest brewery in Kansas and major regional brewery with distribution in 14 states, Tallgrass fearlessly explores, creates and shares new beers with fun, positive and exciting branding. For additional information, visit www.tallgrassbeer.com.

name: Mad Fox Brewing Company
description: Mad Fox Brewing Company offers a dining experience unique to the Washington, DC, area: upscale casual dining in an English-style gastro brewpub with an emphasis on high-quality food to complement our house-brewed beers. Mad Fox features a chef-driven, seasonal menu and frequent specials including pizza, panini, salads and vegetarian friendly foods; fresh, locally grown seasonal produce, cheeses and other ingredients; locally raised lamb, bison, beef, chicken and game; and house-cured meats. Mad Fox has a 63-foot long bar showcasing our seven to ten standard, house-brewed beers on tap as well as a rotating selection of seasonal brews in German, English, Belgian and American styles. Also, don’t miss our cask conditioned proper Real Ales served through water jacketed Angram beer engines, ensuring that every pint is served at properly conditioned cellar temperatures.

name: Barley Island Brewing Company
description: Barley Island’s national award winning handcrafted ales produced on-premise with only the finest malts and hops. Being independently owned and operated has its advantages. We can quickly implement new food trends or even beer flavors to suit our local clientele.

name: Morgantown Brewing Company
description: Morgantown's oldest and newest brewpub, located in the heart of downtown Morgantown West Virginia. This casual local pub offers a wide range of craft beers brewed on the premises, great food, a live music venue and full calendar of events. Meet friends for lunch or dinner, or have a beer and watch the big game on TV. A must visit for craft beer lovers.

name: Boulevard Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Boulevard Brewing Company, the Midwest's home for fine ales and lagers since 1989. Boulevard's mission is simple: to produce fresh, flavorful beers using the finest traditional ingredients and the best of both old and new brewing techniques.

name: Uinta Brewing Company
description: Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT. Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul. Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

name: Gillette Brewing Company
description: Gillette Wyoming's first and finest brewery in the heart of downtown. We have a relaxed atmosphere and the finest craft brewed beer around.

name: EPIC Brewing Company
description: EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO. In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.

name: Three Taverns Craft Brewery
description: Three Taverns delivers an open-minded American interpretation of traditional Belgian-style beers. Pushing the boundaries of flavor and style in search of new discovery, we are passionate to promote the culture of the table, where good beer and good people come together in gratitude and celebration, and magic happens.

name: La Cumbre Brewing Company
description: La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do. The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that. Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks. Well, this is the beer he drinks. And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.

name: Old Bust Head Brewing Co.
description: Locally brewed. Universally loved.

name: Hillcrest Brewing Company
description: The Hillcrest Brewing Company (HBC), The World’s First “Out and Proud LGBT Brewery " is set to open in June of 2012 in time to celebrate the 43rd anniversary of the Stonewall Inn Uprising. We specialize in handcrafted beer and stone oven pizzas with bottles, growlers & kegs to-go. The restaurant, managed by Joey Arruda, serves paired pizza that is perfectly orchestrated with a focus from the water and flour to create its crust, to the fresh Italian Roma tomatoes with fresh toppings and cheeses before it is fired in stone lined ovens. We are located at 1458 University Avenue, in the colorful and vibrant LGBT community of Hillcrest in San Diego. HBC features four initial microbrews with plans for up to twelve more to come. Pouring only grains and grapes- our 24 beers on tap and assorted selection of wines are paired with specialty pizzas, by our talented breweristas. The remainder of the taps pours “Guest” brews from other local micro breweries. Our tap-room, designed in-house features an open ceiling with sealed concrete floors and a 15 foot chandelier made with 97 sustainable 22oz beer bottles that will hang within a 23 foot copula. Additional clusters of hanging beer bottle chandeliers give life to a total Frankenstein set up, with much of the equipment home-made including a steam punk style bottling machine built from scratch by David White, Brewmaster/Artist/Mad-Scientist who lives, breathes and dreams beer. A 13 foot garage door opens to an L-Shaped outdoor patio with cushioned keg barrel seating and planters with local varietal hop bines (hop vines) that can grow up to 25+ feet along horizontal trellises.

name: Four Peaks Brewing Company
description: Beer: the Final Frontier...these are voyages of the Four Peaks Brewing Co., our ongoing mission: to create delicious new brews, to seek out new styles and new types of ingredients, to boldly brew what no one has brewed before...

name: Kokopelli Beer Company
description: Kokopelli Beer Company is a small brewpub located in the Solaire Shoppes at 8931 Harlan Street in Westminster Colorado, just across from the future Westminster Mall renovation. We enjoy brewing quality handcrafted ales and meeting new folks, so we decided to put them together. As a brew pub, we offer a small menu to compliment our ales with items such as pizzas, sandwiches, salads and more.

name: C.H. Evans Brewing Company
description: The Evans family was in the commercial brewing business for three generations. The original brewery was built in Hudson, NY in 1786. It continued production until prohibition in 1920. Its award winning ales were well known in the Northeast and were even exported to England and France. Production levels peaked in 1915 when 65,000 barrels of beer were produced at the Hudson Facility. The brewery bottled its own beer in Hudson at one of the country’s earliest bottling facilities (1889) and later at a plant in New York City. The family also malted much of their own grain in their malt houses at the Hudson facility. Neil Evans revives this rich heritage here at the Albany Pump Station. Surviving C.H. Evans Brewing Company memorabilia is displayed in the new facility, as well as pictures of the pump station as it appeared at the turn of the century.

name: Lift Bridge Brewing Co.
description: Welcome to Lift Bridge Beer Company. Our mission is simple: to create fine beers for you to enjoy! It is our pleasure to supply you with what you need to help you slow down and enjoy life. Whether that is a Farm Girl Saison®, Crosscut Pale Ale™, an American Pale Ale or any of our other seasonal specialties, we want to brew it our way! We hope that through every bottle and tap pull, you can taste: the history of our City, the pride and fun we have in its creation, the uncompromising natural ingredients and brewing process utilized, and ultimately our sincere hope that we have given an experience that makes you proud to be a beer drinker.

name: Georgetown Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Georgetown Brewing Company, a Seattle craft brewery and maker of Manny's Pale Ale. In May of 2017, after 14 years selling beer, we went from a draft-only production facility to canning select full-time beers (hey, we always said “never say never”). Sorry, still no brewpub, but we do have a retail shop where you can pick up kegs to go, growlers, cans and perhaps get a taste of our newest beer. Or you could be social and get out to your favorite local watering hole. The only thing that hasn’t changed, we’re still focused on one thing…brewing darn tasty beer.

name: Lovelady Brewing Company
description: Family owned brewery located in the heart of downtown Henderson, Nevada. Beers are a mix of traditional and new.

name: The Prodigal Son Brewery and Pub
name_short_display: The Prodigal Son Brewery and Pub
description: Pendleton, Oregon. A small agricultural town located at the foothills of the beautiful Blue Mountains. And now home to some of the best beers in the state. We’re passionate about fermentation and it shows in our brews. Whether it’s a dry-hopped Northwest IPA or a malt-heavy Porter, the Prodigal Son is dedicated to exploring the possibilities of grain, hops and yeast. Creativity is something we value in our Ales and it’s our goal to incorporate regional ingredients into beers that go beyond convention. Brewing to style is not our objective; we prefer to focus our explorations on the potential of beer. But we’re more than just brewing, we’ve got good food to boot. The Prodigal Son features a menu that combines traditional pub fare with scratch cooking. Here you will find regional ingredients incorporated into handcrafted cuisine. We have a bona fide chef with an artist’s muse- and his work is truly the product of inspiration. Our food is unique –you might even say it has character. We’re proud to be back home, here in Eastern Oregon. Come visit anytime, and stay as long as you like. We hope you will join us on our journey to beervana. Lucky for you, your efforts will be rewarded with good beer.

name: Independent Brewing Company
description: Brewing fine ales and lagers in Oakland, California's historic Jack London District.

name: A1A Ale Works
description: Handcrafted and brewed to excellence, A1A Ale Works goes to great lengths to serve each guest the freshest beer possible. This commitment to serving nothing but the finest and freshest beer has led to numerous awards.

name: Blackstone Brewing Company
description: Blackstone Restaurant & Brewery was established in 1994 and was the first brewpub in Nashville. In 2011 we expanded as Blackstone Brewing Company when we opened a brand new state of the art brewery in Nashville.

name: Aarhus Bryghus
description: Aarhus Brewery makes special beer for enjoyment! That is to say that art is not so advanced as to result in afskræmmende and can only be drunk by connoisseurs. Anyone who wants to try something new, you will find joy in Aarhus Brewery products. Aarhus Brewery makes special beer with between 5 and 9% alcohol, bottled in large 60 cl bottles. There will be a beer which will be suitable as an aperitif beer, which beer will be suitable for fish and meat dishes light, and there will be dark, heavy and bulky beers, which are suitable for meats and cheeses. It builds both fixed beers and varying seasonal beers. Read more in products. The brewery is purely a production brewery that produces beer and brave this in bottles and kegs. There is not affiliated catering to the brewery. On the other hand we do tours for small groups of between 15 and 75 people.

name: Brasserie Val de Sambre
description: Located in the heart of the Cistercian Abbey ruins Alder, the brewery produces and sells the famous beer of the Abbey of Alder, The Honey and White Charleroi. The brewery has a tavern where you can like the monks of old, enjoy a good beer of the Abbey of Alder (ADA).

name: Brasserie Lefebvre
description: The origins of the Lefebvre brewery, located at Quenast (in the Brabant region of Wallonia, the French speaking district of Belgium) in the valley of the Senne, goes back to 1876. In this year, Jules Lefebvre, gamekeeper, farmer, inn keeper and brewer, inaugurated his new brewery. Pubs were opened around the neighbouring porphyry quarries so that the numerous workmen, made thirsty by stone working, could come to refresh themselves. After six generations, there is still a youthful determination and family spirit present in the brewery. It is constantly expanding and mainly works on the export market which accounts for 80% of overall production.

name: Brasserie de Brunehaut
description: In 1890 the Allard family founded the Brunehaut brewery in Guignies, then called the St Joseph Brewery. It became known in the region for brewing beers like "La Druide" and "Brunehaut 8°". In 1991 the company took on a new challenge and moved into modern buildings while maintaining its traditional character and the quality of its products, qualified as "grand crus" by connoisseurs. An alliance of Modernity and Tradition! These are the company's motto, a real creed for the managers at Brunehaut Brewery. Tradition, because the traditional brewery retains the entirely natural brewing method for late fermentation beers and that are refermented in bottles and kegs. The result: a panel of about a dozen abbey or organic beers, all valuable and unique. To ensure that the link to the region remains strong, the types of barley used in the brewing process are grown in our own farm at Gaurain-Ramecroix. Modern, because modern and high performance machinery ensure scrupulous compliance with hygiene regulations and a top quality production with consistent flavour. Also modern in how we deal with the market: several beers from Brunehaut won prizes at international competitions and are currently present in 25 different countries. Marc-Antoine De Mees and his staff are still equally enthusiastic to allow the discovery of this knowledge and method.…

name: Brewery Vivant
description: Brewery Vivant is the realization of years of dreaming and much discussion of what a great brewery can be. What makes our brewery different from the rest is the way we approach our craft and operate our business. The core of Brewery Vivant can be found at the crossroads of three passions: 1. Our love of the tradition and artistic approach of the Belgian & French styles of beers 2. Devotion to using local sources for ingredients and running our business according to the three pillars of sustainability; Environmental Integrity, Social Equity, and Economic Viability 3. Sharing the experience of how beer and food can be paired to uplift the enjoyment of both

name: Abita Brewing Company
description: Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans. In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100-seat brew pub) and moved up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand. We brew over 160,000 barrels of beer and 10,000 barrels of root beer in our state-of-the-art brewing facility. Our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews. We are privately owned and operated by local shareholders, many who have been with us since day one. Abita uses only the finest ingredients – British and North American malted barley, German and American yeast strains, Pacific Northwest hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs. In Abita Springs, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way. Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes.

name: Brewery Ommegang
description: In October of 1997, not far from the birthplace of baseball, ground was broken for what was to become America's most unique craft brewery. Based on traditional Belgian farmhouse architecture and set on a former hop farm in upstate New York, Brewery Ommegang was born with the philosophy that truly unique ales must be built from the ground up. Now brewing six award-winning Belgian-style ales, an imaginative range of seasonal and limited edition ales, and offering daily tours and tastings, plus a full calendar of special events, Brewery Ommegang is the place where brewing is an art and partaking is a passion.

name: Brouwerij Corsendonk
description: Corsendonk is a brand of beers produced under the license by Brasserie Du Bocq. Its name is a reference to a monastery in Oud-Turnhout. In 1982 Jef Keersmaekers, descendant of Antonius Keersmaekers (the founder of the original brewery in 1906), was given a chance to revive the brand, and a new series of beers was launched.

name: Blackberry Farm Brewery
description: Tucked away on Blackberry Farm's 4200 acre estate in the foothills of the Great Smoky Mountains, Blackberry Farm Brewery produces classic Old World - style beers - each one artisan-crafted and bottle-conditioned.

name: Union Brewing Company
description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

name: Odin Brewing Company
description: Odin Brewing embraces the exploratory spirit of the ancient Vikings. We set sail in December 2009, during the height of a global economic storm, and have quickly become one of the fastest growing breweries in Washington, with our beer is now sacking and pillaging cities throughout Washington and British Columbia. We have taken a different tack than many new brewers, and rather than going for a number of very big, single batch beers, we are focused on food-friendly beers in a smaller lineup that is readily available year round. We realized a long time ago that food-friendly by no means needs to be less flavorful, and we actually add ingredients to widen the palate of our beers above and beyond their original styles. To better integrate with a meal and make our beers more ‘sessionable’ in general, we utilize highly attenuating yeasts to dry out our beers to make them less sweet and filling, then replace that desired sweetness with an addition outside the norm, such as Juniper, Ginger or even Angelica. These ingredients are always kept at a level to avoid building a ‘spice beer’, and always present themselves as a unique and complementary addition. We also focus on extremely clean finishes, and use the entire recipe to build bittering rather than just using the hops to reduce lingering starchiness. In the end, the true beauty of any flavor is in the eye (and mouth) of the beholder. Read about our beers here, then taste them at your local restaurant or store and judge for yourself if we have truly crafted ‘Great Beer Designed With Great Food In Mind’. We believe we have.

name: Sprecher Brewing Company
description: Established in 1985, Sprecher is Milwaukee's Original Microbrewery. We brew over 20 different beers as well as 8 gourmet sodas, including our world famous Sprecher Root Beer.

name: DESTIHL Brewery
description: DESTIHL was founded on the promise of supporting flavor and boycotting bland. We're an independent, production brewery that was established in 2013 in Bloomington-Normal, Illinois to brew beyond the confines of typical beers. Our team combines centuries-old global brewing traditions and new American craft brewing ingenuity & artisanship to produce a wide array of beers for every palate. We brew more styles of beer because we have a passion for brewing and because you have a passion for unique, craft beers. The result is a diverse offering of intensely flavorful beers that are anything but bland, from our award-winning WiLD SOUR Series, barrel-aged Saint Dekkera® Reserve Sour Ales and Dosvidanya® Russian Imperial Stout, to our many Belgian-style beers, IPA's, other wood-aged beers, classic styles and exciting seasonals. DESTIHL has become a brand, but we have not strayed from our roots. We take pride in our values and will continue to grow and support our local community. We promise to deliver on these uncompromising beliefs.

name: King Harbor Brewing Company
description: We brew classic styles with a California coastal twist by sourcing unique ingredients to emphasize flavor profiles and the drinking experience - hoppy pale ales that use subtle fruit additions to brighten hop character, an American style brown ale blended with a cold press coffee, and a Saison brewed with locally sourced lemon verbena and lemon peel. And when we are not brewing we can usually be found on the beach, at Dodgers or Kings game, or shooting birdies on the links. For us, an awesome beer is part of an awesome experience.

name: North Coast Brewing Company
description: A pioneer in the craft beer movement, opened in 1988 as a local brewpub in the historic town of Fort Bragg, located on California’s Mendocino Coast. Under the leadership of brew master Mark Ruedrich, the brewery has developed a strong reputation for quality having won more than 70 awards in national and international competitions. In addition to Red Seal Ale, Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout, Scrimshaw Pilsner, and other fine North Coast brands, the brewery has resurrected the old Acme label with a heritage dating back to the San Francisco of the 1860’s. These exceptional beers are available in 47 states now and also are exported to Europe and the Pacific Rim.

name: Oast House Brewery
description: A small Micro-Brewery based just outside the coastal town of Aberystwyth in Mid Wales, producing cask conditioned and bottled real ale for Aberystwyth, the surrounding area and occasionally further afield. We are currently Cuckoo Brewing while we save up funds to buy our own kit, but we are looking forward to doing that in the near future. Oast House Brewery takes its name from the old maltings based in Trefechan. We liked the idea of resurrecting a little of Aberystwyth’s ale past, and so we named ourselves after them. The Old Oast House which can still be found in the harbour was used for drying and roasting barley in order to create malt. We use malt in our ale to give our ale both flavour and sugar. You get to taste the flavour in our ale, but the yeast eats most of the sugars and turns them in to alcohol. We did look into basing our brewery in the Oast House but unfortunately it is not for sale.

name: Burley Oak Craft Brewery
description: Hi there! We have been hard at work building this brewery keeping in mind sustainable practices and using local materials and craftsmen. We love our town of Berlin, Maryland and hope you join us in our taproom for a couple of pints and growlers. Our goal is to produce distinctive beers whose quaility is unsurpassed using new and traditional brewing methods. Why "Burley Oak?" The inspiration for our name Burley Oak Brewing Company was derived from the name of the town, our traditional brewing methods and the history of our brewhouse. Berlin, Maryland in Wikipedia The town of Berlin had its start around the 1790s, part of the Burley Plantation, a 300-acre (1.2 km2) land grant dating back to 1677. The name Berlin is believed to be derived from a contraction of "Burleigh Inn", a tavern located at the crossroads of the Philadelphia Post Road (now South Main Street) and Sinepuxent Road (Tripoli Street). It just so happens, that our building was originally a Cooperage - making oak barrels to fill with local produce and seafood to ship off to Baltimore in the early 1900's. And we are bringing barrels back to the building, aiding us in the aging of our hand-crafted ales.

name: Brouwerij St. Bernardus
description: Also know as Sint Bernardus and St. Bernardus Brewery

name: Border X Brewing
description: We created Border X Brewing as a vehicle to explore new flavors in craft beer. With over 85 breweries in San Diego in January of 2013, we knew that we wanted to add our own unique contribution to the beer scene. Having been raised on both sides of the border, we always enjoyed eating from both cultures. Mexican Street Tacos, chile enfused candies, enchiladas one day, and Hamburgers, mac and cheese and ding dongs the next. As adults we realized how unique being raised on the border was, how the mix of flavors was seeping from north to south, and south to north. It was this fusion in flavors that inspired to take traditional, European brewing traditions and infuse the process with a whole new palette of Latin American ingredients. So we dug into our own roots for inspiration and found a treasure trove of brewing traditions, ingredients and unique flavors. Our best example of this is our Blood Saison, an agave and Hibiscus infused Saison that come off sweet initially, middle tartness and finishing like a beer.

name: Bayou Teche Brewing
description: Bayou Teche Brewing was founded on this simple dream – to craft beers that compliment the cuisine and lifestyle of Cajuns and Creoles.

name: Las Cazuelas Mexican Grill and Brewery
Gravity Brewing
description: Louisville Colorado's Original Craft Brewery. Producing high quality hand crafted ales with purpose. Down To Earth Beer, Food & People.

name: California Cider Company
description: The California Cider Company is owned by Geoffrey House, the man credited with initiating the national cider renaissance. Utilizing his insider's view of the cider industry, he took more than two years to develop the Ace Cider. House, owner of the second largest specialty beer and cider marketing company in the US, began importing ciders into the US in 1986. Since then he has seen explosive sales growth, as hard cider has moved beyond specialty beer and liquor stores and established itself on the supermarket shelves as a new drink category. With Sonoma's superior apple juice giving Ace Ciders their great fresh taste and House's expertise and in-depth knowledge of the hard cider business providing a marketing edge, CCC is beginning to take a dominant position in this increasingly significant new beverage market. As with all alcoholic beverages, we urge you to please drink responsibly.

name: Walter's Beer
description: For 100 years, Walter’s Beer was as much a family tradition as it was a refreshing malt beverage. The Walters family toiled through fires, Prohibition and fierce competition to deliver the classic recipe that gave generations of beer enthusiasts a reason to relax at the end of the day. Your time has come to experience this bold, historic brew.

name: Wingman Brewers
description: Inspired by Tacoma's legacy of honest hard work, Wingman Brewers strives to create a strong selection of spirited, full-flavored beers for the South Sound region.

name: Achel Brewery
description: Achel brewery or Brouwerij der Sint-Benedictusabdij de Achelse Kluis is a Belgian Trappist brewery, and the smallest of the seven currently approved Trappist breweries. It is located in the Abbey of Saint Benedict in the Belgian municipality of Achel. It brews five trappist beers

name: Lone Tree Brewing Company
description: A craft brewery and tasting room: Small and family friendly, with an emphasis on sampling small-batch brews and sharing the experience with fellow beer lovers.

name: Howard Brewing Company
description: Howard Brewing Company is a brand new craft brewery opening in Lenoir, North Carolina at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. We will be opening in a great old building downtown on West Avenue alongside the Carolina Distillery and a new pub-style restaurant. We are working on some great ideas at the building including rain water recapture, solar power, and renovating the building so the dining experience literally overlooks the brewery and distillery operations. We are excited to bring our beer to you as soon as we can and are acquiring our brewhouse and swinging the hammers as you read this...

name: Free State Brewing Company
description: “Because without beer, things do not seem to go as well.” In 1989, Free State Brewing Company became the first legal brewery in Kansas in over 100 years. Since opening the doors at our Mass Street HQ, we’ve been working day in and day out to be a haven for beer lovers, where good beer and good food can inspire lively conversations and memorable experiences. Our 14-barrel brewhouse is made up of some of the best equipment available to the small brewer, but we still think the most important ingredients are the care and respect that our enthusiastic, knowledgeable staff has for each and every beer that we make. And now that we’re producing bottled beers in our expanded bottling facility, our attention to detail and dedication to great taste and quality can be experienced by people all over Kansas and Missouri.

name: Great Sex Brewing
description: Great Sex Brewing (GSB) began as an idea in the early 1990's when Doug Talbot and some friends attempted to purchase an old historic building near Vail, Colorado for micro-brewing purposes. Doug's intent was to use the name as it appears now. After a number of twists, turns, bumps and grinds Jeff Talbot became involved and GSB was eventually incorporated in California at the turn of the century. Our main office is in Redding, CA, so you might say Redding is "The Home of Great Sex!"

name: Eagle Creek Brewing Company
description: Opened in August 2013 Eagle Creek Brewing Co is Statesboro GA's first craft brewery. Located in the heart of South Georgia we focus on producing delicious, interesting and highly drinkable beers using the very best ingredients available. Stop by our taproom or find our beers at good beer bars and bottle shops all around Georgia.

name: Buckbean Brewing Company
description: Buckbean Brewing Company — the first package brewery in Western Nevada and the second of three in the Silver State — began operations in a new 7,600-square-foot facility in Reno, NV in April 2008. Buckbean Brewing Company debuted with two styles of beer in 16 oz. cans, which has now grown to three, but also offers different styles on tap. The brewery houses a tasting room and offers guided tours free of charge. Buckbean Brewing Company is the vision of Reno native Douglas S. Booth and Veteran brewmaster Daniel B. Kahn. These two self described “beer junkies” joined up in 2004 to create a new kind of microbrew appealing to both male and female beer drinkers.

name: Bad Tom Smith Brewing
description: On June 28, 1895, after confessing to the murder of six people, “Bad Tom” Smith uttered his final words before meeting a hangman’s noose in Breathitt County, Ky.: “Bad women and bad whiskey have brought me where I am. I give you this warning: Don’t drink bad whiskey and don’t do as I have done.” While he doesn’t think highly of his great-great uncle, Sean Smith, Bad Tom co-owner, has turned his relative’s evil deeds into a namesake for a local brewery. “My penance is to make good beer for all the bad whiskey he drank,” Smith quips. After talking and sharing his great-great uncle’s story with Charles Boucher, co-owner and master brewer, they decided to change the name to Bad Tom Smith Brewing. Boucher’s beer list includes the flagship Bad Tom Smith, a reddish brown ale. Other favorites are Brother Clement, a white Belgian ale brewed with more than a 100 pounds of clementines, and Old Abe American Ale, an American-style ale based on English beers with a dark amber color.

name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

name: Adnams Brewery
description: Adnams is one of England's oldest and most respected breweries, but despite its rich heritage and enduring fame, Adnams is not a company willing to rest on its laurels. Its continued commitment to quality and innovative packaging designs has made it Britain's fastest growing brewery over the last two years. To top it off, Adnams' head brewer was recently chosen as Britain's Brewer of the Year by a panel of his peers. The aggressive team at Adnams is raring to go and keen to make a mark in the U.S.

name: Surf Brewery
description: Located less than five miles from Surfer’s Point, Ventura’s Surf BreweryTM. The only craft microbrewery kegging and bottling their own beer in Ventura County. Tasting room and HomeBrew supplies as well.

name: Bluebonnet Beer Company
description: Small craft brewery in Round Rock, TX owned and operated by a husband and wife team focused on brewing high-quality classic beer styles with a Texas twist.

name: Broken Bottle Brewery
description: Broken Bottle Brewery is what we like to refer to as a "nanobrewery", which basically means that it is smaller than a microbrewery, but bigger than Donavan's garage (and more awesome)! We have a small brewing area in the back and a taproom up front (also known as the Lair of Deliciousness). Our goal is to create the small neighborhood bar feeling that Albuquerque is lacking. Most importantly, we concentrate on producing small craft batches of the unique recipes that we have developed over the years.

name: Mac & Jacks Brewing Company
description: Mac & Jack’s Brewing Company proudly dedicates itself to preserving a clean environment as a responsible resident in Redmond and to the community at large. From re-using water to providing spent grain to local farmers, all byproducts created here during the brewing process are recycled responsibly. This makes for happy neighbors as well as happy cows!

name: Triple Digit Brewing Company
description: Triple Digit is the high gravity brand of Cincinnati's Listermann Brewing Company. Every Triple Digit beer is brewed at or above a triple digit gravity (1.100). Welcome to the Next Level

name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company
description: Slanted Rock Brewing Company, LLC was founded in Meridian, Idaho on June 2011 by Bob Lonseth, Alesa Lonseth and Vincent Melchor. These partners and additional investment from John E. MacCrisken financed the start-up of this venture. ​Slanted Rock started operations in Fall 2012 with a 15 BBL Brewhouse, 2-15BBL Fermenters, 1- 30BBL Fermenter, 1-15BBL Brite Tank and 1-30BBL Brite Tank. Capacity and capability has expanded by adding additional 60 BBLs of fermentation capacity and our very own canning line. Our distributing partner is CSB (Craig Stein Beverage). Retail Customers can buy kegs and pick-up direct from the brewery. Individuals can also purchase kegs in the following sizes: ½ BBL, 1/6 BBL. Slanted Rock is committed to brewing a wide variety of craft beers using only the finest ingredients available. We are a small company built on dreams and hard work. Hope to see you out there with a Slanted Rock brew in hand!

name: Hood Canal Brewery
description: Hood Canal Brewery opened its doors in September 1996 in an 800 sq. Ft. pole building at the home of Don Wyatt, owner and brewer, just north of Poulsbo, Washington. Don had five years experience in home-brewing and worked at the Thomas Kemper Brewery before its closing. When Kemper's closed its doors, he decided to follow his passion and strike out on his own. Distribution of Hood Canal Beers started in Kitsap County. He later expanded his sales to the Seattle area via Odom Distributing Corporation, and now he personally distributes to bars, pubs, and grocery stores in Kitsap and surrounding counties. Our Tasting Room is on Bond Road between Kingston and Poulsbo. It's about the ten minute drive from the Kingston ferry terminal or from Poulsbo.

name: Ironworks Brewery and Pub
description: Established in 1989, we are Denver's second oldest brewery. A locals dive bar feel, with a full kitchen, pool, darts, pinball and our back hop garden patio.

name: Save the World Brewing Co.
description: Artisanal Belgian style ales making you feel good on so many levels. After years of perfecting our recipes and with the use of only the best grains, hops and yeast, we feel our beers are raising the bar to the next level for the craft brewery movement. Grab a bottle of one our beers and decide for yourself, knowing that you're helping to Save The World one beer at a time! We offer beer brewing classes and tasting parties by appointment only,

name: Arrowhead Ales Brewing Company
description: Craft Beer and Awesome Food

name: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain
description: Schlossbrauerei Maxlrain is first mentioned in 1636. It was a “brown beer” brewery as was customary in those times. While a great deal has changed in the meantime, essential features have survived. Thus, Maxlrain is and remains a local private brewery under independent management. The fifteen styles of beer classified under pale ale, dark ale, Pils or wheat beer are all brewed applying manual skills utilizing finest ingredients enhanced by our own source of spring water drawn from the Mangfall Valley.

name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
description: Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves. We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

name: Lucid Brewing
description: In July 2010, over a craft beer at a local restaurant, Eric Biermann and Jon Messier had a Lucid thought – “Let’s throw away the ties and the corporate ladders. Let’s start a craft beer brewery!” That Clarity in Thinking, led to the successful launch of Lucid Brewing. In June of 2011, with a year of planning already completed, they realized jumping headfirst into the brewery was the only way they could make their dream a reality. They quit their day jobs. With that leap of faith – and a ton of support from many friends and family – they started building their brewery from the ground up. Through the sweltering heat of the 2011 summer, many friends labored side by side with Jon and Eric. They did it all, start to finish, from digging trenches to assembling the last tank. So of course they needed a refreshing and light drink to quench their thirst while they toiled away. They found just the right recipe and brewed their first beer – AIR. A beer made to get the job done. Its slight citrus aroma and flavor, lower ABV and crisp dry finish made this their favorite “go to” beer. By October the brewery was complete and cooking. And in the spirit of the season, Eric and Jon gave thanks to the Brew gods when they made their first deliveries to their first three customers the week of Thanksgiving… in Jon’s car. Lucid was on its way! Always keeping an eye on the demand for high quality while quickly catching the craft beer lover’s attention, Lucid assembled a team of dedicated employees and introduced brews to quench their customers’ demands. AIR, DYNO, FOTO and DUO, along with seasonal and small-batch brews, are quickly becoming Minnesota favorites at local bars and restaurants. Great success has followed them after throwing away the daily grind for the daily brew.

name: Airdale Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2008, Airdale Brewing is a craft beer company located in San Diego, California. Founded by a former Naval Aviator and a veteran southern California craft brewer, Airdale strives to create well-balanced, unique, flavorful beers that embody their mantra of, "Work Hard | Play Hard" Airdale Brewing Co. is working to bring its line of premium craft beers to every market available. We intent to do this by producing quality beers that stand on their own as true examples of artisan american ales.

name: Aspen Brewing Company
description: spen’s beer history dates back to 1885 and the original Aspen Brewery which was located only a few hundred yards from the new Aspen Brewery. Founded by Christian Sanders, the Aspen Brewery operated successfully in Aspen until being purchased by P.H. Zang Company of Denver in 1902. We believe that they produced one beer, presumable a Lager, to quench the thirst of Aspen’s mining population. In 1990, Flying Dog brew-pub was opened by George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre in the Cooper Street pedestrian mall. Locals and visitors flocked to the brew pub for the beer, food and bohemian atmosphere. Flying Dog operated in downtown Aspen for three years until moving to Denver.

name: Half Acre Beer Company
description: Half Acre Beer Co. is a brewing company in the Northcenter neighborhood of Chicago, IL. We built a brewery in the middle of the city where we brew small batch beers, and have a store & tasting area where we sample our beers and sell them to go in all package styles. We make different beers throughout the year, some we brew all the time and some are only around for a very short period. Our focus is to expand our abilities and enjoy our work.

name: Alaskan Brewing Co.
description: Alaska has a rich history of brewing. From the explorers of the 1700s through the Gold Rush, many a thirsty Alaskan has been able to enjoy locally made beers. In 1986, 28-year-olds Marcy and Geoff Larson reignited that tradition when they opened the Alaskan Brewing Company, the 67th brewery in the country and the first brewery in Juneau since Prohibition. Alaskan beers reflect many of the same characteristics of beers that were brewed here during the gold rush era. From the historically based Alaskan Amber recipe to alder-smoked malts and Sitka spruce tips, Alaskan beers reflect Juneau's local brewing history and innovation. Marcy and Geoff were drawn to the beauty and adventure of Alaska, but finding a livelihood that would allow them to stay was a challenge. "Why not start a brewery?" a friend suggested. Other than the extreme financial and logistical challenges of brewing beer in the Last Frontier, they couldn't think of why not. Maybe the idea wasn't so far-fetched. After all, Geoff was a chemical engineer and a homebrewer and was married to Marcy, an adventure-seeking accountant and aspiring bush pilot. Together they brought a unique skill set to the task of opening a brewery in Alaska. While researching brewing in Alaska, Marcy unearthed shipping records from Douglas City Brewing Co. (1899-1907) that listed ingredients for its popular beers and a newspaper article that described the way it was brewed. Geoff homebrewed a batch of the Gold Rush-era brew and they could see what made it so popular. That beer is now known as Alaskan Amber. In December 1986, Alaskan Brewing Co. officially began operations when Geoff, Marcy and 10 volunteers spent 12 hours hand packaging the first 253 cases of Alaskan Amber for distribution in Juneau, Alaska. From that very humble beginning, Alaskan Brewing Co. has grown to become the most award-winning craft brewery in the history of the Great American Beer Festival and expanded distribution to 14 states.

name: Wild Rose Brewery
description: Wild Rose Brewery, located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is a craft brewery that produces bottled beers and draught ales available to beer lovers in pubs, restaurants and liquor outlets all across Alberta. All Wild Rose beers are unpasteurized and preservative-free. That's not because we are lazy; rather, it's a conscious choice to offer beer lovers the best products available in Canada. That quality is reflected in our six bottled beers and our draught-only classic ales.

name: Strangeways Brewing
description: Strangeways Brewing is a one-of-a-kind, 8,400 square-foot production brewery that is open to the public daily. It houses multiple tasting room spaces along with outdoor seating, and always has 25+ unique beers on tap.  RateBeer named Strangeways “Best Brewery Tap Room in Virginia” in 2014/2015. Outfitted with a 20 barrel brewhouse, this is where we unhinge the status quo, break through the boring, and invite the unknown. Make Strangeways Brewing one of your adventure destinations for regular tastings, tours, event/private party bookings, and whatever strange events we come up with.

name: 2nd Shift Brewing Co
description: We are a micro that will be making beer that is big on flavor and aroma, the way beer should be. There will be several styles and a continuing line of seasonal and special beers that will be produced throughout the year.

name: Grand Teton Brewing Company
description: Grand Teton Brewing Company is the original brewery of Grand Teton and Yellowstone National Parks. We have been brewing our handcrafted beers at the base of the Tetons since 1988.

name: Tap It Brewing Co
description: Here at Tap It Brewing Company, located in SLO Town, USA in the heart of the Central Coast, we’re true to our roots and true to our word. We like to take a laid-back approach to almost everything we do. But there’s one thing we’re absolutely serious about – our beer.

name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too! Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

name: Von Freude
description: When we found that something had been lost to industrialised Beer we started making our own Craft Beer. This is when we founded the von Freude Microbrewery . von Freude stands for the Making of Modern Craft Beers with the techniques of endurable Craftsmanship.

name: Ale-Mania
description: Fritz3Flavors, rather than a - Beer can be more than required by the Reinheitsgebot and enjoyment is not linked to Community, insurance or even special offers. For a long time the beverage beer in German lands was drunk critical, but now it's time for more flavor and more conscious enjoyment. The not-not so new impetus to the beery diversity finally reached now the curious German beer drinkers. In fact Craft Beer was born in the early 1980s in the United States and is nothing more than a return to flavor beer diversity and creative crafts. This is exactly what Fritz Wülfing: New to create copy instead of familiar things. How many brewers of craft beer scene he brews with passion many different and especially innovative beers. There are not only IPAs and Stoutvariationen, but also completely new creations such as Goshen and other beers with historical background. All in one: different and delicious!

name: Strange Land Brewery
description: Our story is not unlike many a beer journeyman before us—we’re intoxicated with the mystery of fermentation, the possibilities of taste, and chasing after unexplored horizons. Our goal is simply to make beer —

name: Cervejaria Alenda Bier
description: Located in the small town of Morro Reuter, in southern Brazil, was founded by a couple of German origin on January 30, 2010, the Alenda Weisse brewery specializes in the production of wheat beers according to traditional methods used in breweries in Bavaria including the process of decoction and fermentation in open tanks (Dekoktionsverfahren Gärung und im offener Bottich). It is still employed Hefeweizen former manufacturing method, where the re-fermentation occurs naturally within the bottle. It is considered the smallest microbrewery installed in Brazil, with a production capacity of 1,000 liters / month and is the only specialized in the production of wheat beers. Their owners spend the weekends to production, there is a weekend in each month is reserved for reception of visitors, but due to the size of the facility and the process of fermentation in open tanks is very delicate, the groups do not exceed 4 people . Visitations should be scheduled in advance by e-mail: contato@alendabier.com.br. All equipment was designed by the owners and is inspired by the small German family breweries dedicated to the production of wheat Weissbier type beers. For not being pasteurized, trade of beers is performed only in Rio Grande do Sul.

name: Athenian Brewery
description: Athenian Brewery SA is one of the leading companies producing and marketing beer in Greece . Founded in 1963 by a group of Greek entrepreneurs and a member of the Group Heineken NV Works based in Athens . The first factory was Athenian Brewery in Athens in 1965 and produced beer Amstel. In 1975 was inaugurated the second factory in Thessaloniki and in 1985 purchased the third , in the industrial area Patras . From the 1993 operates in Lamia the bottling plant of Natural Mineral Water Iole . Today , we produce and pack them in some of Greece 's most famous beer : Amstel, Amstel Premium Pils, Amstel Bock, Heineken, ALFA , Fischer, Buckler, BIOS 5. At the same time , we import beers Amstel Light, McFarland, Erdinger, SOL, Murphy's, Duvel, Chimay, Kirin, Moretti, Desperados, Krusovice and others. The 25 products we produce and distribute , available in 11 countries , with the help of an extensive network of distribution and sales . We continue to strategically plan our growth , seeking the strength of our products in existing markets and our expansion into new .

name: Adkin Brewery
description: The Adkin Brewery was originally founded as a hobby in early 2000. It is a true example of a small cottage brewery, and is run by the sole proprietor, Mr Shaun Cunningham, from the garage attached to his house on a housing estate in Wantage, Oxfordshire. All of Shaun's beers are produced using only natural ingredients, most of which are supplied by Best Mates Brewery, Ardington and Ken Thomas of Arkwright's Homebrew in Highworth, near Swindon, Wiltshire www.arkwrightshomebrew.com. At the moment, Shaun still has a full-time job. Despite the restrictions placed upon Shaun in terms of both time and space, you can see from the photographs just how much can be achieved in a small, basic garage. As for the quality of the products, well, that speaks for itself!

name: Third Place Brewing
description: Nano Brewery producing handcrafted beers in Wichita, Kansas.

name: Circle Brewing Company
description: At Circle, all of our brews embody the concept of purity through simplicity of design. You won’t find chemicals, stabilizing or clarifying agents, cheap additives or adjuncts, or even gimmicky fruits or spices in any of our brews. At Circle, we embrace the German Purity standards of 1516 and continually brew better beer with that in mind. To us, the circle is a symbol of perfection in its most basic form. We share that perfection with you in every pint of Circle.

name: Sierra Blanca Brewing Company
description: Located in Moriarty, New Mexico and also known as Rio Grande Brewing Company. We currently brew during the year 10-12 of our own Brews. We now have a full 1/2 acre Beer Garden complete with horseshoes, bocci ball a couple of grills and plenty of seating. Rich Weber is the brewmaster. With a total of 11 people including office staff we anticipate brewing about 9100 barrels this year. Our Brewery is open 6 days a week and always ready to offer up a cold pint or give a tour of our Brewery. Come on by and see what may be brewing or being bottled. We also do contract brewing for Abbey Beverage, Premier Beverage (Isotopes Amber and Blonde), and Rodeo Cold Brewing. Always a good time here at Sierra Blanca Brewing Company!!

name: Shannon Brewing Company
description: At Shannon Brewing, we are passionate about great beer—all natural, beautiful, wholesome, easy-drinking beer! Shannon Brewing Company’s great beer comes from a profound commitment to our “old-world” brewing process, the best natural ingredients available and a VERY patient aging process.

name: Lakewood Brewing Company
description: From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers, perfect for whichever neighborhood you call home. Pay us a visit in our taproom and beer garden. Brewery tours are offered on the weekends and free to the public. Schol!

name: Founders Brewing Company
description: Founders Brewing Company, founded by Mike Stevens and Dave Engbers produced its first beer in November of 1997. Built out of a dream and a passion for home brewing, what started out as a hobby quickly became a thriving business. As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer. Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer. As the years have passed, Founders has built its brewery on the exploration of recipe development and brewing techniques. We are not the standard micro-brewery, rather we have traveled a path that breaks from the standard craft-brewer. Carving a niche out of the craft industry, Founders Brewing Company has built its reputation on producing very unique beers. Our focus is to offer our wholesalers, retailers and consumers a product that stands alone on the shelf and offers a true drinking experience to our friends, the consumer.

name: Hell's Basement Brewery
description: Our brewery's name was inspired by the stories of Rudyard Kipling’s travels across Canada and his famous quote “This part of the country seems to have all hell for a basement, and the only trap door appears to be in Medicine Hat. And you don’t even think of changing the name of your town. It’s all your own and the only hat of its kind on earth.” – Rudyard Kipling 1907 ​ Six courageous beer lovers from Medicine Hat along with their families, friends, and countless members of the community worked tirelessly for six months to bring quality, craft beer to Medicine Hat. ​ We take pride in our community, and we've worked with a variety of local businesses, tradespeople and artists to make our dream a reality. We're excited to let you know that we're now open for business. We can't wait for you to come in and taste what we've created (if you're over 18 of course).

name: Full Pint Brewing Company
description: Full Pint Brewing Company is a collaborative brewery featuring some of the Pittsburgh area’s finest brewers and beer nerds.

name: Bull & Bones Brewhaus & Grill
description: Bull & Bones is a brewpub with both an upscale dining room and a separate sports bar with a casual dining area. Currently offering 7 craft beers brewed on site in our 10 barrel brewhaus. We have a wood-fired grill, on-site smoker, an ice rail integrated into our granite bar, 20 HDTV's, and 7 championship pool tables!

name: College Street Brewhouse & Pub
description: Just a quick drive to the north side of town, you'll find yourself at Havasu's hippest new brewhouse and pub. Here we focus on creating one-of-a-kind handcrafted beers. Revelers will appreciate sipping a smooth, flavorful craft brew while enjoying our rustic cuisine. Our casual atmosphere, outdoor dining, large bar and views of Lake Havasu are sure to become your favorite place to come and unwind.

name: Snake River Brewing
description: America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment. Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal

name: Four Mile Brewing Company
description: Four Mile Brewing was born from a desire to create a high quality, premium, local beer - a product that the people of the area would be proud to call their own. So, why the name Four Mile Brewing? The Four Mile Valley and its natural resources are what embody every aspect of the Greater Olean Area; its natural resources are what drive our industries and it is deeply rooted in farming and agriculture. The surrounding mountain ridges provide endless recreational opportunities and draw tourists from all over the region for their beauty and sense of adventure. Its views have inspired countless students at St. Bonaventure University and are part of the tradition at that school.

name: Pennsylvania Brewing Company
description: Penn Brewery has been producing high-end craft beers since 1986. Penn’s flagship lineup features authentic German-style beers brewed in the tradition of Pittsburgh’s German immigrants, according to the strict quality standards of Reinheitsgebot. More recently, our lineup has been expanded to include other varieties including APAs, IPAs, fruit beers, and more. The common thread that binds all of Penn’s beers together, however, is exceptional quality and craftsmanship. We produce all of our brews in the classic, old-world way, without taking any shortcuts. We use copper kettles for optimal heat control. We employ double-decoction grain mashing to release fuller flavor in our lagers. And we lager all of our beers in horizontal tanks for a cleaner, crisper finish. Penn Brewery is housed in the mid-nineteenth century landmark E&O Brewery building and is one of only a handful of working breweries with original beer caves still on premise. And with our commitment to brewing the old-world way, we like to say that here at Penn Brewery, the tradition of our lagering caves lives on.

name: Panther Island Brewing
description: Panther Island Brewing is located on the banks of the Trinity River in Fort Worth, TX. The brewery began in a small warehouse with a band of friends brewing beer, playing rock and roll and chasing dreams. The band of brewers spent three years crafting batch after batch of beer, and fine tuning their recipes. Hard work, persistence, and passion for brewing spawned a crazy journey that included getting funding to build a full scale brewery in a building that has housed some of Fort Worth’s oldest breweries. Although the journey has been wild, it is only beginning. We are proud to be part of Fort Worth’s craft brewing scene, and are excited for the opportunity to pursue our dreams.

name: Bastrop Brewhouse
description: Bastrop's First Brewpub!

name: Lost Coast Brewery
description: Founded in 1989 by Barbara Groom, the Lost Coast Brewery is one of the only female-owned and operated breweries in the U.S. Lost Coast is famous for its delicious and award-winning beers: Great White, Downtown Brown, Indica IPA & Tangerine Wheat!

name: Tin Man Brewing Company
description: Tin Man Brewing Co. was assembled in 2012, an alloy of production brewery and restaurant. Committed to sustaining a habitable environment for all living and mechanical being, we utilize innovative processes to minimize waste and maximize taste. Forging new ground, we were one of the first small craft breweries in the United States to use a mash filter.

name: Almanac Beer Co
description: Our artisanal ales are brewed in collaboration with select Northern California sustainable farms. Each limited release is a unique beer to be enjoyed with friends and savored around the seasonal table.

name: Tractor Brewing Company
description: Tractor Brewing Co. produces world class beers. Come see the brewery. Helping New Mexicans Get Plowed with Great Beer Since 1999.

name: Lassen Ale Works
description: Northeast California's only brewpub-- Lassen Ale Works-- Located in uptown Susanville, CA at the historic Pioneer Saloon. 21 and over only, ID required. On-site brewery. Six house beers on draft, plus seasonal specialties and guest taps. Full bar offers good selection of wine by the glass and craft cocktails, single malt scotch and premium liquors. Fine pub fare is prepared in house, from scratch. House specialties include beer battered fish with hand cut chips, lamb dip and fresh salads. Weekend lunch and dinner specials. Pool tables.

name: Alpine Beer Company
description: Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations. The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.

name: Brasserie Almaza S.A.L.
description: The Brasserie Almaza S.A.L. was founded in the Baouchriye sector of Beirut in 1933 by Lebanese shareholders as the Brasserie Franco-Libano-Syrienne; the name stems from the fact that France administered Lebanon (then the Lebanese Republic) at that time, but still administered under the French Mandate of Syria. Lebanon saw many conflicts throughout its existence, and throughout the bombardments, Almaza still kept brewing its beer, changing its name to the Brasserie Almaza S.A.L. in the 1990's. In 1995, Almaza beer became the only beer brewed in Lebanon (no longer true, ever since the 961 Brewery opened in Beirut in 2006). In 2002, the Heineken group purchased a significant portion of the brewery, which means I'm not sure if the beer I purchased was actually brewed in Lebanon. In addition to the Almaza pilsner, their flagship, they began brewing Rex strong ale (8% ABV) in 2004 and Almaza Pure Malt (6% ABV) in 2007; they originally began experimenting with additional styles in the 1990's. Since Lebanon has a large Muslim population, it also brews Laziza (a non-alcoholic malt beverage it acquired in 2003) and Almaza 0% Alcohol.

name: Aloha Beer Company
description: Aloha Beer Company embodies the classic Hawaii lifestyle. With the generous spirit of Aloha as a namesake, this is a premium beer that combines the smooth balance of ohana with the refreshing, hang-loose attitude of a Sunday barbecue. Every bottle of "Hawaii's Beer" is a heartfelt "wish you were here" message from the Islands of Aloha. We can't create a Hawaiian sunrise, but we can brew the next best thing.

name: Loomis Basin Brewing Co
description: Serving Handcrafted Premium Ales

name: Wild Wolf Brewing Co
description: Located in Nelson County, Wild Wolf Brewing Co is an award winning brewery and farm to fork restaurant situated on 10 acres featuring gorgeous mountain views, a Biergarten with waterfalls, and a hop yard where chickens and ducks do the weeding/fertilizing. Enjoy corn hole, big screen TVs and live music. Dog/kid friendly.

name: Mill House Brewing Company
description: The Mill House Brewing Company opened as a brewpub in November 2013, in the Historic Mill House that has, for many years, been a watering hole and restaurant for the citizens of Poughkeepsie and the surrounding areas. The rehabilitated 1820’s brick house is now home to a 7 Barrel single-infusion system, built by Portland Kettle Works, along side a restaurant that seats over 250+ guests. Mill House Brewing Company has long focused on creating Local Craft Beers, with World Class Flavor. At MHBC, where art & science meet, it’s important to understand our humble beginnings. Jamie Bishop and Lawrence Stock, are Two best friends brewing better beer. From the Days in the basement of Jamie’s Hudson Valley home, to brewing over 600 barrels in the first year at MHBC, the two have continually focused on creating beers that are not only seasonally varied, but have classic integrity. An American Brewers Guild graduate in 2014, Mill House Brewing Company continually strives to create better beer, with in-house lab testing, water recipes, and house yeast strain cultivation. They are true masters of their craft, brewing 25 uniquely different beers to date, with many more on the way! Mill House Brewing Company has enjoyed much success since 2013. The Brewpub was awarded Top 100 Hot Spots in American from OpenTable dining, Hudson Valley Magazine Best New Restaurant and Bar Menu, Hudson River Craft Brew Fest “People’s Choice” in 2013/2014, as well as countless other accolades. With the brewer owners, restaurateur partner Daniel Crocco, and boutique development firm RL Baxter Building, the team looks to spread their wings even more in 2015. With a 20bbl brewhouse on the horizon this year, Mill House Brewing Company is dedicated to bringing Local Craft, and World Class Flavor to the world. Prost!

name: Seminar Brewing
description: Seminar Brewing, LLC is a small, dedicated group of craft beer brewers in Florence, South Carolina. Our brewers include Bryan Fisher, John Mattheis, and Travis Knowles. Our business manager and founding partner is Dave Peters.

name: Laughing Dog Brewing
description: At Laughing Dog Brewing, what began with a dream for brews with more hops has turned into an insatiable desire to craft beers of all flavors, with a focus on quality, purity, and fun. Today, Laughing Dog brews has brewed over 15 distinct beers, including seasonals like our Huckleberry Ale and Winter Ale, and our award-winning IPA's and Stouts. But despite our success and growth, our motto remains the same as the day we started, to create... "Fetchingly Good Beer"!

name: Abbey Wright Brewing Company
description: The Valley Inn & Abbey Wright Brewing Co. have a superb selection of our own hand-crafted beers. We also have 22 beers on tap, and a huge selection of bottled beer from around the world.

name: Three Floyds Brewing Company
description: Three Floyds Brewing Company LLC was founded in 1996 by brothers Nick and Simon with their father Mike Floyd. The original brewery was built by Nick and Simon in a run down warehouse located in Hammond, Indiana. The first beers brewed by the brothers were designed to be a departure from the fairly bleak craft brewing scene in the region. Nick and Simon brewed intense balanced beers that were and still remain “not normal” by conventional standards. In November of 2005, after receiving numerous visitors to the brewery over the years, Three Floyds opened its own brewpub at the production facility. What was once office space is now a refuge for the craft beer enthusiast. With all the Three Floyds mainstays, seasonal offerings, special small batch beers and many guest beers it is a mecca for craft beer. The pub also has a full service kitchen providing pub fare of the best quality supported by a 3000 square foot organic herb and vegetable garden.

name: Alphabet City Brewing Company
description: Established in 2012 and proud to be one of the few New York City breweries. NYC has had a rich brewing history that reaches back over 100 years. This has given ACBC a strong foundation on which to build and offers a challenge we enthusiastically embrace everyday. We started as two roommates in the Alphabet City neighborhood of the East Village of NYC brewing beer in our kitchen and are excited to be on the verge of opening a brew pub there in the near future. We love beer and love sharing our beers with friends and that's what our style of brewing is all about. It's about camaraderie and the group experience. We provide brews for the table that everyone can gather around; brews perfect for the meal you're about to have or the story about to be shared - brews for celebrations and brews for collaboration - we brew for you.

name: Resolute Brewing Company
description: Resolute is a neighborhood brewery and taproom focusing on local community. Friends, family, pets, and beer lovers are all encouraged to come hang out!

name: Tommyknocker Brewery
description: For over 20 years, we've used pure Rocky Mountain snow melt, the finest malted barley and high quality hops to passionately craft award winning ales and lagers. With over 100 medals to our name, one sip of a time-proven classic or an innovative new recipe and you too will become part of the loyal and expanding TKB following. Nestled in the cozy historic mountain mining town of Idaho Springs, Colorado, we're just 30 miles west of Denver and 20 miles east of Summit Co. That makes us the perfect destination to sit by the fireplace for a wintertime warm up or cool down in the summer with a refreshing brew and award winning pub fare.

name: Guanella Pass Brewery
description: “At the foot of the Guanella Pass Scenic Byway located in downtown historic Georgetown, Colorado, Guanella Pass Brewing Company is a real mountain brewery that believes where you drink beer is just as important as what beer you drink.”

name: Plank Town Brewing Company
description: A microbrewery & restaurant located in the heart of historic downtown Springfield on the corner of 4th and Main in the Odd Fellows Building.

name: Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu
description: The company was founded in 1877 by Johann Gottfried Glauner by the lion was still brewing firmierende company bought as, and thus reactivated the former monastery brewery. 1880 was the company over to Carl Albert Glauner. 1906 was renamed to Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu. The company was and is consistently in the family Glauner. The Executive Board comprises the Managing Director and Carl Markus Schlör Glauner and three new officers. The Alpirsbacher Klosterbräu Glauner GmbH & Co.KG produces and sells beer. In addition, the company acquires and manages investments in industrial and commercial enterprises. The company, with special Alpirsbacher quality leader in Baden-Wuerttemberg export beer market. It employs 80 staff and has annual turnover of 20 million € (2007). Seat and the only production site is Alpirsbach. A special feature of the brewery is a special pipeline , which spatially separate the brewery bottling combines.

name: Kinslahger Brewing Company
description: Lager focused distributing brewery.

name: Clockwerks Brewing
description: A downtown Minneapolis, MN brewery focusing on carefully crafted, well balanced session-style beers in a steampunk-inspired setting. Think flavorful, drinkable, well-balanced styles that make you want to take another sip, and then another.

name: Überbrew
description: Überbrew: Superlative Beer Combining atmosphere, music, food, service and award winning beer to provide the customer with the best tap room experience.

name: Hops & Grain Brewery
description: Hops and Grain is a local Austin brewery that produces hand-crafted ales and handmade dog treats. We are very passionate about our craft and strive to create sustainability in everything that we do

name: Natchez Brewing Company
description: Natchez Brewing Company is located at 207 High Street, in historic downtown Natchez, Mississippi. Natchez is known as the oldest established city on the Mississippi River, and the hub of the steamboat era. We are proud of our city, proud of our mighty river, and proud to be brewing the first "Natchez" beer that will be for distribution. Natchez has the Old South Winery, Charboneau Rum distillery, and now has a brewery with i's namesake. Our brews help share the story of the south. Our story begins long before our own time, with the men who dreamed before us. We were built from flatboats and keelboats paddled onto muddy sandbars... Raised with planters of cane, cotton, corn, family and tradition... Grown along the banks of a steamboat highway on the Mighty Mississippi. Our heritage is passed on from years of tall tales, Huck's river adventures, sandbar fights and campfire stories. Our beer is crafted with a passion for local flavor and a love for tradition... Made with a true southern drawl and the hospitality of the deep south. Southern Inspired, Southern Brewed

name: Brauerei Ayinger
description: The Ayinger Brewery (pronounced "eye-ing-gr"; German: Brauerei Aying) is a medium-sized German brewery located in Aying, Bavaria, about 25 km from Munich. Approximately 10% of Ayinger beers are exported, mainly to Italy, the United States, and the rest of Europe. Ayinger beers have been frequent award winners in international beer competitions. For some years, a range of beer was brewed under the Ayingerbrau name by Samuel Smith's Brewery in Tadcaster, United Kingdom. Although the Ayinger logo was used, the recipes and range were different from those of the Ayinger Brewery. The arrangement ended in spring 2006, at which point Samuel Smith's rebranded the beers. Distribution of the Ayinger range of beer followed that summer. Because the Oktoberfest in Munich does not allow breweries outside its city limits to participate, Ayinger Brewery organizes many smaller festivals in the countryside around Munich.

name: Joseph James Brewing Co. Inc.
