description: Revolution Brewing is Chicago's new hometown craft brewery. Our brewpub in Logan Square is a bustling, neighborhood institution where friends and families meet to enjoy the freshest beer in town. Opening our brewery has been a labor of love. We think you can see that in everything we do ranging from the details of our carved fists holding up our mahogany bar to the pungent hop aroma of our Anti-Hero IPA to our creative dishes like our bacon-fat popcorn. The growth of craft breweries in the U.S. has been nothing short of a revolution and we're proud to be standing tall in this new crowd. The changing tastes of beer drinkers demand bigger flavors and more variety. That's exactly what we give you at Revolution Brewing. Our brewpub produces about 50 different beer styles each year. We've got session beers like Workingman Mild, hop-bombs like Double Fist and more bourbon barrel aged beers than you can shake a stave at. We have fun doing what we do and invite you to come in and join us.

name: Cobra Brewing Company
description: We know how satisfying it is to enjoy a nice hand crafted beer, that is why at Cobra Brewing Company we brew with only top quality ingredients. All of our crafted beer is brewed locally in Flower Mound, TX.

name: Blue Hills Brewery
description: Beer is our life! Blue Hills Brewery makes great tasting beers inspired by the elements and nature around us; embracing the rich history of the Blue Hills and the South Shore. We do this not only for ourselves but, for our friends, neighbors and visitors to the Boston and South Shore areas. We want to grow together with the South Shore community and businesses, by being a good neighbor, demonstrating civic responsibility and producing the finest, freshest beers around. Our brew house has a capacity of brewing 20 barrels at a time, that's about 620 gallons per batch. The beer spends the first 7-9 days in a primary fermenting vessel after which it is transferred to a secondary fermenter. There it is chilled to around 40 degrees for another 7-10 days. At this time it is ready to be filtered carbonated and kegged.

name: Raw Brewing Company
description: Raw Brewing Company was created from a passion for real ale and an idea that became reality. After several years of enjoying real ale David decided to have a go himself as a hobby to see if he could produce quality real ale. After several months it was clear that the product was good with the assistance from an army of tasters! It was time then to turn this passion and idea into reality Raw Brewing Company was born.

name: Saddlebock Brewery
description: Welcome to Saddlebock Brewery - the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas. Since 2012, we've been brewing fine, European-style beers in an environmentally friendly facility. Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.

name: Three Creeks Brewing
description: Where we utilize only the finest ingredients available for all of our food and brewing activities, while striving to impress even the most sensitive of palates, Our menu of excellent yet casual and unpretentious pub food is served in a family-friendly, smoke-free environment that all patrons will enjoy. Our old west livery stable provides a comfortable, warm and rustic atmosphere that includes a full restaurant, 10 barrel brewing system, comfortable bar area complete with large screen TV’s and pool tables as well as a large patio for the enjoyment of our hand crafted ales.

name: AleSmith Brewing Company
description: Forged in 1995, AleSmith is an artisan microbrewery that specializes in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. Deeply rooted in the amateur and craft brewing communities, AleSmith ales have continued to garner national and international awards and acclaim, as well as a loyal and rabid following among beer enthusiasts.

name: Rifle Brewing Company
description: All of our microbrews are brewed on premise with the highest quality of craftmanship. We offer four core brews year round. Our brewer is constantly switching up our selection so make sure to come in often for his newest creation. You'll leave happy every time - guaranteed.

name: Top Shelf Brewery
description: Top Shelf Brewery, located in Manchester, Connecticut, is a nanobrewery who takes pride in brewing the freshest and most flavorful beer for local consumption. The brewery has a local bar feel with ample seating, a bring-your-own-food policy, and the service of pints, flights, and tulips, along with growler fills. Our taproom is open on Wednesdays and Thursdays 4pm to 8pm, Fridays and Saturdays noon to 9pm, and Sundays noon to 5pm.

name: Blue Star Brewing Company
description: Owned and operated by Joey and Maggie Villarreal of Joey's on N. St. Mary's Street, the BSBC has been open since June 25, 1996. We offer medal-winning beers, an exceptional wine list, and delicious food. The brew pub is located in the Blue Star Arts Complex at 1414 S. Alamo, on the San Antonio river across the street from the Pioneer flour mill. The stainless steel vats and brewing facility are right at home in what was once an old beer storage warehouse. Friendly staff and warm wood decor make for a comfortable, casual atmosphere.

name: Moody Tongue Brewing Company
description: Moody Tongue Brewery opened in 2014 under the direction of acclaimed brewmaster Jared Rouben. Moody Tongue, a nickname for a guest with a discerning palate, features “culinary brewing,” Rouben’s original approach that combines the worlds of brewing and cooking through the application of a chef's mindset to the brewing process. Classically trained at the Culinary Institute of America in New York, Rouben worked in lauded Michelin-starred kitchens such as the Martini House in Napa, CA, and Thomas Keller’s Per Se in New York City before moving to Chicago to pursue a career in brewing. During the fall of 2016, Moody Tongue introduced a tasting room to its brewery in the Pilsen neighborhood of Chicago, serving year-round and limited-release beers in an intimate mid-century modern atmosphere with Michelin-minded service. The Tasting Room is open Thursday from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.; Friday from 5 p.m. to 12 a.m.; Saturday from 12 p.m. to 12 a.m.; Sunday from 12 p.m. to 9 p.m.; and Monday from 5 p.m. to 10 p.m. The Tasting Room is closed Tuesday and Wednesday.

name: High Water Brewing
description: Leveraging his successful 15 year brewing career, Brewmaster Steve Altimari is proud to enter his fifth year at the helm of High Water Brewing. "High Water" being a playful interpretation of Steve's last name. A loose Italian translation of "Alta" meaning High and "Mare" meaning Seas or Water led us to the High Water name. Inspired by the most creative brewing practices and styles across the world, Steve's love of beer and unbridled passion for all things flavorful have led to a line of products that represent the very best of the best. Steve's vision of creating unique and flavorful beers and getting them into a glass have taken fruition. High Water Brewing is partnered with Hermitage Brewing in San Jose to allow growth of our production capacity to meet our growing customer demand. High Water Brewing is now licensed as a small beer manufacturer at the E.J.Phair Pittsburg brewery. We have installed 2 of our 30 bbl fermenters and are producing a new line of draft beers. These are one off recipes and released as the High Water Tributary Series. High Water Beers are now distributed in Northern, Central and Southern California, Reno, Las Vegas, Seattle, New York, Vermont, Florida, Japan, Taipei, Brazil, Denmark, Sweden, Rome, London and Amsterdam. Keep an eye out for High Water products at a craft beer location near you!

name: Hartford Better Beer Co.
description: Is a contract brewery operation at present. Leveraged off of the previous operation of Connecticut's first brewpub, The Hartford Brewery Ltd. Some of the recipes from the previous operation are showcased in our current portfolio. Others are new recipes created by our former brewing team. Our beers are currently being brewed at Shipyard Brewery in Portland Maine, using our explicit recipe design and oversight. Our mission is to continually improve sales of our brands to facilitate the growth of additional brands and with a future in mind that may lead to a new brewery in the region to support our brand lines.

name: Core Brewing & Distilling Co.
description: Every great community needs a local flavor and Core Brewing & Distilling Company is out to be Arkansas’ hometown beer. Our brews are big and innovative rooted in tradition. We brew with passion and pride. From grain to glass, we brew beer for this great community to love and share.

name: ShawneeCraft Brewing Company
description: True to nature, true to the craft It's the motto of ShawneeCraft, a summary of our philosophy, and the ideal to which we aspire. We call it the fidelis philosophy. We’re true to nature because environmental impact is a consideration in every decision we make. We honor the nature of materials that we work with. No shortcuts, no artifice. We’re true to the craft because we honor traditions of workmanship perfected by centuries of well-trained hands. The Fidelis Philosophy took root in the fertile soil of Shawnee-On-Delaware, Pennsylvania. Our village, bounded by wooded hills on one side and the Delaware River on the other, enjoys a mild and varied climate, plenty of water and sun, abundant plants and wildlife and friendly, talented people. We are captivated by this nature and its possibilities. And our location- less than 100 miles from both New York City and Philadelphia- makes it only natural for us to broadly share the Fidelis Philosophy. In a world of mass-production, our products are handmade. In a world of homogeneity, our products represent a defiant individuality. In a world without roots, our products embody a tangible sense of place. We aspire to eat what we grow, to drink what we brew, and to build what we use. And we’d like you to experience a taste of this lifestyle yourself- in the form of ShawneeCraft beer.

name: McHale's Brewhouse
description: McHale's Brewhouse is a Scotch-Irish Pub with an attached nanobrewery. We have amazing food. We make our own beer batter from our Dixie Blonde. We have 5-8 rotating house beers on tap at all times.

name: Thomas Creek Brewery
description: Since the beginning of the brewery in 1998, Tom Davis has been winning the hearts and taste buds of people all over the Southeast. His goal is to make the finest hand crafted beer, and please every beer lover that tries a Thomas Creek brew.

name: Smoky Mountain Brewery
description: We are a natural gathering place for any televised sporting event or just a great meal. Inside you'll find one of the largest working micro breweries in the state of TN. And don't forget the live entertainment nightly.

name: Nantahala Brewing Company
description: Nantahala Brewing Company is a microbrewery that was founded in Bryson City, Western North Carolina’s outdoor adventure capital, in the spring of 2009. We officially started selling beer in May 2010. If you are in the area, stop by and check out our progress.

name: Lexington Avenue Brewery
description: Good times await in Asheville at the Lexington Avenue Brewery. Relax a while on our open air patio. Enjoy a craft beer and an incredible meal at the 92’ curving bar or a custom built dining table. Our historic downtown Asheville building provides the perfect atmosphere. The front stage regularly entertains LAB guests during dinner hours.

name: Acoustic Draft Mead
description: BzZz Loves You

name: Angry Orchard
description: Once upon a time cider was the drink of choice. We've been making ciders for decades... now we want to share them with you. Branch out and experience our Angry Orchard.

name: Wasatch Brewery
description: Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee,America’s beer capital, only todiscover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

name: Pyramid Breweries
description: Based in the Pacific Northwest, Pyramid Breweries began as Hart Brewing in 1984 and launched the flagship brand of Pyramid Ales. In 1996, the company was reborn as Pyramid Breweries and currently offers craft beers produced under the Pyramid family of ales and lagers. With breweries in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Berkeley, CA, Pyramid also owns Alehouses at all three locations and an additional Alehouse in Walnut Creek, CA.

name: Twelve String Brewing Company
description: Located in Spokane Valley, WA, 12 String Brewing Company marries the brewer’s love of music, especially the 12 string guitar, with his passion for brewing spectacular beer. Our goal is to craft a variety of great beer in the Northwest tradition. We will also feature several other beers from our brewing friends. Yes, 12 string brewing company crafts great beer in the Northwest tradition. This is an example of a small scale brewing company at its best! The brewery includes an onsite tap room with plenty of seating and from time to time, great live music. And when not brewing one of his great beers, you just may just find the brewer hanging out, playing his 12 string guitar.

name: Adventure Brewing Company
description: Adventure Brewing Company makes great craft beer in the Stafford and Fredericksburg, Virginia area.

name: Basket Case Brewing Company
description: Basket Case Brewing Company is a nanobrewery in Jasper, IN. We are located in The Mill House Restaurant where we make and sell our beer.

name: Dry Dock Brewing Company
description: Dry Dock Brewing Co. is a speakeasy that hasn’t stopped growing. The brewery was Aurora, Colorado’s first when owners Kevin DeLange and Michelle Reding opened with a 7 BBL brewhouse in a 900-square-foot space next their original business The Brew Hut, a homebrew supply shop, in 2005. They named the brewery as a nod to Kevin’s love of nautical history. Dry Dock expanded in 2009, and again in 2011. Now the brewery runs a 7 BBL brewhouse including a tasting room with 180 seats and 16 taps at its original location at 15120 E. Hampden Avenue which is called South Dock. In 2013, Dry Dock nearly quadrupled its production numbers, jumping from 3,200 barrels in 2012 to 12,000 barrels in one year. This increase came with the purchase of a 30,000-square-foot production facility, North Dock, at 2801 Tower Road. At North Dock, Dry Dock has the capacity to expand to brew more than 30,000 barrels a year, and cans its flagship line of beers, including the Amber Ale, Hop Abomination, Hefeweizen, and Apricot Blonde. In September of 2014, Dry Dock opened the Canoe Room, a four-tap tasting room inside of its North Dock facility. The tasting room, which in addition to draft beer, serves Dry Dock’s canned offerings. The room was once the storage area for The Boy Scouts of America Aurora chapter’s canoes and the area gained the nickname “Canoe Room,” which stuck. Dry Dock established itself early on by word-of-mouth, and put itself on the map when it won a gold 2006 World Beer Cup (only 6 months after the tiny brewery opened) for its HMS Victory ESB (now Dry Dock’s Amber Ale). Dry Dock has since been the recipient of 20 GABF® medals, the prestigious Brewers Association’s Small Brewery of the Year award, and five World Beer Cup® awards.

name: Funkwerks
description: In 2007 Gordon Schuck’s recipe design and brewing skills resulted in a gold medal-winning Saison at the National Homebrew Competition. Brad Lincoln first experienced craft beer while working as an accountant in Portland, OR. The two met during the winter of 2009 while attending the Siebel Institute and studying brewing science. After being immersed in beer for the better part of five months, the two graduated and shared a desire to open a brewery. This resulted in the Saison-focused brewery that is now Funkwerks, opening December 9, 2010. Saisons originated as Belgian farmhouse ales- brewed during winter months for the farm workers during the summer months. Usually having a dry profile and complex fruity aromas, Saisons today are brewed year-round and generally have a higher alcohol percentage than their original versions. Funkwerks’ two flagship beers, Saison and Tropic King, are produced year round. Also brewed annually are four seasonals, a number of small experimental batches, and select barrel-aged releases. Funkwerks flagship Saison was awarded a gold medal at the 2012 Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and a silver medal in 2011. Deceit, a Belgian-Style golden strong ale, was also awarded a gold medal at the GABF in 2012. In addition to receiving two gold medals in 2012, the GABF named Funkwerks the 2012 Small Brewing Company of the Year. Funkwerks is located at 1900 East Lincoln Avenue in Fort Collins, Colorado. The tasting room- complete with an indoor bar, retail area and spacious outdoor, dog-friendly patio- is open 7 days a week: Sunday through Thursday from 12pm-8pm; Friday and Saturday from 12pm-9pm. Brewery tours are given Saturdays at 2pm. Funkwerks is currently distributed in: Colorado: C.R. Goodman Iowa: Johnson Brothers Arizona: Hensley Beverage Company Texas Dallas/Fort Worth: Andrews Distributing Houston/Austin: Flood Distributing

name: Ass Clown Brewing Company
description: We are imaginative brewers specializing in small batches, Making handcrafted an understatement. Our ales lack filtration and utilize low carbonation to maximize flavor.

name: Avery Brewing Company
description: Since 1993 our brewery has been committed to producing eccentric ales and lagers that defy styles or categories. Our products are thoroughly American at heart: blending Old World tradition and expertise with ingenuity, creativity and boldness.

name: Ithaca Beer Company
description: Ithaca Beer Co.,established in 1998, has a mission to brew delicious beers for the purpose of making life more enjoyable. We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers. Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process! From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile. Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.

name: Yankee Tank Brewing Company
description: We brew delicious beer in Lawrence, Kansas. You can find us at many bars and restaurants in the area and always at Henry Ts in Lawrence and Topeka.

name: Fitger's Brewhouse
description: Fitger's Brewhouse is located in the ancient Fitger's Brewery, in Duluth. We serve our own award winning hand-crafted ales and lagers brewed on premise by Fitger's Brewhouse Master Brewers. North Shore style ales and lagers, brewed with fresh Lake Superior water. Fitger’s Brewhouse opened in 1995, after its founders took a western-states ski trip and came back inspired by that region’s brewing scene. Combining the relaxed ambience of a high-mountain brewery with uncompromising dedication to quality, Fitger’s Brewhouse established a tradition of handcrafted beer, fantastic food and excellent entertainment on Lake Superior’s North Shore. In 2012 Fitger's Brewhouse won a bronze at the Great American Beer Festival for their Fitger’s Framboise. In 2013 they have received multiple honors including “Best Reason to Save the Growler” by the Minneapolis Star Tribune, “Best of the Lake” by Lake Superior Magazine, and “Best Brew” by Duluth Superior Magazine. This year Fitger's Brewhouse will produce more than 80 styles and nearly 3000 barrels of handcrafted beer. Our stage hosts eclectic local and touring entertainers six nights a week.

name: Snowshoe Brewing Company
description: Snowshoe Brewing Co. was founded in early 1995, with a mission to brew great beer and create a diverse menu of good food. Our brewpub & restaurant was opened in Arnold, Calaveras County, in the former location of The Meadowmont Inn, overlooking the golf course. Our brewers have created award-winning ales that have ale lovers throughout Central California and the Sierras asking for a Snowshoe at their favorite pubs and restaurants. The staff at our restaurant wants to ensure that your meal is enjoyable… served with our Snowshoe hospitality! The beer is bottled in Calaveras and brewed using a 15-barrel brewhouse, three 15-barrel fermenters and three 30-barrel fermenters. Our specialty beers include India Pale Ale, Westridge Winter Ale, Cutthroat Strong Ale, Oktoberfest, Irish Red, Porter, Midnight Moon Oatmeal Stout.

name: Alley Kat Brewing Company
description: Alley Kat Brewing Company is a craft brewery that's mission is to produce oustandingly flavourful, fresh tasting beer of exceptional quality. Longest running microbrewery in Edmonton and the fourth oldest brewery in Alberta.

name: Quaff On! Brewing Company
description: Quaff: To drink heartily and with gusto! At Quaff ON! Brewing Company, 'Gusto' is part of everything we do. Our hand-crafted beers reflect our passion for the brewer's art and our commitment to creating beers that excite and delight the quaffer's palette. Quaff ON! Brewing Company was formed in 2012 in response to the demand for the iconic craft beers we developed at Big Woods Brewing Company, our brewpub located in the heart of Brown County Indiana. Why 'Quaff ON!'? Because from the day Big Woods threw open its doors in 2009, Quaff ON! has been the rallying cry, the toast, and the salutation of our loyal fans. When Big Woods founders Jeff McCabe, Tim O'Bryan and Ed Ryan decided to create Quaff ON! Brewing Company, they had one Master Brewer in mind to take Busted Knuckle Ale, Hare Trigger IPA, Six Foot Blonde and Timid Virgin Pale to new heights and a larger market. That Brewer is Mark Havens, whose reputation as a talented and committed 'creator of craft beers' is well known. Mark came on board in time to lend a hand in the conversion of our 60 year old bowling alley into the Quaff ON! brewing facility. Once Mark got the new brewery up and running and our original Big Woods recipes were in production, Mark began introducing new beers, including Yellow Dwarf Wheat, a hopped up wheat that begs to be quaffed and Sadie the Goat Brown Ale, a hearty homage to the substantial beers quaffed by river pirates 2 centuries ago. Currently Quaff ON!'s beers are distributed all over Indiana. Look for us at your favorite watering hole and in the craft beer section at package stores throughout the state. If Quaff ON! is not served at your favorite place, send us a note and we'll get it in there! If you're travelling our way, stop in and see us in Brown County and visit us in Nashville at Big Woods Village where you can enjoy fine craft beer, great food and the best in local entertainment. "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." - William Shakespeare

name: Midnight Sun Brewing Company
description: Since firing up its brew kettle in 1995, Midnight Sun Brewing Company has become a serious yet creative force on the American brewing front. From concept to glass, Midnight Sun relies on an "art marries science" approach, mixing tradition with innovation, to design and craft bold, distinctive beers for Alaska...and beyond. We at Midnight Sun find inspiration in the untamed spirit and rugged beauty of the Last Frontier and develop unique beers with equally appealing names and labels. But the company’s true focus remains in its dedication to producing consistently high-quality beers that provide exciting flavor and satisfying refreshment in all seasons. From our extreme Pacific Northwest locale, we offer our wonderful beers on draft and in 22-ounce bottles throughout Alaska. Some of these beers are also distributed in Washington, Idaho, Oregon and California. We invite you to visit our hardworking brewery and retail Loft in South Anchorage every chance you get!

name: Big Storm Brewing Co.
description: Big Storm Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 by longtime friends Clay Yarn and Mike Bishop. Using their backgrounds in different areas of business to fuel their passion for beer, they built Big Storm from the ground up together. Now proudly serving the Tampa Bay area with good craft beer, Big Storm Brewing Co brings new meaning to the phrase "hand crafted".

name: Sinistral Brewing Company
description: 7 BBL Brewery in Manassas, Virginia

name: Second Salem Brewing Company
description: We are a one-barrel nanobrewery located in Whitewater, Wisconsin. Our name comes from Whitewater's historic nickname. From around the turn of the century to the 1930s, locals referred to the town as "Second Salem" due to its reputation as a site of witches' gatherings at the Witchtower (the Starin Park water tower), strange murders, unearthly creatures in the lake, and other unexplained phenomena. South central Wisconsin is also the stomping grounds of the Beast of Bray Road, a werewolf-type creature that was sighted on numerous occasions in the early 1990s, and the Wild Man of La Grange, a strange character apprehended by local authorities in 1929. We are not sensationalizing these strange events, figures, and architecture. They are a part of our collective past: one that makes our town unique, and one that provides a rich variety of stories to translate into beer.

name: Lake Louie Brewing
description: Lake Louie Brewing started out as a mid-life crisis for owner Tom Porter. He had spent 20+ years in the Engineering field and was looking to make a change in careers and a change in outlook. Having been homebrewing for a couple of years, Tom wrote a ‘cartoon’ of a business plan that stated that a 3 barrel brewery could make a profit (in the first year, no less!). Armed with said business plan and a cashed in 401k, Tom and his wife DeAnn proceeded to convert a metal storage shed on their property into a nascent brewery. Lake Louie Brewing is located on 18.5 acres of land purchased from Tom’s uncle Louie Carpenter (hence the name ‘Lake Louie’) near the small town of Arena, Wisconsin (population: not too many, traffic lights: zero). Lake Louie was the skinny dipping pond for area youth (including Tom in his day). At the end of one full year’s brewing, Lake Louie has produced the astounding sum of 106 barrels of beer. 2001 year end totals: 276 barrels. A 258% increase in one year (lookout Bud!).

name: Perennial Artisan Ales
description: Our philosophy is to brew beer with the adventurous craft beer drinker in mind—focusing on hand-crafted, small batches of beer, using local, seasonal and organic ingredients as much as possible. Our beers are influenced mostly by Belgian and American craft styles, but the addition of premium ingredients such as fruits, spices or wild yeast strains sometimes causes the beers to defy traditional categories. Our barrel aging program features a wide variety of beers aged in wine and spirits barrels, ranging from a Rye barrel-aged Mexican Chocolate Stout to a wild yeast-fermented Saison aged on Missouri wine grapes in French oak wine barrels. We strive to always achieve balance with each of our recipes, making our beers exceptional with food.

name: Burning Sky
description: Brewers & Blenders of Artisan Beer

name: THAT Brewery & Pub
description: THAT Brewery, just off the Arizona Trail in Pine, AZ is a place for people who like beer! We like beer – like to drink it, brew it, tip it and sing songs about it. Opened June 2012. THAT Brewery craft brews are available in many of your local pubs. Come up to Pine to see it all in action - great craft brews (THAT Brewery concoctions and other locally brewed guest craft beers), food, wine, volleyball, horseshoes and good times in the great Northern Arizona cool air. It’s a beautiful drive along the Mogollon Rim with an awesome destination - great craft beer from the source! By the way, we're good people too - actively a part of many charity groups in the area including: Friends of Tonto Natural Bridge, Mountain Village Foundation, Pine Strawberry Business Community, Pine Strawberry Fuels Reduction, AZ Trails Association, RiffRaff Club and the Justice McNeeley Foundation (childrens medical needs charity). We reach out and do all that we can in order to help these and many more groups in the area with fundraising, donations, organizing events and are always happy to give our time! Cheers!

name: Anthem Brewing Company
description: Anthem Brewing Company strives to create World Class beers that blur the line between the Old World and the New. Our beers are our anthem to the world.

name: Ska Brewing Company
description: Characters Brewing Beer With Character Since 1995

name: Deschutes Brewery
description: Founded in 1988, Deschutes Brewery began as a brew pub in downtown Bend, Oregon and is known for such brands as Black Butte Porter, the nation’s number one selling craft porter, and the popular Mirror Pond Pale Ale. In addition to its original Bend pub, this family and employee-owned brewery opened a second pub in Portland’s Pearl District in 2008. The company’s main brewing facility is located on the banks of the Deschutes River and is the nation's 7th largest craft brewery, distributing in 28 states, Washington D.C., and two Canadian provinces. Deschutes Brewery was named one of America’s Best Places to Work in 2013 & 2014 by Outside Magazine.

name: Stone Brewing
description: Founded by Greg Koch and Steve Wagner, Stone Brewing has come a long way since opening up in San Diego, California in 1996. We have been listed on the Inc 500 | 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies list 12 times, and has been called the "All-time Top Brewery on Planet Earth" by BeerAdvocate magazine twice. Stone Brewing is the ninth-largest craft brewer in the U.S. and with our breweries in Richmond, Virginia & Berlin, Germany, we join artisanal brewers across the world in the quest to show the public that there are more...and better...choices beyond the world of industrial beer.

name: Blackjack Brewing Company
description: HAND CRAFTED BEER OF THE FINEST QUALITY Blackjack is a local craft brewery focused on making excellent small batch beers and serving them in a relaxed, communal environment. It was started by Ed Wenda, a Raleigh native and former dentist, who one day realized he enjoys brewing beer more than drilling on teeth. Ed also brought in Brooks Hamaker to brew beer. Brooks has 29 years brewing experience, starting with more than a decade of being the head brewer at Abita Brewing Co. Brooks has also brewed for Fullsteam and Big Boss breweries. Also behind the scenes is Tim Sullivan, formerly of Big Boss Brewing. Tim is Mr. “Fix It” who does everything from cellar work at the brewery to fixing our old skeeball machine.

name: Heathen Brewing
description: Heathen Brewing is a small craft brewery that was created from the soul of home brewing. The realization that we as a people want to break the corporate strong hold on the beer industry and get back to using local ingredients in small craft batch brewing has demanded the formation of Heathen Brewing. At Heathen Brewing we make small batches of "Progressive Ales for the Promiscuous Palate". It all ...See More

name: Conquest Brewing Company
description: The first production brewery in Columbia, SC established after prohibition.

name: 2SP Brewing Company
description: True to Style: that’s Delaware County and that’s us. The 2SP Brewing Company’s mission is to bring world-class beers from world-class brewers to this region. Disclaimer: drinking our beer won’t enhance beard growth or make you a rebel and unique. We know as well as you, when it comes to beer and hype: Believe Nothing. Try Everything.

name: Pikes Peak Brewing Company
description: We established our Monument, Colorado brewery in 2011 as a place for our community to connect and come together. We believe the best beers are ones shared with friends and we hope that wherever you find a Pikes Peak Beer, it finds you in good company. We would rather brew for our neighbors than notoriety, so our beers are personal expressions that stay faithful to classic styles. We’re lucky to be at the source of some the country’s finest ingredients. From our abundant grains and fresh hops to our pristine waters, we’re inspired by our landscape to make beer as solid and iconic as our namesake mountain. Since receiving such an overwhelming response, we’ve made it a priority to give back to the community that’s been so good to us. Our seasonal beers support organizations that make our corner of Colorado such a great place to live. At Pikes Peak Brewing Company, we’re elevating the craft of beer and invite you to join us on our trek to the summit.

name: Caldera Brewing
description: Caldera Brewing Company was incorporated March 12, 1996. The first brew was July 4, 1997 and the first keg sold was August 28, 1997. Caldera self-distributed its products for the first six years. In November 2003, Caldera partnered up with Gold River Distributing in Southern Oregon and Mt. Hood Beverage Company in the Eugene and Portland markets to expand its business. Please see the Distribution page for current distribution. For the first eight years, Caldera was draught only until June 2005 when the Pale Ale was put into cans. Caldera is the first microbrewery in the State of Oregon to brew and can its own beer. See The Aluminum Beer Can page for more on cans and the quality they provide.

name: Otter Creek Brewing
description: Otter Creek has been hitting, hopping and dosing brews with creativity since acid-wash jeans were hip. Under the direction of brewmaster Mike Gerhart, we are undergoing a renaissance of rad, a rebirth of cool--throwing a bit of kind into the kettle whenever possible. Our hop-soaked ales are available throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic regions.

name: Abide Brewing Co.
description: Abide Brewing Company is proud to be the first brewery in Newnan, Georgia. Local residents Matthew Kapusta, Evan Scanlan, and Philip Leonard developed their craft while home brewing. Together in 2013 they decided to follow their dreams to start a local nano-brewery that focused primarily on quality, flavor, and the unique techniques of brewing. After learning about the project, Yokogawa Corporation of America added their support by manufacturing and installing a Brewery Automation and Control System. In early 2015 the first beers were released into the local market. Abide’s desire is that their community would “accept without objection” Local Craft Ales. Cheers!

name: Holsten-Brauerei
description: Holsten stands for character and class Hamburger brewing tradition. A true original with an edge. On our Fanpage we look forward to an honest and whistles with you. We hope that also shows her character and kindness and respect each other deal. Please respect personality and copyrights, privacy and data protection. The waiver of profanity, insults, discrimination with respect to race, religion, sex or national origin should be obvious. Also as far as the use of alcohol, you should definitely act responsibly, after all we are all connoisseurs. The bottom line here should not go otherwise than in a circle of your pals. If it is danced to very out of line, marvel not, if we remove postings or comments. But our strong character fans, that should probably unlikely to occur. In this sense: Hummel, Hummel - Mors, Mors! Cheers and of course!

name: 42 North Brewing Company
description: Certain locations around the world hold within them an unspoken power. They’re where wars were fought, fortunes lost – and found – and where legacies are made. And, these places happen to be connected by a common thread. Unseen to the naked eye, yet felt in its magnetic persuasion. It is the 42nd Parallel. Crossing Russia, Italy, France, and Spain. And Great American cities like Boston, Detroit, and Buffalo. It’s the border of California and Oregon, New York and Pennsylvania, and, in many instances, countries including the United States and Canada. And when it comes to beer, the 42nd parallel is unparalleled as well. Some of the world’s best hops grow along it, and in the late 1800’s and early 1900’s, it’s where New York State hops grew bountiful and full-bodied. This tradition – and the legacy of arguably the most important parallel on earth – have found a new home, and a new future, here: at 42 North.

name: Orpheus Brewing
description: Orpheus Brewing is an artisanal brewery overlooking Piedmont Park and the Beltline. With a lineup featuring saisons, sours, hops, and barrels, Orpheus Brewing is offering beers unique to the Southeast.

name: Creature Comforts Brewing Company
description: Creature Comforts was founded by people passionate for starting a craft brewery in Athens, GA, a town that we love and that has the potential to be a craft beer hub and destination for the South East. The first piece of the puzzle was David Stein who at the time was the head brewer at Twain's Billiards & Tap, a well-known brewpub in Decatur, GA. David was a home brewer turned pro, whose passion for craft beer had moved him through working at some of the top craft beer establishments. David was using the name Creature Comforts for his personal home brews and that name became the foundation for the brewery we run today. David quickly brought on his friend Adam Beauchamp, who was in his seventh year of brewing beer at Sweetwater Brewing Company in Atlanta, GA, a brewery he began working at after leaving a PHD in Genetics program at Emory. Adam himself was an accomplished home-brewer and he had a wealth of experience running a production brewery. With the help of a craft beer enthusiast and local Athens, GA businessman, Derek Imes, we began building Creature Comforts in a beautiful 13,000 square foot historic warehouse building in downtown Athens. The building was originally built in the 1940's as a Chevy dealership and later became Snow Tire Co., before Creature Comforts took over. Building in a 1940's warehouse presented a lot of challenges as well as many wonderful opportunities. One such opportunity was the chance to salvage and reclaim the old wood from the building that was subsequently refinished and then put back into the brewery in the form of bar tops, tables, wall paneling, and ceilings. The final result, is a brewery that has won an award for outstanding rehabilitation by the Athens Heritage Foundation and something that we are extremely proud to share with the world. Approximately two months before opening, we found the final missing piece. We knew we wanted to bring someone into the family who would handle the business aspects of the brewery, considering the fact that Adam and David are brewers dedicated to spending every minute of their day making the best possible beer. Through a long journey that ended with a very serendipitous introduction that came via a person in Vancouver, British Columbia, Chris Herron, a Georgia native himself who was living in Connecticut, became the CEO of Creature Comforts. Chris had spent 12 years working in sales, pricing, and finance for major beverage alcohol suppliers, and was intent on starting a craft brewery in Georgia, which made him joining Creature Comforts an easy choice. We have since added, Blake Tyers a veteran and forward thinking home brewer as a brewer at Creature Comforts, and we brought on Katie Beauchamp to manage our office activities, tours and special events. Combined with the nearly 20 part time tour staff we have, our entire family is together and we have 20+ years of experience. What started out as curious exploration of what we love, turned into us uncovering our passion, following that passion, and finding happiness, which has allowed us to enjoy the Creature Comforts of life. Creature Comforts Brewing Company is truly our very own creature comfort. Our brewery is what makes us happy, it is what makes us feel at home, it is what comforts us, and puts us in a happy place. Creature Comforts is the end result of the story of our past and the starting point for the story our future, and we look forward to writing that story with you.

name: Big Time Brewing Company
description: Big Time's brewery is a 14 barrel JV Northwest system consisting of a gas fired brew kettle, an infusion mash tun with mixer, a hot liquor back, a wort cooler, (5) 14 barrel fermenters, (1) bright beer tank, and (20) 7 bbl serving tanks. We sell 85% of our beer at the pub but do wholesale a limited number of kegs to a dozen or so Seattle area taverns. We currently brew approximately 1,300 barrels of beer per year

name: Marshall Brewing Company
description: Marshall Brewing Company’s goal is to bring the art, quality, and enjoyment of craft brewing to Oklahoma. MBC does this by operating with a highly trained and educated staff that possesses a passion for top quality brewing and will settle for nothing less. The company aims to be known as the premiere brewery in Oklahoma and to be respected on the regional and national markets as well. MBC’s development goals are for steady growth without ever sacrificing quality, which is the cornerstone of the product line.

name: Sugar Creek Brewing Company
description: Sugar Creek is bringing Belgian-inspired beer to the Carolinas and beyond. The Sugar Creek Brewing philosophy combines the watchful eye of a Trappist Monk with the technical precision of a nuclear engineer to craft fresh, full-flavored beers that are immensely satisfying and intensely drinkable. Using unique combinations of aromatic yeast strains, domestic and imported hops and award-winning malt varieties, Sugar Creek infuses traditional recipes with modern tastes and techniques to create beer that nourishes both mind and body.

name: Pine Street Brewery
description: When asked, “Why we started brewing?” The common response back in 2009 was, “We like arts and crafts”. The brewing began in a small apartment kitchen on Pine St. in San Francisco on a stove that could hardly generate a boil. During the first night, it became apparent that we could create the beer that we wanted to drink and the collective that became Pine Street Brewery (PSB) was born. That was goal from the first night of brewing—it was love at first smell. PSB moved into the historic Bourne Mansion in Pacific Heights during the Spring of 2010 and called this home until the Fall of 2011. Regular weekly brewing led to lots of experimentation and ten recipes that have become part of the core beer list. During “Brew Nights,” friends were made, a community was fostered and a brand was started. Pine Street Brewery was designed so that our products would be available for many different palates in many different communities. There is a unique Pine Street in almost every area. We intend for our beer, interpretations of classic styles, to unite people across the US, one beer at a time. Our philosophy is to provide a celebration through ales and togetherness. We are active in the community through volunteer work and partnerships with local charities.

name: ENKI Brewing
description: ENKI Brewing is the 20+ year culmination of the friendship between two beer lovers. John Hayes and Dan Norton met working for NIKE in the early-80s. Training and competing in track and road running events brought them together. They soon found another shared interest--experiencing the world of beer. The two made many friends spending spare evenings in New England pubs offering European beers, which, before the emergence of American craft beers, were the best beers available. The two often discussed their dream of opening their own brewery over the years. In August of 2012, John and Dan decided to take the keg into their own hands, and ENKI Brewing Company was born. Just a few months later, their dreams came to fruition at 7929 Victoria Drive. ENKI’s mission is to “Make the World a Friendlier Place – Two Beers at a Time” just as John and Dan have been enjoying and sharing beers with old and new friends, alike.

name: Kensington Brewing Company
description: The Kensington Brewing Company is a small, independently owned and operated craft beer company located in the heart of Kensington Market, Toronto.

name: Brouwerij Van Steenberge
description: The only operational brewery left in the Meetjesland. Traditional brewing techniques in a modern environment. The Brewery Van Steenberge is synonym for independence, progress and growth. It focuses on traditional brewing techniques that have evolved on the rhythm of technological evolutions. It guarantees a reliable quality and service. Respect for the staff and the environment occupy a central position in the policy.

name: Pittsburgh Brewing Company
description: From it’s beginnings in 1861, Pittsburgh Brewing Company has always been committed to a few things: deep roots in the Pittsburgh community, strong tradition, innovation, and of course, brewing great beer. We’ve been at it for over 150 years, and with every bottle we keep getting better. OUR MISSION Make Pittsburgh proud of its hometown brewery Build on our proud tradition of excellence Produce the best-tasting malt beverages in the country Reinvigorate and maintain an iconic brand Create high-quality jobs and provide healthy returns to investors OUR VALUES These core values are at the center of everything we do here at the Pittsburgh Brewing Company. QUALITY This means quality in everything: ingredients, the people we hire, the vendors we work with, our advertising, and of course, every beer we brew. We strongly believe that anything worth doing is worth doing well. INTEGRITY Integrity means honesty, transparency, and dedication to our values. We’re a proud part of our Pittsburgh community, and we love giving back. TRADITION We’ve been brewing for over 150 years and our brews reflect that expertise. Today’s Iron City Beer tastes just like it used to, but a little bit better every time.

name: Commonwealth Brewing Co.
description: Local family owned, full production brewery housed inside a fully renovated, former fire and rescue station in Virginia Beach.

name: Great Crescent Brewery
description: The Great Crescent Brewery beers are made with all malt, fresh hops and whole ingredients. Every beer is hand-crafted in small batches using traditional brewing methods. We package our beer in self-pressurizing mini-kegs that hold the equivalent of a case of beer, half–gallon refillable growler bottles and 1/6 barrel (5 gallon) kegs that can be used in commercial and home draft systems. Some of our specialty beers, like our Cherry Ale, will only be available in limited quantities. We are a production brewery that sells beer right from the premises. Although we don’t currently have a tasting room where we can sell beer by the glass – we will be offering samples to help you decide which beer to purchase. We are open to the public Wednesday-Friday 2pm to 7pm, Saturday 12 (noon) to 7pm and Sunday 12 (noon) to 4pm. You can purchase our beers outside of the brewery at The Pour House in Aurora, Indiana, Bakers Discount Liquors in Rising Sun, Indiana and Whitey’s in Lawrenceburg, Indiana. We are also available on draft at Bourbons Bar & Grill in Lawrenceburg, Indiana.

name: Seven Arrows Brewing Company
description: Seven Arrows Brewing Company creates a relaxed, social and enjoyable environment that provides high quality and true to style beers.

name: Independence Brewing Company
description: Rob and Amy Cartwright embarked on their dream to brew flavorful, delicious beers for the people of Austin in October 2004. Armed with their love of beer, years of brewing experience, an intrepid spirit, and their trusty dog Jasper, they founded Independence Brewing Company. Located in southeast Austin, amongst tech companies and warehouse park entrepreneurs, Independence Brewing is a true reflection of the creative energy and pioneering spirit that makes Austin great. What started with a married couple and their dog, has blossomed into a talented crew who pours their hearts and soul into brewing beers we love to drink and share with friends.

name: Twisted X Brewing Company
description: Twisted X Brewing Company brews Hill Country crafted beers using spring water that are sure to satisfy a thirsty palate. Cheers!

name: River North Brewery
description: Independent family-owned Denver brewery crafting Adventure Fuel for the state of Colorado.

name: Brau Brothers Brewing Company
description: We are very excited to introduce Brau Brothers Brewing Company, LLC. We are a locally owned and operated brewery, producing strictly for a local and regional market. We like to stay close to the beer we produce as well as to the people who drink it. Our modest scale allows us to be more flexible, dynamic, and closer to retailers as well as beer drinkers.

name: Elysian Brewing Company
description: The Elysian was founded in 1995 by principals Dick Cantwell (President/Head Brewer), Joe Bisacca (CFO/Head of Operations) and David Buhler (Sales & Marketing Director). Our first Seattle location, a 220-seat beer hall and our main brewery, opened in 1996 on Capitol Hill, Seattle’s most populous neighborhood. In 1997 Elysian was chosen to operate a pub and small brewery at Gameworks—a large entertainment complex owned by Universal Studios, Dreamworks & Sega. Elysian left this partnership in 2002 upon expiration of the five-year contract. A short year later Elysian opened TangleTown, an 80-seat neighborhood brewery/bistro. With a 3-bbl pilot brewery, Elysian-TangleTown acted as the brewers' test kitchen, fueling the creative fires and helping cement Elysian's reputation as Seattle’s top brewpub. The most recent addition to the Elysian empire, Elysian Fields, opened in August 2006. Perched next to Seattle’s two sports arenas, Fields seats 400 and packs the house at lunch and on gamedays. It is typical for us to offer over twenty different Elysian beers between the three locations.

name: Mantra Artisan Ales
description: Craft is a combination of art and science. The science has been learned, the art, on the other hand, comes from inside each of us.

name: Dois Corvos
description: American-style craft beer in Lisbon, Portugal.

name: Schneider Weisse
description: The wheat beer specialists of the Schneider brewery are regularly awarded at international competitions. This proves that they are justly considered as world classics. A unique variety of distinguishing wheat beer specialties is being brewed at Bavaria’s oldest wheat beer brewery strictly following the Reinheitsgebot. The brewer, Georg Schneider VI, presents his family of wheat beer specialties:

name: Flying Bison Brewing
description: Flying Bison Brewing Company is a packaging brewery located in the city of Buffalo, and the first stand alone brewery to operate in the city proper since Iroquois Brewing closed its doors in 1972. An award-winning brewer with over 30 years experience, owner Tim Herzog made a strong commitment from the inception of this company as merely an idea to establish Flying Bison Brewing Company in the City of Buffalo and foster the return of what was once a flourishing industry.

name: Finger Lakes Beer Company
description: Finger Lakes Beer Company was established in the fall of 2009 by Partners, Wayne Peworchik & Mark Goodwin. Both Wayne and Mark were avid homebrewers for many years. Mark continued on with his brewing education by completing the Web-based Concise Course in Brewing Technology at the Siebel Institute of Technology World Brewing Acadamy from which he obtained his Certificate. We selected our location nestled in the heart of the beautiful Finger Lakes Region of upstate New York for its close proximity to Keuka Lake and the availability for lake water for brewing. Our building offered a spacious workable layout, ample parking and room for future expansion. We began our building renovations and equipment installation in early 2010, received our license in the fall of 2010, and on November 11th, 2010 opened our doors for tours, tastings, and growler fills. Our Brew Room features a matched Ripley 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Brewing system. The Brew House includes a Boil Kettle, Mash Tun and Hot Liquor Tank. The Brew Room also features 3 double wall digital temperature controlled fermentation tanks, grain mill, filter, and other assorted brewing equipment. Adjacent to the brew room is a walk-in cooler containing 8 - 7 Barrel Stainless Steel Serving Tanks and assorted keg filling and dispensing equipment. The entrance way and tasting room offer large windows for great views of the Brew Room as well as a large comfortable area for you and your friends to relax and visit while enjoying your favorite brews offered fresh daily. We offer tastings and growler fills of fine crafted ales and root beer all brewed on premises as well as guided tours on non-brewing days. Have your own growlers, we fill your clean growlers. Don't own one yet, no worries we have 1 and 2 liter in several styles with our logo on them.

name: Island Brewing Company
description: Island Brewing Company has been brewing in Carpinteria, CA since July, 2000 and has steadily gained a following of enthusiasts along the Santa Barbara coast. Owner and brewer Paul Wright began his brewing adventures after receiving a homebrew kit for Christmas in 1991 in Novato, CA. He joined the local brew club and started winning awards for his beers. Soon he found himself president and heading up the Marin County State Fair competitions, and after burning out all the burners on the stove, he was banished to brewing outdoors. A certified beer judge, he worked at Marin Brewing Company before starting off on his own, moving south to Carpinteria. Now a family run brewery, Island Brewing Company has won awards on both the state and national level. We serve local bars, restaurants, and retail outlets and have five and fifteen-gallon kegs and 22-ounce bottles available for weddings, caterers, as well as for thirsty individuals that happen to come our way. We’ve now opened a new brewery in beautiful downtown Carpinteria and hope you’ll stop by to visit soon.

name: TRiNiTY Brewing
description: TRiNiTY BREWiNG Company is a Public Ale and Lager House. Inspired by Belgian and English tap houses, our pub focuses on three major concepts: Artisanal Beer, Slow Food, and Conscious People. Cheers!

name: SunUp Brewing
description: The seven barrel system that looms behind the floor to ceiling glass in our Brewer’s Den is the fruits of our labor and February 14, 2006 marked a new chapter in our history. You see, this was the day that the first three beers brewed on site flowed. We know we are biased, but in our minds the beer had never tasted as good as it did that day. Our brew master is the “Big German” Uwe Boer that we all know and love. He works magic in his craft and the passion that he shows for brewing fills the glasses as his award winning beer dispenses from our taps. We now boast our own regular taps but his innovation in our seasonal ales and distinct brewing style is what keeps our bar stools full and the place hopping. We can hardly keep his cask conditioned ale on tap as our customers are known to consume the kegs in record time. “Great Beer, Great Food and Great Service” became our motto as we plugged through the first few years and now the slogan is what we live by. Our fantastic customers and great staff are what makes us who we are and how we stand out in the sea of new restaurants that pop up daily. It is our great customers that made it so easy to push forward into brewing and our loyal staff that helped to smooth over the transition. We continue to grow and change over time just as any business wants to do but it is remembering the little things that have gotten us to where we are today. After all in today’s crazy hectic world it is the little things in life that make it all worth it.

name: Uncle Billy's Brewery
description: Uncle Billy’s Brewery is located in the heart of South Austin on Barton Springs Road, with a short walk to Barton Springs Pool and Zilker Park. Uncle Billy's Brewery and Barbecue features a brewery on site serving hand crafted beers by brewer Michael Waters. Uncle Billy's offers a delicious menu that includes barbecue, burgers and salads. Enjoy drinks and live music on the dog friendly outdoor patio. Award-winning beers from on-site microbrewery & delicious BBQ! Daily specials, happy hour & outdoor seating.

name: MadTree Brewing Company
description: MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country. Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities. MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition. HIGHLIGHTS - The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch. - In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio. - Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine. - PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

name: Darwin Brewing Co.
description: Darwin Brewing Co. is a production brewery with a beer tasting room. Co-owner and Brewmaster Jorge Rosabal is in charge of the brewing operation.

name: Breakside Brewery
description: Breakside Brewery is the invention of Scott Lawrence and Tony Petraglia. Some mutual friends introduced the two after learning they both had a desire to leave their corporate jobs in order to pursue their dream of opening a brew pub. They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

name: Saucy Brew Works
description: Saucy Brew Work’s beer is designed to satisfy, sip after sip or chug after chug, your choice. Our New Haven-style pizza is killer. The brewpub offers a great time for the great people you’ll find at every bar stool.

name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery
description: Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process. We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer. Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.

name: Blue Skye Brewery and Eats
description: Blue Skye Brewery and Eats is a new microbrewery and restaurant built around our cozy wood-fired pizza oven. We serve six varieties of in-house crafted beer along with a complete bar of bottled beer, wine and alcohol. In addition to pizza our menu includes quality sandwiches, salads and pub fare - all made in-house with fresh ingredients. We are located on Santa Fe Avenue in downtown Salina, Kansas and are dedicated to the development of this historic district. We think you'll find our offerings and atmosphere a unique addition to the current mix of local dining choices. We hope you'll join us for quality food, fresh brew, and the gathering of good friends.

name: Wynkoop Brewing Company
description: Colorado’s first brewpub, Wynkoop Brewing Company was founded in 1988 by a group of young entrepreneurs and urban pioneers led by Denver's current Governor John Hickenlooper. Our brewpub’s hallmarks -- highly acclaimed small-batch beers, high quality food & service, the city’s best pool hall and our glorious 1888 building -- helped make us a major catalyst for the revival of Lower Downtown Denver. Today Wynkoop Brewing Company is a beer-blessed Denver institution, a must-visit Colorado landmark and one of the nation’s most revered craft breweries. We’re also one of the city’s best places for private and corporate events. We’ve hosted everything from the Democratic National Convention parties to beer festivals, weddings and company conferences. (All with great beer and food.) Today we’re expanding our downtown brewing efforts to deliver more of our ambitious, artisan-style craft beer to Denver’s best beer outlets. Look for cans of our beer in local stores and kegs of all of our beers at the area’s top bars and restaurants.

name: Oval Brewing Company
description: Oval Brewing is a start-up commercial brewery and tap-room, once open it will operate as a “social brewery” in Columbus, Ohio. It will be a production facility producing kegs and cans of craft beer for the local market. Attached to the brewery will be a tasting room where patrons can interact with the brewers, hang out, learn and -of course- taste. OBC will have various social functions beyond creating excellent beer; the brewery space will be available as an event space for both public and private functions, a small entertainment venue, team building events, home-brewing classes and team-building workshops. We are also creating a “virtual boardroom” where customers can vote on upcoming beers and styles. These pieces will allow us to communicate directly with the our customers and community.

name: RoHa Brewing Project
description: Great Beer. No Compromise.

name: 3 Sheeps Brewing Co
description: All families have their stories: tales of grandparents and great-grandparents and the incredible things they accomplished, or lived through, or overcame. My family was no different. I grew up hearing stories that cascaded across a broad plain of topics, but the ones that fascinated me most centered around the Kingsbury Breweries. Back in 1926, the Kingsbury Breweries, then known as the Gutsch Brewery, declared bankruptcy. It was a tough time for breweries across the country as Prohibition was in full effect. Many breweries failed during that time, and the Gutsch Brewery was on its way to joining them. It was at this time that my family took the helm of the brewery. Soon after, they changed the name to the Kingsbury Breweries, expanded coast-to-coast, and turned the brewery into what we remember it as today. I grew up hearing stories from my father, who, as a child with his father, would go around the various Kingsbury Breweries, see the brewers hard at work, and watch the customers enjoy a beer in the Ratskellar. This is where my interest was first piqued by the great world of beer. Many years later, thanks to a brilliant gift on my wife’s part, I started making my own beer. From that point forward there was no turning back. The hobby turned into a passion, which turned into an obsession, which turned into quitting my day job and opening a brewery. This is my Really Cool Waterslide - my choice to take a dream and make it my reality. Thank you to all those who have helped me get here. - Grant Pauly, 3 Sheeps Brewing

name: Rivertowne Brewing
description: If you have not been in to visit us yet, we look forward to meeting you. Otherwise, we appreciate having you as a patron. For those of you who didn't know, we have 4 exciting locations. Experience dining in or spend an evening with us enjoying your favorite hard-to-find beer. Our Mission is to build genuine relationships with our guests, and to make a positive impact on the community. We further desire to offer excellent service, great beer and food made with TLC to our guests.

name: Babe's Bar-B-Que and Brewhouse
description: The Coachella Valley's oldest craft micro-brewery.Winner 2015 BREWERY OF THE YEAR at the California State Fair Commercial Beer Competition.Over 40 international beer awards over 15 years. WINNER Gold Medal at the 2015 US Open Beer Beer Championship for Belgian vanilla Blonde ale. WINNER 2014 Silver Medal at GABF for Belgian Vanilla Blonde Ale! Brewing our 1st batch way back in March 2002, Babe's Brewhouse has won numerous Gold, Silver & Bronze medals at the LA International Commercial Beer Comp and Silver & 2 Bronze at the AIBA's Australian Inter Beer Awards in 2003! Best Known for our Honey Blonde Ale & Blackfin Lager!

name: Master Gao Brewing Co. f Nanjing
name_short_display: Master Gao Brewing Co. f Nanjing
description: Master Gao Brewing Co. of Nanjing can be dated back to 2008. It owns Master Gao® brand beer. The company is a practicer, advocator and pusher of China’s craft beer movement. Its motto “Brew Free” has become the ideological pursuit of the entire craft beer society. In 2012, the company’s “Baby IPA” received nationwide applause, and regarded as a milestone and break through of China’s craft beer movement. In 2016, Master Gao Brewing Company once again introduced a canned version of Jasmine T-lager, taking China brewed craft beer into a new phase of mass marketing. The company’s achievement has been reported by global media such as Financial Time, Boston Globe, Business Week, and China Daily. In the past 9 years, the company has held multiple national craft beer events, including Master Cup National Home Brew Tournament , China Craft Beer Festival, China International Craft Beer Expo etc.

name: Pretty Things Beer & Ale Project
description: We are a gypsy brewery, without a permanent brewing home. We like it that way, we can be whatever we want to be on a shoestring budget. What more do you want than that? Our flagship beer is Jack D'Or. Jack is the mournful grain of barley you can see to the right. He is the soul of beer, nature's magician, creating sugar from starch and bringing together the Pretty Things to produce the substance we adore: beer.

name: Bacchus Brewing Company
description: At Bacchus Brewing Company, we start each day with a singular focus. We love what we do and want to provide you with only the highest quality beer. Every beer we produce is made with premium ingredients and attention to detail. The quality of our beer reflects who we are and what we care about. We encourage you to sit back, relax, and enjoy an exceptional taste of the Finger Lakes. Visit us in person or at www.bacchusbrewing.com.

name: Back East Brewing Company
description: Back East is an award-winning Craft brewery in Bloomfield, CT. Back East was formed by Edward Fabrycki, Jr. and Tony Karlowicz, two cousins with a passion for great-tasting, high-quality beer. Back East brews many different styles of high-quality beers, distributed on draft and in cans throughout Connecticut.

name: 21st Amendment Brewery
description: In 2000, Nico Freccia and Shaun O’Sullivan opened the doors to the 21st Amendment brewpub in San Francisco’s historic South Park neighborhood with Freccia managing the restaurant and O’Sullivan spearheading the brewing process. In addition to quickly becoming one of the city’s favorite pubs, 21st Amendment began expanding beyond the Bay Area by helping to pioneer the movement to canned craft beer. Known for their witty names and delicious brews, 21st Amendment offers year-round selections, as well as seasonal offerings and their infamous ‘Insurrection Series’, a once-in-a-while limited edition release. Sold in 25 states, 21st Amendment operates out of its new San Leandro brewery headquarters and is among the top 50 craft beer brewers in America.

name: Steamworks Brewing Company
description: Steamworks Brewing Co. opened its doors in Durango in September 1996. A favorite watering hole for locals and visitors alike, our brewpub has much more to offer than award-winning craft beer. Known as a town meeting place, Steamworks enjoys a bustling, fun environment. Steamworks’ culinary program is unmatched in the region in both breadth and quality of offerings. Our “gastropub” fare includes regionally-raised meats and sustainable seafood. Healthy salads, delicious pizzas, spicy Southwestern-style dishes, and vegetarian & gluten-free offerings provide something for everyone who’s hungry. Stop by to discover what’s “on tap.” Hang with the locals. Catch a game. Enjoy a fresh beer and outstanding food. Every day promises a screaming deal and fun to be had!

name: Four String Brewing Company
description: Four String Brewing Company is Columbus' latest craft brewery. Located in the heart of Grandview, Four String is now distributing draft beer in the Columbus market.

name: Foolproof Brewing Company
description: Foolproof Brewing Company in Pawtucket, Rhode Island, produces high-quality, hand-crafted beers. Each of our beers is designed with a specific experience in mind.

name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
description: The Saugatuck Brewing Company (SBC) has been a leading producer in the Michigan Craft Beer Industry since brewing its first beer in 2005. The brewery, located conveniently on Blue Star Highway in Douglas, Michigan, boasts two tasting rooms and outdoor patio dining. The Pub features 16 taps, hard cider, and wine along with a full food menu including everything from unique entrees to shareable appetizers. Free, live music increases the dining experience every Saturday at 6:00 pm, along with live music on the Patio every Thursday at 6:00 pm from Memorial Day to Labor Day. Along with the Pub, the Saugatuck Brewing Company recently added on a second tap room, which has been dubbed "The Barrel Room," including 15 additional taps and a variety of munchies. The Barrel Room is a laid-back tasting room where customers can enjoy a pint while playing a round of one of the many games featured, like shuffleboard, bumper pool, pinball and more. Saugatuck Brewing Company is also proud to be the only location in the state of Michigan to offer a "Brew On Premise" program, where customers can come in and brew their own beer on our 3.5 barrel Brew System located in the Pub. All of the beer offered at the Saugatuck Brewing Company is brewed on site on a 45 barrel Brew System in the 14,000 square foot Production Facility. Customers can tour the facility every Saturday at 2:00 pm for $7.50/person. Each tour includes a complimentary tasting and their choice of a logo'd pint glass or growler to take home. The Saugatuck Brewing Company bottles 7 styles year round, including everything from a crisp Blonde Ale to exciting flavored stouts. SBC also offers a variety of interesting styles throughout the year as bottled seasonals, specialty releases and draft only beers. These beers can be found near and far, as they are distributed through 11 states (Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Ohio, Wisconsin, Missouri, Kentucky, Pennsylvania, Florida, New Jersey and Nebraska) along with 7 foreign markets (United Kingdom, Western Canada, Germany, Trinidad & Tobago, Ukraine, China and South Korea). While the plan remains to grow these brands throughout the country and world, SBC will never forget that Michigan is where they are from, and where the heart is. Saugatuck Brewing Company is located on the southwest coast of Michigan on Blue Star Highway, ½ mile North of Exit 36 on Interstate 196. Located in the community of Saugatuck/Douglas, which is known for it’s clean, beautiful beaches, sprawling sand dunes, and exciting night life; not to mention their delicious beer.

name: Fountain Square Brewing Company
description: Back in the Summer of 2011, we got the crazy idea to startup a brewery, not because we wanted to be on the bandwagon, but because we wanted something different, something our talents and passion for beer could make happen. Out technical background in Microbiology, Chemistry, and Automation, made up the perfect storm needed to produce quality beer with a higher level of consistency and with improved shelf stability. Our passion for beer and diversity of tastes allowed us to craft carefully refined recipes that we know will delight you. We chose Fountain Square because of the community. Since we will be the first to admit our creativity and talents exist on a side of the brain that has little capability to draw, we have this admiration and attraction to those whose talents reside in the arts. We have connected to this community over the past year and look forward to being a vehicle for expressing its artistic nature. Fountain Square is a community of hard working, creative, fun loving, and genuine people. They are probably the most helpful people we've ever met. We are truly honored to be a part of the community and will strive to be worthy ambassadors and stewards.

name: Beardslee Public House
description: Drew Cluley, an award-winning master brewer, brings 20 years of extensive craft brewing experience to Beardslee Public House. Drew began his brewing career in Seattle at Pyramid Brewing Company when it opened in 1995. Following a stint as a brewery consultant in Nagano, Japan, Drew returned to the states and worked at Pyramid Alehouse and Big Time Brewery. He eventually became Pike Brewing Company’s assistant head brewer in 2000 when his first commercially produced recipe was released, and became Pike’s head brewer and production manager in 2006. In 2011, Drew returned to Big Time Brewery as head brewer before joining Chef John Howie in June 2014 to design and develop the Beardslee Public House beer program.

name: Upland Brewing Company
description: We’ve been brewing ales, lagers, and sours in Bloomington, Indiana since 1998. Many of our brews are unique twists on traditional recipes, while others are products of our own imaginations. We’re proud to say that several of our beers have brought home national and international medals and awards, but what we really care about is brewing the kinds of beer we like to drink, and providing a fresh local option to our communities. It never hurts to get a pat on the back, though! Along the way, we’ve made lots of friends and drank our unfair share of good beer, all while trying to do good in our communities and do well as a craft brewery.

name: Lynnwood Brewing Concern
description: You can call Lynnwood Grill "comfortable excitement.” It’s the kind of place where people know your name... and the bartenders know what you're drinking. Now located across from the Raleigh Grande Theatre, this locally owned bar and grill is the perfect place to grab a bite before or after the movie. It’s also a cozy place to meet friends for drinks, watch a game, or listen to live music. When the weather is nice, enjoy drinking and dining on the outdoor patio or the spacious rooftop.

name: DuClaw Brewing Company
description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

name: Meadowlark Brewing
description: Packaging Brewpub in Sidney, Montana.

name: Catskill Brewery LLC
description: The Catskill Brewery makes fresh ales, lagers and mixed fermentation beers using the best natural ingredients available. We make beer here, but we live here too – in this place we call The Catskills. So, we’ll keep an eye on the steps we take, and make sure we don’t leave a trace. In our building, our beliefs, and our process, we will look for every opportunity to make the best beer, share the best stories, and introduce new people to this place we love.

name: Arcadian Moon
description: Located just 45 minutes east of Kansas City, Arcadian Moon opened its doors in 2013 with a focus on Midwestern varietals and a desire to become one of Missouri’s best winery destinations. Since then, we’ve added live music on Saturdays and Sundays from spring to fall, opened a kitchen serving wood-fired pizzas and casual cuisine seven days a week, and is now one of Missouri’s newest craft breweries. From Crimson Cabernet to Vignoles — and from dry to sweet — Arcadian Moon has a wide selection of Midwestern varietals, as well as some blends. Later this year they will be launching their Explorer Series™, featuring wines produced from grapes grown beyond the heartland. Craft beers include Kölsch, Irish Ale, Brown Ale, Baltic Porter, Oatmeal Stout, IPA, Hard Ginger Ale, and more.

name: Baere Brewing Company
description: An industrial farmhouse in the Historic Baker District of Denver.

name: Millersburg Brewing Company
description: Brew Pub

name: McMenamins Breweries
description: McMenamins has been a neighborhood gathering spot throughout Oregon and Washington since 1983. We handcraft our own beer, wine, cider, spirits and coffee. We offer an eclectic mix of pubs, historic hotels, 25 breweries, movie theaters, concert venues, spas, events and just pure fun. Since our first brew at the Hillsdale Brewery & Public House in 1985, McMenamins has produced more than 75,000 batches. In keeping with McMenamins' company philosophy, our breweries believe that brewing "green" is brewing responsibly. Waste products are given to local farmers, where they can be used; materials used are recycled or reused whenever possible; and second-hand equipment is largely used. Have a look at our earth-friendly brewing practices. Many beer lovers are familiar with our ales: Terminator Stout, Hammerhead, Ruby, Black Rabbit Porter, Sunflower IPA and others. Due to the nature of handcrafting, it's safe to say that no two McMenamins batches are identical. Science and technology provide the backbone for our craft, but it is the unique qualities of each brew house, and the individual brewer's ale-crafting style, that ensure you will enjoy liquid refreshments that are truly special and made with every care for the environment. Whether you're in Seattle, Salem, Roseburg or Portland, breweries with the iconic McMenamins name are near. Come in and sip some creativity!”

name: Cosmic Brewery
description: Brewing a truly cosmic beer. We are committed to brewing true flavors of beer that satisfy every taste bud.

name: Howe Sound Brewing Company
description: Howe Sound Brewing is proud to provide premium quality, all natural, micro-brewed beers to British Columbia's Sea To Sky Corridor, from Vancouver to Whistler BC. All of our ales and lagers are handcrafted with no preservatives to deliver pure satisfaction.

name: Bainbridge Island Brewing Company
description: Making a great beer requires a combination of art and science. Science, in knowing what the gear and the ingredients can do. Art, in imagining what beer can be.
