description: City Brewing Company is one of the premier contract beverage producers in the country. Our two production facilities located in La Crosse, Wisconsin and Latrobe, Pennsylvania have the capacity to package over 60 million cases annually. Both facilities have the capability to produce beer, flavored malt beverages, teas and energy drinks in a variety of bottle and can sizes and configurations. We pride ourselves in quality and reliability for our customers which include some of the largest beverage companies in the country. Our facilities coupled with the experience and dedication of our skilled employees enables our customers to meet the demands of an ever changing marketplace.

name: Mount Pleasant Brewing Co
description: Distinctive Ales and Lagers

name: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery
description: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery is proud to be a member of the thriving craft beer scene in Richmond, VA. Located in Richmond’s historic German brewing district, Hardywood features a 20 barrel brewing system, public taproom and outdoor beer garden, and a private event taproom. Join us during public taproom hours, Wednesday through Sunday, and enjoy free live music, bocce ball, corn hole, local food trucks, craft fairs and brewery tours in addition to our award winning craft beer, brewed in the heart of Richmond.

name: Climax Brewing Company
description: Climax Brewing began as the dream of two home brewers who felt it was time for some good beer. Most of the recipes we use to brew our beer today started out as Dave's own home brewing recipes and all are developed from the style guidelines and are 100% representations of their given style.

name: Naked City Brewery & Taphouse
description: Once upon a time, there were two dudes named Donald and Don. One was an engineer toiling away on the super computers of a local university, and the other was a supervisor managing the complex operations of a local billionaire. Both of them loved their jobs, but more than their jobs they loved beer. Each Don had a recurring dream of a magical place without a name, a place where the great beers of the world flowed like the Salmon le Sac at flood stage, and the fine brewing tradition of the Pacific Northwest stood proudly beside the best concoctions from far-flung breweries in Asia and across Europe. Don and Donald worked tirelessly in the wee hours on their home brew mixtures, searching for the best possible combination of hops, malt, barley, and love. For long years, the two Dons had their separate dreams, and never met. A local poet named Bryan had the pleasure of growing up with Donald, and worked for the same local billionaire as Don. After many months of hearing Don speak of his dream of the magical beer haven, Bryan knew it must be the very same place of which Donald had spoken too. He knew instinctively that it was his responsibility to bring the two Dons together. On a fateful summer afternoon at the Elysian Brewery on Capitol Hill, the two Dons met. The event later became known as THE HAPPY HOUR OF DESTINY. Every patron in the pub knew something special was happening that day. The magical place both men dreamed of was one and the same. That very afternoon, the two Dons vowed to create a great beer haven right here on earth, and together they would name this magic place THE NAKED CITY. In THE NAKED CITY, it doesn't matter where you're going or where you've been, all that matters is great living and great beer. In THE NAKED CITY, the only problem is what great craft beer to try next. The two Dons spent a combined 25 years studying the world's great brewing traditions, and couldn't wait to begin experimenting together. Their very first batch of beer, an Oak-aged double IPA, took a ribbon in the Northwest regionals of the 2007 National Homebrew Competition. The rest, as they say, is history. Two years after the two Dons combined their separate dreams, THE NAKED CITY opened its doors. Now Naked City boasts an award-winning brewery that produces a variety of small-batch beers available at the pub and friendly bars and restaurants in Seattle, Tacoma, Bellingham, and beyond. The 24 taps of THE NAKED CITY offer a constantly rotating variety of Washington's best beers, regional craft beers, and the best beers Donald and Don have found in two lifetimes of beer travels around the world. Two and a half years after THE NAKED CITY was founded, the Dons convinced the local poet who brought them together to join them in the adventure. The Dons and Bryan together built a bigger brewery; a full-size kitchen; a dining room/movie theatre called The Screening Room that features free monthly events including film, comedy, poetry, community discusssion, and jazz; and now The Walrus Beer Garden, a patio that's home to murals by local artists, games, and summertime events. So. Welcome to THE NAKED CITY, where great beer lovers flock like the salmon of Capistrano, and the only question is: WHAT TAP NEXT?

name: Russell Brewing
description: Located in Strawberry Hill, Surrey, British Columbia, Russell Brewing Company has been brewing premium craft beer since 1995 using the finest ingredients available. Our beer is 100% natural and has no preservatives.We don't pasteurize which means we dont kill the taste you drink our beer just the way it is brewed. Fanatical about beer, we believe that the passion and quality that goes into creating Russell beer comes through in the taste. Our sister brewery, Fort Garry Brewery is Manitobas oldest microbrewery and has been producing original beers since 1930. Both Russell Brewing and Fort Garry Brewing are wholly owned subsidiaries of BC-based Russell Breweries Inc. a public company listed on the TSX Venture Exchange (TSX:V:RB).

name: Hales Ales Brewery and Pub
description: Founded by Mike Hale in 1983, Hale's Ales is the Northwest's 3rd oldest and longest running independently owned brewery in the Northwest. Hale's built its long standing reputation by brewing small batch, full flavored ales using traditional English brewing methods. An innovator from the start, Hale's was the first craft brewery to introduce Seasonal, Cask Conditioned and Nitrogen Conditioned ales to the region. Hale's goal is to stay true to what the craft brewing "revolution" is all about: crafting fresh, locally brewed ales of the very finest quality. Cheers from Hale's Ales!

name: Newburgh Brewing Company
description: Welcome to Newburgh Brewing Company, which is the Hudson Valley's newest Craft Brewery! Founded by Chris Basso and Paul Halayko, both from Washingtonville, NY, and later joined by an accomplished Charlie Benedetti, Newburgh Brewing Company is proud to join the rich history of brewing in New York State. We began brewing in March 2012, launching our beers on April 19, 2012.

name: Iron Spike Brewing Company
description: Iron Spike Brewing Company is a craft brewery and restaurant located in downtown Galesburg, IL at the historic Central Fire Station. This 10 barrel brewhouse and restaurant is truly unique to the downtown community, both inside and out. A 20 foot long, 12 foot high glass wall separates the brewery from the dining area, with the last of three functional fire poles located behind the bar. Iron Spike Brewpub operates with one simple philosophy of crafting traditional, unique and specialty styles that will entice every beer drinker, whether a craft-beer virgin, blog enthusiast, or malty connoisseur, and to rescue the standard that craft beer was founded upon. Iron Spike pushes the envelope of traditional styles including pilsner, porter, Indian Pale, Belgian, wheat and many others. We design recipes that stretch the character, basis and strength of each style. Our kitchen and chef compliment our craft beers with simple methods of building “from scratch” homefolk, hearty, and mouth-watering dishes that will entice and pair perfectly with our brews. Iron Spike not only brings craft beer and food to the area, but brings live music and local bands to fill up the atmosphere. Altogether, Iron Spike prides itself on original beer, great food, and local entertainment while supporting the Galesburg community.

name: Big Ridge Brewing Company
description: The Mark James Group is British Columbia's premiere collection of craft brewery restaurants. Established in 1976, MJG now has five popular brewery restaurants and a restaurant, along with three lounges and bars and one industry-leading clothing store. Over the years, MJG restaurants and pubs have proven themselves with an award-winning combination of great food, friendly service and unpretentious welcoming surroundings. Our brewmasters have decades of experience and take great pride in making some of the finest beers around, while our chefs are constantly at work improving our menus which balance sophisticated flavours with solid, well-made pub favourites.

name: Puyallup River Brewing Co.
description: A small batch production only brewery in the South Puget Sound region of Washington State. 2015 Washington Beer Awards Small Brewery of the Year!

name: Two Goats Brewing
description: Built in a renovated 19th Century barn with a sweeping view of Seneca Lake, Two Goats Brewing is an unpretentious gathering place on the Finger Lakes Wine Trail for people who just want to drink great beer and enjoy time with their friends. Or make some new ones!

name: Lakefront Brewery
description: Milwaukee’s own Lakefront Brewery Inc. started in 1987. The industrious and inventive microbrewery located on the Milwaukee River has become a Milwaukee landmark. Its rich history includes partnerships with local taverns, preservation of local historical pieces, unique tours, family style dining options and most importantly, great beer.

name: Redwood Brewing Co
description: Brewpub that offers upscale dining in a casual atmosphere. Our lodge themed restaurant features: smoke free dining, award winning beer, woodfire pizza oven, steaks, wild game, live music, outdoor dining and much more. 2008 Great American Beer Fest Small Brewpub of the Year.

name: Big Shoulders Beer Company
description: It started with a love of beer and a homebrewing kit. Big Shoulders isn't a big beer company (yet). Hopefully soon we will win a ton of awards, but for right now, we strive to make good beer that everyone can enjoy, no matter where they fall on the beer lover's spectrum. Our first releases will be Crosstown Wheat and Hopapalooza. Crosstown Wheat is a perfect summer wheat ale brewed with lemongrass and coriander. Hopapalooza is an IPA with nicely balanced aromatic and bittering hops.Both will be available in bottles and kegs in April 2012.

name: Wicked Beaver Brewing Company
description: Wicked Beaver is a West Texas Craft Brewery, formed in Spring of 2009. We are a hands-on Brewery, with no automation to speak of, this keeps us in touch with every batch of beer we brew. On an old dirt road, far from the beaten path, deep in the midst of no-where lives a Wicked Beaver. Why is he Wicked, you may ask? He is Wicked from the ways of the world, so many demands, too many deadlines, minor appreciation, and never enough time. So with little more than the stick in his hand and the Hops in his hanker chief, he journeyed West. Upon arriving in the West he hopped from the tailgate, choked on the dust, and kicked a tumble weed rolling his direction. This is the West, the place full of opportunity “he asked himself” and sighed but after a few Wicked Cold months, the landscape began to change, grass became lush green, trees bloomed and the flowers opened. The Wicked Beaver found the warm days, and cool nights were perfect to pursue his passion. The Wicked Beaver and his brewing partners have been Brewing Craft Specialty Beer’s in secret for years, perfecting the fragrant aroma by blending only best hops and hand selecting the Malted Barley for the most unique varieties of flavors and textures. The Wicked Beaver is ready to share his unique creations with you!

name: BriarScratch Brewing
description: Mission? To start both a unique farm style brewery in rural Middle TN and to establish Sumner County's first ever brewery! The goal is to bring fresh, local beer to Sumner County and Middle Tennessee!The mission is to focus on local sources, fresh ingredients, local community events, and a variety of beer styles for all of you fine folks to enjoy! Craft Beer is an exploding industry that has taken America a century to rebuild after prohibition occurred. People want local and we're gonna bring it! Briarscratch Brewing is underway in the planning stages to bring Sumner County its very own delicious craft beer using the best water, malt, hops, yeast, and whatever else we might want to throw into the kettle for a unique twist. Coming 2014!

name: Creemore Spring Brewery
description: At Creemore Springs, we’re renowned for being different – in part because we remain 100 years behind the times, in deed and in thought. We make our beer in small batches, in an open flame copper kettle, using the same painstaking methods as the European brew masters of the 1800’s. We take no shortcuts; we make no compromises. Our unofficial motto is: if something is worth doing – it’s worth doing well. Some might question such old-fashioned thinking but it results in consistently superb beer, and that has won us the loyalty of a legion of fans. Will we ever do things the same as everyone else? Ask us again in another 100 years.

name: Moon Under Water
description: The Moon is a true “beer bar”, which means a selection of only the finest brews, paired with food designed for every taste and even serving the beers in new glassware appropriate to the style of beer. The new Moon beers can be described as ‘German-fusion’ and are Brewmaster Clay’s West-coast interpretation of traditional German styles. All beers are 100% natural, unfiltered and naturally carbonated. Guest beers are handpicked to showcase some of the best Craft Beers in British Columbia and served alongside the house brewed beers.

name: Bold Rock Hard Cider
description: A southern guy from Virginia had a farm in the Blue Ridge Mountains and met a top cider maker in the world from New Zealand. It doesn’t get much more southern than that! Now the two of them are making hard cider and history.

name: Bangin' Banjo Brewing Company
description: Brewing out of Pompano Beach, FL, created by Matt Giani and Adam Feingold. Opening in Summer 2015.

name: Crispin Cider
description: Classically refined, but not styled as a traditional "sweet beer" beer alternative, Crispin ciders are crisp and clean, not sweet and sticky and never sacrifice superior quality refreshment satisfaction for overbearing complexity. Always true to the apple, Crispin Hard Ciders naturally fermented in the USA use fresh pressed apple-juice, not from apple juice concentrate, from a premium blend of US West Coast apples, with no added malt, grape wine or spirit alcohol. Crispin’s unique USA produced ciders are smoothed with pure apple juice or from natural sugar sources like organic honey or organic maple syrup, and contain no added colorants, sorbate or benzoate preservatives. Crispin ciders have 7 different varietals - Original, Light and Brut; classic European styled crisp clean ciders, Browns Lane; an imported classic English dry cider, and our line of Artisanal Reserves; Honey Crisp, The Saint and Lansdowne - unfiltered "cloudy" ciders, ground-breaking "craft beer" uniquely American ciders. Crispin ciders are all Gluten Free for the wheat-intolerant person.

name: Category 12
description: Category 12’s head brewer and founder, Michael Kuzyk, has been brewing beer for nearly 20 years and has his doctorate in microbiology and biochemistry from UVic. But all work and no play makes… well, you know the rest. After leading the creation of several world-class research labs, he decided it was time to make his own – dedicated to the pursuit of exceptional beer.

name: Cerveza Urbana
description: 4bbl brewery located in Mexico, in the city of Mexicali, Baja California. Known for their award winning Cross Over IPA and Hoppy Blonde Ale, both great beers. If your ever in Mexicali, be sure to find them and have a few pints.

name: The Black Abbey Brewing Company
description: “St. Anne, help me! I will become a monk!” Thus cried Martin Luther as a summer thunderstorm bore down on him in Stotternheim, Germany in 1505. These words marked the beginning of a momentous shift in religious history, but as you’re about to see, they led to some great beer, too.

name: Crow Hop Brewing Co
description: The main brewing philosophy of Crow Hop is to create well-balanced recipes that highlight each of beer's classic ingredients. Our seven core beers represent this philosophy, whereas our rotating selections give our brewers' creativity a chance to shine, in particular our Monthly Micro-fest. Each month, we release three to six pilot batches brewed around a common theme, from fruit beers to IPAs to a high gravity series - nothing is off limits. We strive to have products on hand that will excite and satisfy all kinds of beer lovers because for us at Crow Hop Brewing, it's about the beer.

name: Crown Brewing
description: When the Crown Brewing Company opened its doors in 2008 we had one goal in mind, "Craft the Best Beer Period!" In 2010 our Industrial Porter won a Bronze Medal in the World Beer Cup, Brown Porter category. We offer a selection of six to eight of our hand-crafted beers, fresh and on tap year round. In addition to our foundation beers, we brew special seasonal beers throughout the year. So, stop on in and see what's new!

name: The Veil Brewing Co.
description: We are a craft brewery located in the Scott's Addition neighborhood of Richmond, Virginia. We focus on hop forward beers, high gravity and barrel aging, lagers, wild ales, and spontaneous fermentation. We are dedicated to quality and strive to provide a unique experience through our beers and our tasting room.

name: Cugino Brewing Company
description: Cugino Brewing Company closed operations in 2004

name: Old Yale Brewing Company
description: In the heart of BC ‘s Fraser Valley surrounded by pristine mountains, rivers, lakes and agriculture you will find Chilliwack, BC – a recreational paradise and home of Old Yale Brewing Co. The story of our name, Old Yale, originates from the Old Yale Wagon Road. Built in 1875, it was the Fraser Valley’s first road link connecting all the communities from New Westminster to Yale. All of us at Old Yale Brewing believe that it’s the connections between people and communities that bring us together much like the road itself. Whether it’s our Classic Old Yale Pale Ale, Seargeant’s IPA or nationally acclaimed Sasquatch Stout, we invite you to taste one of BC’s finest craft-brewed beers.

name: Carlow Brewing Company
description: Carlow Brewing Company is a small Irish Brewery established in 1998. Carlow, a small town located in the Barrow Valley Region, the traditional malt and hop producing region in Ireland, once boasted a number of breweries, but the practice had been discontinued for over 100 years until revived in 1998 by Carlow Brewing Company.

name: Traveler Beer Company
description: At Traveler Beer Company we expand what craft beers can be by adding new flavors and discovering old traditions. We discovered the shandy tradition in Europe and are thrilled to bring this unique style of beer home, to you. Shandys exemplify everything we look for in a craft beer—they are different from the mainstream, fun, inviting, and social, and thanks to the finest ingredients, shandys taste amazing. Curious?

name: Chandeleur Brewing Company
description: Chandeleur ("shan-duh-leer") Brewing Company was started by Cammack Roberds and Cain Roberds. Their love of beer began in the 90’s, which eventually lead to homebrewing, and an endless pursuit of finding the best craft beers the World had to offer. They chose the name "Chandeleur" in honor of one of their favorite places, the Chandeleur Islands off the coast of Mississippi. The uninhabited island chain is approximately 50 miles long and is home to some of the best redfish and speckled trout fishing on the planet. Cam and Cain were born and raised in Gulfport, MS. Being raised on the coast instilled in them a true love for the water. When they’re not brewing beer, you’re almost guaranteed to find them fishing or cruising in a boat with family. As they gained a real passion for craft beer and continued to hone their homebrewing skills, they began to dream about opening their own microbrewery. Several years later, in July of 2012, Senate Bill 2878 became law, raising the permissible alcohol content in Mississippi beer from 5% by weight (6.25%ABV) to 8% by weight (10.1% ABV). The fellas knew that it was high time to start making their dream into a reality. And, they knew that Mississippi was the place to do it. In December of 2013, they purchased a historic building in downtown Gulfport and broke ground for what is now Chandeleur Brewing Company. Their vision is to handcraft some of the most excellent ales on the Gulf Coast using only the finest, freshest malted barley, hops, and local ingredients.

name: Colorado Plus
description: The 1st brew pub in the history of Wheat Ridge, CO. Brewery Tap House and Restaurant.

name: TRVE Brewing Company
description: TRVE Brewing is the Denver brewery dedicated to bringing you beer that's beyond the pale. A neighborhood spot where you can hang out and have some killer beer.

name: Deep Ellum Brewing Company
description: A business is brewing in Deep Ellum, Texas... Dedicated to making extraordinary beers and supporting all things local. Drink the Deep!

name: Sunken City Brewing Company
description: Sunken City is the new brewery at Smith Mountain Lake. We will start pouring beer in May!

name: Saranac Brewery
description: Our attention to detail and uncompromising commitment to quality represent the signature trademark of the Matt Brewing Company and our award-winning Saranac Beers.

name: Heavy Seas Beer
description: Heavy Seas Beer is brewed by Clipper City Brewing Company, in Baltimore, Maryland. The brewery was established by Hugh Sisson in 1995. Previously, Sisson operated Maryland's first brewpub, Sisson's. The brewery is named for the famed Clipper ship - first developed and built in the home port of Baltimore. While the name of the company remains Clipper City Brewing Company, all of its beer falls under the Heavy Seas brand. Heavy Seas is located at 4615 Hollins Ferry Road, Suite B, in the Halethorpe section of Baltimore. Heavy Seas currently offers a variety of beer styles in approx. 18 states within the United States. Heavy Seas mission is to bring back the local brewery, and to do it in such a way that we are more than just a fringe player, but a positive part of our area. To accomplish this mission we have created a broad portfolio of products with enough diversity that we have at least one beer that can appeal to everyone. Whether your preference is for a classic American style lager beer, or a big, challenging Hop Cubed Ale, we have a something that will suit your taste. We believe in bringing beer drinkers the quality and flavor of a handcrafted beer while supporting the local communities we serve.

name: Goldspot Brewing Company
description: Goldspot Brewing is in the Berkeley neighborhood, about a block from Regis University. Named for the gold spot that symbolizes the sun on both the city and state flags, Goldspot features several core beers made on a seven-barrel system, including an IPA, an imperial oatmeal stout and a wheat beer, along with rotating seasonals.

name: Brouwerij Liefmans
description: Brewery was acquired by Duvel Moortgat Brewery

name: Brouwerij Het Anker
description: Het Anker Brewery is a Flemish brewery in Mechelen, originally founded in 1471 by a community of Beguines. In 1872, the brewery was acquired by Louis Van Breedam, who renamed it Het Anker in 1904.

name: Atwater Brewery
description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!

name: Saw Works Brewing Company
description: Traditional Beers Brewed For Today! Knoxville, Tennessee Marble City Brewing Company became Saw Works in May 2012.

name: E.C. Dahls Bryggeri
description: E.C. Dahls Brewery (E.C. Dahls Bryggeri) is a brewery and soft drink factory based in Trondheim, Norway. E.C. Dahls Brewery was founded in 1856 by Erich Christian Dahl (1814–1882), a local businessman and consul-general from Trondheim. He was the son of Erich Dahl (1774-1821) Christine Lyche (1776-1861). His parents had been the owners of an import-export business and shipping company. In 1851, Erich Christian Dahl had bought the Sugarhouse (Sukkerhuset) in the Kalvskinnet area of Trondheim, where there had been a sugar refinery since 1754. Sukkerhuset was rebuilt for brewing. The brewery stayed in the building until 1984. The first bottle of Bayerøl, a Munich-style dunkel, was sold in 1857. In 1910, the plant began to produce soft drinks at the brewery as well. Bayerøl was the most important type of beer until the early 20th century when Dahls Pils, a pilsener took over as the most popular beer. In 1966, it was merged with Trondheim Akti Brewery (Trondhjems Aktiebryggeri), which was founded in 1899 and Trondheim Brewery (Trondhjems Bryggeri) which dated to 1919. E.C. Dahls Bryggeri is now owned by Ringnes, part of the Group Carlsberg AS.

name: Brasserie St. James
description: We make beers for all palates. A lot of our beers have been lovingly referred to as so finely crafted that they seem to be made for a serious wine drinkers palate. A saying goes in wine making, "it takes a lot of good beer to make good wine...". The point being, we make complex, delicate, nuanced beers, not just the same typical west coast hop bombs or dark extremely high alcohol brews (though we make quality versions of those too). Our goal is to show the whole spectrum of beer, its history, and its evolution. To show beer its proper reverence, as not only "The people's beverage", but one that pairs as well with food as wine, and when it's skillfully crafted and not over hopped to hide the flaws in production, it does. The truth is, it takes more skill to make a delicate lager, than a double IPA. You would be hard pressed to find anyone more passionate and knowledgeable about beer than myself or my brewer Josh Watterson. We welcome you to come down to our weekly brewery tours, and discuss all things beer, food, wine, or whatever be the topic of the day!

name: Oskar Blues Brewery
description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.

name: The Booth Brewing Co.
description: The Booth Brewing Co. was founded in May 2013. We currently operate seven pubs in Seoul, and recently started operating a brewery in Eureka, California since May 2017. We've been notable for collaborating with Mikkeller to create Taedonggang Pale Ale in May 2015 and for creating label collaboration beers. We are also notable for being joint-venture partners of Mikkeller Bar Seoul since June 2015, introducing cold-chain logistics to the Korea craft beer industry with its subsidiary company The Booth Cold-Chain, crowdfunding 1Bn Korean Won within 24 minutes in February 2017, starting The Beer Week Seoul, which attracts an audience of over 20,000 people, and having its co-founders Heeyoon and Sunghoo enlisted on Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia - Arts in April 2017. We are the first Asian brewery to operate and sell beer from its own facility in the United States, and we like to follow our fun!

name: The Dandy Brewing Company
description: The Dandy Brewing Company is Calgary’s true Nano-Brewery. We produce inspired ales, with lots of care, in very small batches. Our custom built, 3BBL brew-house ensures a keen eye to every detail and fosters creativity in both our recipes and beer styles. Dandy Ales are living beers; naturally conditioned bottles, kegs, and casks. This return to the true ale tradition ensures the living yeast in the unfiltered and unpasteurized beer will continue to work with the premium malt and complex hops from the moment it is pitched in the fermenters, until it passes your lips! We are pleased to offer a top notch tasting room on site where you can taste any or all of our eight taps, including Dandy favourites and special one-off beers. There are also tours and a small shop to pick up a variety of Dandy merchandise! We share a passion for not only brewing, but the people, process, experiences, and personal touches that make the real ale experience so special.

name: Indeed Brewing Company
description: Indeed Brewing Company has a penchant for adventure, both in the beers we brew and the way we go about brewing them. We offer two flagship beers: Day Tripper Pale Ale & Midnight Ryder American Black Ale. We also brew seasonal offerings like Shenanigans Summer Ale, and Stir Crazy Winter Ale. Visit our taproom to to buy 10, 16, or 20-oz. beers, or take home 750 mL bottles of beer. Our tours are available on Saturday's, to sign up, visit our website at IndeedBrewing.com. Indeed Brewing was founding in Feb. 2011, and began production in July 2012, and opened taproom in August 2012. We distribute kegs, 12-oz. cans, and specialty beers in 750 mL bottles.

name: Figueroa Mountain Brewing
description: Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. was founded by father and son team, Jim and Jaime Dietenhofer, in 2010. With a passion for craft beer, they set out to pay homage to the beautiful Santa Ynez Valley with handcrafted beer and hand-drawn artwork depicting the local landscape on their labels. There are currently five taprooms along California’s Central Coast and one taproom set to open in Westlake Village late summer 2015. Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. beer can be found in their taprooms or at select retailers and restaurants throughout California. Learn more about @FigMtnBrew or where to find their beer at www.FigMtnBrew.com.

name: Cedar Creek Brewery
description: Cedar Creek Brewery is located about an hour southeast of Dallas in Seven Points, Texas near the lake for which it is named. The brewery began its life in 2012 with used dairy equipment, ingenuity, and duct tape–let’s just say MacGyver would be proud of some of our early work. We recently upgraded to a 15bbl brewhouse and the original fermentation vessels have been upgraded to 20 bbl and 30 bbl conical fermenters. While we are growing, we still pride ourselves on our quality and consistency.

name: Bull Island Brewing Company
description: Hampton's oldest waterfront brewery. We are a seven barrel brewery offering 10-12 different beers on tap at any given time. We also offer a full menu and live music to our patrons.

name: Žatec Brewery
description: Dear visitor, Zatec is an area which has become famous for its hops. The first hops were grown in 1004 and the brewing followed shortly. The combination of the dark red soil, rich in ferrous oxide (which retains water) and climate allows the region to produce the award winning crop. The Zatec brewery - built in 1801 - is situated inside the Zatec castle walls, overlooking the town and hop fields. The brewery suffered for lack of investment during the Communist years until by 2000 the brew was hardly available even locally, much to the detriment of the Zatec economy. In year 2001 Rolf Munding purchased the brewery from a local business man and began a program of investment which has rejuvenated the brewery and improved the prospects for the beer, brewery and the people of Zatec, both as beer drinkers and brewers. Tomas Lejsek, one of Czech Republic’s leading and most innovative brew masters has masterminded the changes, bringing together new technology, old brewing processes and pure ingredients.
street_address: Žatecký pivovar, spol. s r.o., Žižkovo náměstí 81,

name: Harriet Brewing
description: At Harriet Brewing we emphasize intention as the primary component in recipe development. It's what makes good beer special. We take pride in using our knowledge of traditional beer styles, our open minds, and eclectic pallets to brew both unique and traditional beer styles. Our goal with every recipe is authenticity… to develop a particular character that allows the beer to stand out and be remembered. It's authenticity that we crave as beer drinkers; so, it's authenticity that we strive for as brewers. We study beer, determine what we want, then manifest it! For most of us here, it's not just in brewing; it's a way of life.

name: Ground Breaker Brewing
description: Ground Breaker Brewing is a dedicated gluten-free brewery. Every beer that we make is naturally gluten-free, made in our brewery where no gluten containing items are allowed through the door. We brew, bottle, and distribute our gluten-free beer from our production facility in southeast Portland, Oregon.

name: Tyne Bank Brewery
street_address: Hawick Crescent Ind Est, St Lawrence Rd.

name: Mother Earth Brewing Company
description: Mother Earth Brewing Company is located on the corner of Heritage and North Street in Kinston NC. The facility includes the brewery itself, a bottling facility and Mother Earth’s corporate offices. In keeping with our company name, our rehabilitation of this old building is incorporating green technology, eco-friendly building materials and alternative energy sources wherever possible. Future plans include opening a tap room and offering tours of the brewery. Mother Earth’s four staple beers are a Munich Dunkel, an American IPA (organic), a Belgian Wit and a Kolsch, along with seasonal brews and oak aged beers. Mother Earth will distribute statewide in groceries, restaurants, and bars. Look for Mother Earth products soon..

name: Roth Brewing Company
description: Founded in December of 2008, this company has been working hard to develop beers that can take the world by storm. Before there was a Roth Brewing Company, the guys started as most new breweries do, with homebrewing. After hearing endless rave reviews of their beers, they decided to jump in head first and open this amazing company. It might be said that prophecies were fulfilled on the day that they took up brewing, but only time shall tell..

name: Petoskey Brewing
description: A Michigan Microbrewery. Join us in our Tap Room to experience made-on-premiss hand-crafted beer and light food offerings!

name: Hoyne Brewing Co.
description: Hoyne Brewing Co. is located in Victoria, British Columbia. And while existing among a very saturated brewing industry in the area, Hoyne stands out as one of the best.

name: Fremont Brewing
description: Fremont Brewing was born of our love for our home and history as well as the desire to prove that beer made with the finest local ingredients – organic when possible --, is not the wave of the future but the doorway to beer's history. Starting a brewery in the midst of the Great Recession is clearly an act of passion. We invite you to come along with us and enjoy that passion -- because beer matters. Known as the Center of the Universe, Fremont is industrial and sleekly postmodern -- home to artists, fisherpeople, tradespeople, technology geeks, and lots of beer lovers. And, for those who don't know, Washington state is home to the second largest hop growing region in the world.

name: Ninkasi Brewing Company
description: Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.

name: Rising Tide Brewing Company
description: Rising Tide Brewing Company is a family-owned craft brewery located in Portland, Maine. We specialize in artisanal, hand-crafted ales brewed in small batches. Our beers are available in bottles and on draft in our tasting room in Portland's East Bayside neighborhood and at select locations in Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and Vermont.

name: Firestone Walker Brewing Company
description: Founded in 1996 by Adam Firestone (aka the Bear) & David Walker (aka the Lion), Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft ever better beer. Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer…and never satisfied.

name: Kennebec River Pub & Brewery
description: The Kennebec River Pub & Brewery is located at Northern Outdoors Adventure Resort in the North Woods logging village of The Forks, Maine. Northern Outdoors is New England's most diverse and accessible adventure destination, offering an authentic outdoor experience and first class amenities in any season. The brewery began pouring pints for thirsty woodcutters, rafters, hikers, snowmobilers and tourists at the resort, in January 1997. Kennebec River beers are unfiltered and all natural, with no preservatives, additives or stabilizers. We handcraft our beers with the utmost care, using the finest malted barley, premium domestic and imported hops, superior yeasts, and pure water. Good flavorful beer, brewed in small batches right here in the North Woods of Maine! Cheers!

name: Jack Pine Brewery
description: Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery. I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer. A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods. It turns out, I’m my own worst critic. I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer. Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer? For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide. It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew. I was making some damn good beer! I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota. I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized. I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles. In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP. I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing. It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery. So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan? Start small. Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small. Nanobrewery small. Brewing forty gallons at a time small. Did I mention the brewer is small? This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery. It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment. Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER! I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing. Now it’s your turn. With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer. So, stop in and give it a try!

name: Railway City Brewing Company
description: Railway City Brewing Company is a small micro brewery located in the heart of downtown St.Thomas. We brew many different styles of beer including our Dead Elephant Ale, Iron Spike and monthly Seasonal offerings.

name: Right Brain Brewery
description: Hailed as One of the "Top 5 Local Breweries In The Nation", Right Brain Brewery is known for our culinary inspired beers using only whole ingredients, like Asparagus, Cherry Pies, or smoked Mangalitsa Pig Heads. When we're not busy fending off pirates on the Boardman Lake we like to throw art shows, concerts, and even yoga classes in our brewery. Some people love us, some people hate us, and others just don't understand, but we just want to teach you how to Keep Beer Curious.

name: Port Jefferson Brewing Company
description: Port Jeff Brewing Company is located at 22 Mill Creek Road, within the Chandler Square walking mall. The brewery features a 7 barrel system which is capable of producing 217 gallons (about 86 cases) per brew. Beers are packaged in keg, 22 ounce and special release bottle formats for distribution throughout Long Island, NYC, and West Chester County bars, restaurants, and other retail beer outlets. The facility opened for production in October of 2011.

name: Powderhaus Brewing
description: We make unique beer for the discerning drinker. We're not afraid of bold and adventurous flavors. Coming soon to Boise area.

name: Red Cypress Brewery
description: Production brewery and taproom located in Winter Springs, FL.

name: Black Market Brewing Company
description: Black Market produces high-quality, handcrafted beer. HUMBLE BEGINNINGS. ALWAYS GREAT BEER. A small budget, tight resources, and big goals are what Our first brews were made out of at a small warehouse that was, more realistically, a large garage. On that small 1 bbl brewing system we pinned our dreams and created the much-loved Hefeweizen. FINEST QUALITY INGREDIENTS, FRESHEST QUALITY RESULTS With big dreams for a mircobrewery, Black Market opened to put Temecula, California on the map with a commitment to use only the best malt, hops and yeast, all selected by hand to ensure quality. The results were award-winning products with a reputation for craft excellence. GREAT BEER FROM WINE COUNTRY As one of Temecula’s first craft breweries, Black Market introduced locally brewed beers to the community. Now found far beyond Temecula, Black Market beers are on shelves and in establishments throughout Southern California, Arizona and Washington. LEADING A MOVEMENT Like many craft breweries before us, we have followed stories of those who came before us. We’re proud to have launched the movement in Temecula, to keep inspiring the next waves of great beer with our success, and to continue to lead through our quality process, experimental hop releases, and innovative beers.

name: Trouble Brewing
description: A 100% Irish owned brewery located in Kill, Co. Kildare. We’re dedicated to producing distinctive and outstanding beer from only natural ingredients.

name: Taxman Brewing Company
description: Taxman Brewing Company is dedicated to crafting unique, artisanal Belgian-American ales. Located in Bargersville, IN (30 minutes south of Indianapolis), our brewery and gastropub provide the perfect "farmhouse" destination.

name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
description: Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997. Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent. Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.

name: June Lake Brewing
description: We're focused on making Super Awesome Beer with some of the most amazing water in the world surrounded by the colossal granite spires of the Eastern Sierra.

name: Aachener Brauhaus Degraa
description: When Helmut Schwichtenberg, a descendant of the Degraa Family, secured the trademark rights for DEGRAA in 2007, he laid the cornerstone for a new era. One year later, he commissioned an extensive market research study that showed what a beer from Aachen should taste like. His father, Karl-Heinz Schwichtenberg, was the last DEGRAA master and manager of the DEGRAA restaurant near the town theater for over 20 years. His grandmother, Käthe Schwichtenberg, ran the DEGRAA am Hansemann – better known as the “Os Oche” – for over 25 years. His great grandmother, Katharina Vonderbank, née Degraa, was the head of Josef Degraa Erben KG until her death; Josef Degraa Erben KG had been founded by her father, Josef Degraa, in 1888. Ever since that time, the DEGRAA brand has been well known, even beyond Germany’s borders.

name: Left Coast Brewing
description: Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls. Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks. Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale. We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

name: Figure Eight Brewing
description: Figure Eight Brewing is a small craft brewery located just an hour southeast of Chicago in Valparaiso, Indiana. We believe in making great beer and enjoying life to its fullest. Our mission is to make great beer and share it. Utilizing the best ingredients while synthesizing classic and innovative brewing styles and techniques, riding on the edge of where beer has gone and where beer is going.

name: BearWaters Brewing Company
description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. BearWaters was named in honor of the region's pristine source of mountain water. BearWaters captures the spirit, traditions and majesty of the Great Smoky Mountains. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

name: Black Bear Microbrew
description: Black Bear Brewery is Orono’s family owned and operated microbrewery. We pride ourselves in our hand-crafted small-batch beers made using only the highest quality ingredients and the greatest care to bring you the finest quality products. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do.

name: Lewis & Clark Brewing Company
description: The great explorers are the inspiration for our breweries name and in many ways our brewing style. It's also where we live as we are located in the heart of the only Lewis & Clark County in the US. Our secret ingredient is the pride and craftsmanship added by dedicated people lucky enough to be called Montanans. Since our beginning, we have gone to the greatest of lengths to build one of the most efficient, sophisticated breweries around with one goal in mind: to produce the finest ales and lagers possible and serve them at their peak of freshness.

name: Boerne Brewery
description: We are a microbrewery nestled in the Texas Hill Country. We are small and intend to stay that way. We are from Boerne. We will be brewing in Boerne. Our beer is for the people that live in, work in, and visit Boerne. We are painfully/cheerfully close to completing construction. We will continue to post updates and pictures as things go along.

name: Der Blokken Brewery
description: Woman Owned. Woman Run. Woman Brewed.

name: Three Ranges Brewing Co.
description: A tiny little brewery located in Valemount, BC

name: Lore Brewing Company
description: We are a full service homebrew, vintner and soda supply store that has all of the ingredients and equipment you need to make great beverages at home. Our microbrewery will be opening sometime in late 2011. 10% discount on most supplies and equipment for AHA members, Police, Fire and Active Duty or Retired Military!

name: GoodLife Brewing
description: Located on Bend's Westside. We take our name from the lifestyle that most Bend-ites live. With tons of recreation, sprinkled with hard work and friends make living in Bend truly the GoodLife. The 30 Barrel Brewhouse and fermentation area are the focal point of the huge viewing windows looking out from within the Bier Hall (our Tasting Room) where you can grab a pint of not only our delicious brew but some of our favorite breweries as well. With 5-7 rotating guest taps you’re sure to find a brew to make your GoodLife. Hope to see you for a pint soon ~ Cheers

name: Broken Plow Brewery
description: Come to Greeley, CO to visit Broken Plow! A 7 barrel brewery and taphouse. Live music 3 nights a week.Live Trivia 2 nights a week. A great place to be!

name: Coachella Valley Brewing Co.
description: The Coachella Valley Brewing Co is liquid perfection.

name: Black Raven Brewing Company
description: The Black Raven is a true neighborhood brewery with a retail taproom. We are the Eastside of Seattle's home to world-class, small-batch brewed ales & lagers.

name: CIB Brewery
description: A limited production artisanal nano brewery located in Carson, Iowa. Opened December 21, 2011. To produce full flavored, real beer with the highest quality from local ingredients and sell that beer to our friends and family. CIB is a small batch, production only nano brewery with an emphasis on flavor, evironmental responsibility, local artwork, ingredients, and distribution.

name: Muskoka Brewery
description: Founded by Gary McMullen and Kirk Evans, Muskoka Cottage Brewery opened for business in 1996. The Brewery now employs a team of 18, all dedicated to providing you with the finest experience in hand-crafted beer. Nestled in the heart of Muskoka, Muskoka Cottage Brewery is the Taste of Cottage Country! In keeping with our Muskoka home and surroundings, our goal is to lead our industry in craft beer excellence and innovation, environmentally sound and sustainable practices. Our values at Muskoka Cottage Brewery are to have a respectful, authentic, open and honest relationship with all of our Muskoka customers and business partners. In short, we have a passion for great craft beer and we hope you enjoy it!

name: SanTan Brewing Company
description: Open since 2007 under the leadership of Founder and Brewmaster, Anthony Canecchia, SanTan Brewing Company has established a strong reputation as one of Arizona’s favorite craft breweries. In addition to brewing, SanTan features a friendly neighborhood brewpub in Downtown Chandler, which has quickly become one of the top local food and beer destinations in the Phoenix metro area. In 2009, SanTan Brewing began distributing their Southwestern Style Ales throughout the state of Arizona, operating with a mission to pair craft beer with craft food that would inspire great conversation and good times. 2014 marked the beginning of taking this journey throughout the Southwest and California. Our belief is that Great Craft Beer and Great Craft Food can be the inspiration for the conversations that can change the world!

name: Vermont Beer Company
description: The Vermont Beer Co. can be found at The Perfect Pear CafÃ© in Bradford Vermont. Brewing beer on a 10 gallon system allows us to rotate our beers more often and makes us the smallest brewery in Vermont. We serve our ales exclusively on draft on premise in The Perfect Pear Cafe dining room, out on our deck over-looking the Waits River and coming soon in our new Pub located just under the Pear. Adam Coulter, enthusiastic home brewer and long time chef of The Perfect Pear has turned in his chef coat and turned his attention to upholding the tradition of brewing great beer in Vermont. Featuring beers such as Waits River Red Ale, First Tap India Pale Ale & Devil's Den Brown Porter, The Pear offers two rotating house taps as well as two rotating guest taps showcasing some of the finest microbreweries from New England and beyond.

name: Bank Brewing Company
description: With the construction of our very own brewery in Hendricks, the sun is rising on new opportunities. Located in rural Western Minnesota, our focus will be two-fold. Our taproom that is located in an old bank building on Main Street will be full of faithful local patrons but we are also a destination brewery for the region. The new brewery brings new beer to our lineup. Ales will dominate and hops will be used to extreme proportions. This new lineup of beer will appeal to the craft beer lovers who are seeking out big, flavorful beer but of course we will have a some that appeal to the masses as well. Our brewery operations are housed in a beautiful historic creamery building and the taproom is in an old bank. Our second effort is on distribution through kegs at pubs and liquor stores in the area.

name: Southern Prohibition Brewing
description: Southern Prohibition Brewing launched in April of 2013 with two simple goals: brew great beer and help make Mississippi a great place to live. Our 22,000 sq. ft. warehouse was a furniture showroom when originally constructed in 1941. After some renovations, the microbrewery in Downtown Hattiesburg houses a 20 barrel brewhouse. With three 60 barrel and four 40 barrel fermenters, Southern Prohibition currently has the capacity to produce 5,000 barrels a year.

name: Alligator Brewing
description: The Alligator brewery is a one-bbl in-house brewpub. We usually have at least ten or more rotating beers on draft at any given time. Our focus is on the integration of new styles and old-world brewing methods, with a mindset somewhere in between mild reverence and gleeful irreverence. Alligator is, for now, a very small operation, but we’re working hard to keep things interesting.

name: Florida Beer Company
description: Headquartered in beautiful Cape Canaveral, FL. Florida Beer Company is Florida's state of the art brewery. With 17 years of brewing tradition, Florida Beer Company produces some of Florida's finest craft beer from its new 60,000 sq.ft. facility. Locals and visitor's to Florida's East Coast can enjoy handcrafted favorites like Swamp Ape DIPA, Florida Lager, Devil's Triangle IPA and Sunshine State PILS.

name: Aviator Brewing Company
description: Aviator Brewing Company was started to provide fine ales and lagers in North Carolina. We also got sick of driving to the store all the time to buy beer so we thought...what the heck....lets brew lots of beer and drink most of it ourselves.

name: Scarlet Lane Brewing Company
description: Scarlet Lane Brewing Company’s mission is to be your humble brewer promoting knowledge and continued betterment in the art of beer making. We will have fun while being excellent stewards to the community, the environment and our employees. Beer Cultivates Wisdom and Friendships

name: North Peak Brewing Company
description: The highest quality ingredients and passion of our head brewers Ron Jeffries and John Walsh help to insure every bottle of North Peak beer is brewed to perfection. Everything we do is designed to create ales of outstanding art and flavor. Every beer is brought to life through labor and love. We strive to create beers to lighten the spirit and soothe the soul.

name: Dick's Brewing Company
description: Dick Young started brewing as a home brewer in 1984 and sold homebrew supplies at his business, Northwest Sausage & Deli. When he wasn’t busy handcrafting smoked summer sausage and pepperoni at the deli he was handcrafting small batches of beer. Dick built from scratch a three barrel brew house (which we still use today as our pilot system) to start designing and creating recipes in the back of the deli. The beer was so popular among Dick’s friends that he soon found himself exceeding the annual production limit for homebrewers. In 1992 Dick decided to make his hobby a business and started the application and permit process to create Dick’s Brewing Company. After two years and many batches brewed, and many beers drank, Dick’s Brewing Company became a reality. Dick quickly realized he would need more space for his growing passion and built a 2,100 square foot building adjacent to the deli. He started with the three barrel system and would brew once a week yielding 6 kegs. Initially he focused solely on three beers: Pale, Porter and Dick Danger. Dick Danger Ale, is still our best selling beer to date. When asked why he started the brewery Dick always answered, and I quote, “I started brewing beer for one reason, I was thirsty”. And we are all so grateful he was. The brewery was located behind the Deli on Prather Road from 1995 to 2008. Over those 13 years the brewery grew from 200 bbls in sales in one state to over 3000 bbls in 6 states. New uni tanks and bright tanks were added along with a brand new bottling line to keep up with demand, and Dicks creative passion for brewing also grew, starting with three recipes in 1994 to over twenty different styles in 2009. Life was good and Dick’s Beers were flying out the door. In 2006 Dick set his sights even higher, and he started construction on a new brewing facility. After two long years of work we moved into the brand new 18000 square foot brewing facility on Galvin Road in Centralia. Dick wore many hats and he was so many things to so many people. In 2009 we lost a brewmaster, a friend, a dad, a partner, a son, a teacher, a rebel, an electrician, a plumber, a carpenter, a craftsman, a joker, a complete and unique leader. He will always be remembered and by doing so his vision and his dream will forever live on in every bottle or keg that gets shipped from the warehouse to someone that is thirsty. Today, the Dick’s Brew Crew is led by Dick’s daughter, Julie Young. With the new brewing facility producing 23 different styles and with plenty of room for growth, we feel that the sky is the limit when it comes to Dick’s legacy. All of us here at Dick’s are proud to continue the dream that our founder started, and we are proud to have you all along for the ride.

name: Powerhouse Brewing
description: Power House Brewing Co. located in Columbus, Indiana, is a craft brewery with state wide distribution of its craft beer, made in our Columbus brewing facility.

name: Victory Brewing Company
description: Having trained in Germany, we appreciate the artistic freedom we have here in the US. Here creativity is embraced by a fervent core of consumers and we are happy to serve that audience with our experience in traditional methods, selection of choice, often imported ingredients, and the best processing that technology can offer us. We relish the opportunity to please both ourselves and our audience with our flavorful creations. We've invested more than our lives in this. Take a look at Victory Brewing Company's Beers.

name: Last Best Brewing & Distilling
description: IT’S OUR PRIVILEGE TO BE THE COMMUNITY LIAISON FOR BEER AND BEER CULTURE AND WE DON’T TAKE THIS ROLE LIGHTLY. THE BEERS WE MAKE ARE A DIRECT REFLECTION OF THE VALUES AND PERSONALITIES OF YOU – OUR CUSTOMERS AND OUR COMMUNITY.

name: Twin Peaks Brewing Co.
description: Located inside the Twin Peaks restaurant at the N. Irving, Texas location. This system has a 10,000 bbl. annual capacity and will supply all of the Twin Peaks locations in Texas.

name: OysterHouse Brewing Company
description: The Oyster House is a small micro brewery devoted to producing high quality, unique ales for beer and seafood lovers.

name: Olde Burnside Brewing Company
description: The Olde Burnside Brewing Co.is a spinoff of our family-owned ice manufacturing business, The Burnside Ice Co., which was founded in 1911 (more history). While our brews may enjoy universal appeal, our marketing theme is clearly Scottish in flavor. In keeping with our roots, we add a bit of Celtic color in all we do, including our sponsorship of a local bagpipe band, Manchester Regional Police & Fire Pipe Band, as well as our local rugby team, The Hartford Wanderers. Come fall, join us at “Pipes in the Valley,” Connecticut’s premier Celtic music festival, showcasing the finest local and world renowned Celtic talents.

name: Big Choice Brewing
description: Big Choice Brewing is a microbrewery owned by Nathaniel Miller, his wife Andrea and Tyler Ruse, all Colorado natives that want to make great beer for their local communities. Come by the tasting room and see what the Big Choice is all about.

name: Meridian Hive Meadery
description: Artisan crafted honey wines in Austin, Texas. Filling your glass with history in the New World.

name: Steel Toe Brewing
description: Here at STB we believe in working our ass off for what we believe in, following our passion, giving back to and working with the community that supports us, being conscious of the world around us, producing the best quality product we can and kicking back with great beer at the end of the day. We are a small MN craft brewery with big dreams of staying small.

name: Atlas Brew Works
description: A packaging craft brewery in the District of Columbia. Atlas Brew Works focuses on providing D.C. with fresh, craft ales and lagers.

name: Powell Street Craft Brewery
description: Powell Street Craft Brewery is a nano-brewery focused on producing high quality full flavoured handcrafted beers using all natural, and preferably, local ingredients. The brewery is located at 1830 Powell Street just west of Victoria Drive in an area that is quickly becoming Vancouver's "Brewery District".

name: Broad Ripple Brewing
description: The Broad Ripple Brewpub, established in 1990, was the first Brewpub in Indiana and is the oldest microbrewery currently operating in the state. Our beers have won many awards over the years and we've been named Best Brewpub by both the restaurant reviewers and readers of every local publication dozens of times, making us the most decorated Brewpub, and one of the most well loved restaurants in the city of Indianapolis.

name: Revival Brewing Company
description: Brewers of fine malted beverages headed up by award winning brew master Sean Larkin.

name: Lake Norman Brewing Company
description: Lake Norman Brewing Company is a family owned and operated microbrewery located in Mooresville, NC. We specifically chose the name “Lake Norman” due to the Lake’s prominence and the vitality it represents to the population that thrives around it. Whether you love Lake Norman as your home or get-away, for the boating, the sunsets, the watersports, the swimming or the fishing, we are excited to be part of phenomenon known to the locals as the “Lake Life”.

name: Phantom Ales and Ciders
description: We love fermenting things. Malted Barley, Grapes, Apples, Honey, Peaches, Pears,... I'm not sure where this will end. We are a nano Brewery, Cidery, Winery, and soon to be Meadery. We create fresh menus every week filled with items designed to pair with our great beers, ciders, and wine.

name: Venice Duck Brewery
description: We are two bartenders from Venice Beach who love good beer. Venice Duck was inspired by a local legend of a guy who went to a party in the Venice canals and woke up the next day on the sidewalk covered with ducks. We incorporate the Venice culture into our beers and truly believe in the power of the flock, our community. We like to say we are the” unofficial” sponsor of Venice events. We are part of the Venice Chamber of Commerce and participate in local events.

name: Hop Dogma Brewing Company
description: Hop Dogma Brewing Company is proud to bring you creative hand-crafted ales and lagers made from the highest quality ingredients. We specialize in small batches and adventurous brews! Come on by and taste the difference!

name: Conshohocken Brewing Company
description: Conshohocken Brewing Company is founded on the same American industrial spirit as the borough for which our brewery is named. Conshohocken was an industrial national hub in the late 1800s – a time of bowler hats, small local breweries and velocipede bicycles. We are carrying that same spirit forward through our hand crafted beers and our personal commitment to each and every beer we brew. Brewing in small batches, each of our beers is uniquely crafted, allowing us to share innovative, fresh, high quality beers with the good people of our communities. In addition to making beer we love, we have big plans to give back to the community and create a socially responsible brewery. We look forward to raising our glasses with all of our neighbors and friends, both near and far.

name: Simpleton Craft Ales
description: Simpleton Craft Ales is a San Francisco brewing company. Our focus is to create delicious, balanced, hop-forward ales.

name: Two Brothers Brewing Company
description: Two Brothers Brewing Company was founded by Jim and Jason Ebel in late 1996. In the past 20 years, the brand has expanded to include a 40,000-square-foot brewing facility in Warrenville, Illinois, Two Brothers Tap House adjacent to the brewery, the 70,000-square-foot Two Brothers Roundhouse in Aurora, IL, Two Brothers Tap House and Brewery in Scottsdale, Arizona, The Craftsman by Two Brothers in Naperville, IL and, most recently, Two Brothers Social Tap in Oak Park, IL. Two Brothers Brewing Company offers seven year-round beers, 12 seasonals and a number of artisan project releases throughout the year. Other Two Brothers ventures include Two Brothers Coffee Roasters, Arizona Beer and Cider distribution company out of Phoenix, Arizona. Producing award-winning products with unparalleled passion, Two Brothers Brewing Company remains 100% family owned and staunchly independent.

name: Crooked Can Brewing
description: Built upon the founders’ passion for craft beer, Crooked Can Brewing Company is an upstart craft brewery built inside the Plant St. Market located in Historical Downtown Winter Garden, Florida. The brewery represents a unique image and creates a cultural following for a way of life. The brand represents a free spirit, laid-back approach, but with a purpose! We produce quality craft beer consistently, with excellent taste and unique quality. The brewing process is monitored under the close personal attention of an award winning experienced brewmaster to ensure the vision is reached batch after batch using traditional brewing methods. The Brewery has an onsite tap and tasting room featuring 4 flagship brands in addition to many other limited edition, seasonal, and specialty batches.

name: MicroBrasserie Charlevoix
description: C'est au coeur de Baie-Saint-Paul, que sont brassées les bières d'inspiration belge "Dominus Vobiscum" Blanche, Ambrée, Double et Triple, ainsi que les bières "Vache Folle" ESB et Milk Stout. Depuis maintenant 1998, les brasseurs charlevoisiens, ne cessent de laisser libre cours à leur imagination afin de satisfaire les amateurs les plus exigeants de bières spéciales. Depuis janvier 2009, les opérations ont été transférées dans de nouvelles installations plus modernes et plus efficaces permettant d’augmenter la capacité de production afin de mieux répondre à la demande. Les produits de la MicroBrasserie sont disponibles dans les meilleurs restaurants, auberges et épiceries de la région de Charlevoix, ainsi que dans certains points de vente à travers le Québec.

name: Four Day Ray Brewing
description: A soft, easy life is not worth living. Neither is a life spent nose to the grindstone without a cold beer at the end of the day to enjoy the fruit of your labors. We dare to be great in industry and revelry alike. We’ll never water down or sacrifice flavor for fashion, and we hold every dish from our scratch kitchen to the same high standard. Our name recalls our Nickel Plate District heritage, drawn from the nickname for a railroad employee who called off work one day a week. Like those laborers of yesteryear, we strive mightily that we may celebrate heartily. They made Fishers a place to live. We’ll make Fishers a place to love—putting in the work to push our city forward and knocking back a pint to celebrate a job well done.

name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2009 in beautiful Decorah, Iowa after a runaway success in home brewing TG is a quickly growing brewery. In less than a decade TG has become world renown for it’s IPA’s and barrel-aged stouts, distributes to over eight states and has over 30 beer varieties. In order to meet overwhelming demand, construction on a new 100-barrel facility which will house a taproom, restaurant, brewery in one location has begun. TG prides its self in crafting truly top shelf beer and is honored to be growing with the support of its many customers worldwide.

name: Berghoff Brewery, Inc
description: Berghoff’s history as a beer brand goes back over 120 years, and in that time it has developed a reputation of high quality and consistency. The first batch of Berghoff beer was brewed in Fort Wayne, Indiana in 1887 by Herman Berghoff and his three brothers. Herman’s desire to expand the market for the family’s beer led him to sell the product at the Chicago World’s Fair where it received high acclaim. Since then, Berghoff has continued its success and relevance in the Chicago market and beyond. As the craft beer market has evolved, the brand has received fresh, exciting updates. Berghoff changed its brewing location and is now proudly brewed at Point Brewery in Stevens Point, Wisconsin. Berghoff has also refreshed itself with updated recipes and packaging. With consulting from brewing experts Randy Mosher and John Hannafan, Berghoff’s new, top-notch beers are ready to satisfy consumer demand. As the brewery looks to the future, Berghoff beer will continue to evolve as trends change, but will always maintain its roots as an authentic German-style brew whose history and tradition will never be forgotten.

name: Pelican Brewing Company
description: Welcome to the Pelican Pub Brew House. Darron Welch is the Brew Master here at the Pub. Before becoming the Brew Master, Darron was an assistant brewer for Adler Brau Brewery in Appleton, Wisconsin, but before that, he home brewed for many years in his hometown of Eugene, Oregon. Darron was a key player in the creation of the Pelican Pub Brewery. He helped build the Pelican Pub from the ground up, designing the brewery layout and production flow as well as all of the fine Pelican beers.

name: Yazoo Brewing Company
description: Yazoo Brewing began as just a dream, stoked by years of homebrewing in the basement. Linus and Lila Hall moved to Nashville from Mississippi in 1996, with Linus going to work as a tire engineer for Bridgestone and Lila as a curator for the Parthenon. Trying to make tires more round proved to be less fulfilling than making great beer, so with the encouragement of Lila, Linus quit his job, got a business degree from Vanderbilt and a craft-brewing education through a course at the American Brewer's Guild, and did an internship under Garrett Oliver at Brooklyn Brewery. Linus found a used 10 bbl brewing system from a brewpub in Iowa that had gone out of business, and went to work restoring a corner of the old Marathon Motorworks building for their brewery. Yazoo Brewing opened for business in Oct 2003, and quickly gained an enthusiastic local following.

name: Percival Beer Company
description: ercival Beer Company was discovered in 2010, but wasn't launched until 2012. After home brewing for over three years, we felt compelled to share our great beer with other beer drinkers and our community. Our desire was to brew and distribute quality Craft Beer Brands that can be enjoyed and appreciated by all, not just a few. In addition, we wanted to help showcase the diverse personalities of Boston. Thus, PBC set out to develop brands which directly represented the diverse neighborhoods that make up Boston, Massachusetts. In particular, we focused our efforts at spotlighting the multi-ethnic neighborhood of Dorchester.

name: Crooked Lane Brewing Co.
description: A 15-barrel craft beer brewing company specializing in a variety of traditional English ales, German lagers, and West Coast style IPAs

name: Boston Beer Company
description: Today, we're a team of about 750 people, and we all share a common passion for bringing great Samuel Adams beers to beer lovers everywhere. We've worked hard and are incredibly proud of the many successes we've enjoyed over the years. The Boston Beer Company has been cited as one of the best companies to work for by Boston Magazine, one of the Best Entry-Level Jobs by The Princeton Review, and our beers have won more awards than any other in history. Jim has been named an "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Inc. Magazine. Our brewers keep amazing us with innovative new brews, including Samuel Adams Utopias and our Samuel Adams Barrel Room Collection. Jim has believed from the beginning that the more you know and understand about beer, the more you'll appreciate a beer like Samuel Adams Boston Lager. To begin that mission, all new employees go through intensive training on everything from ingredients, brewing, and beer styles, to taking care of the beer once it leaves the brewery. We're all beer lovers and protectors of the beer so we're trained how to identify off flavors and how to troubleshoot the causes. The passion for beer continues with an annual homebrew competition that we all take part in. One of our wholesalers once asked Jim why he invested so much in training his people, when ultimately they might leave. Jim smiled and replied without hesitation: "What if I didn't train them, and they stayed?" Each year, usually in January, everyone gathers together. One of the highlights of the meeting is the beer trivia contest. With a culture so steeped in beer education and knowledge, winning is a pretty big deal. Recently, one of the hotel bartenders who was watching as the various teams arrived in costume with music and much enthusiasm and fanfare, said, "I've always known Samuel Adams made the best beer in America, but now I see this is the greatest company in America." When you look around you see that The Boston Beer Company is a team of enthusiastic people who are passionate about beer and who really love coming to work every day to provide American drinkers with the best beer possible. The Boston Beer Company, Inc. is a publicly-traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol, SAM.

name: Long Trail Brewing Co
description: Long Trail Brewery is a microbrewery located in Bridgewater, Vermont, USA. It was opened in May of 1989 by Andy Pherson, who now serves both as the company's president and brewmaster. The company's first brewery was located in the basement of the Bridgewater Woolen Mill in Vermont's Green Mountains, but by 1995 the company had become popular enough that it was able to relocate to a state-of-the-art brewery and visitor center (featuring an open-air deck overlooking the Ottaquechee River) in Bridgewater Corners, VT.

name: Double Dizzy Brewery
description: We started with a man and his dream. Our founder, Leigh loved sampling beers but felt that something was missing. After some encouragement from his friends, and a loving and understanding wife, he decided to start making his own. As it turned out, he was a natural Brewmaster. That was 3 years ago. Today, the brewery has grown from a single pot on a stove, to a three vessel BCS system and continues to expand. At Double Dizzy we’re passionate about making beer and drinking beer!

name: Flying Dog Brewery
description: The Flying Dog Legend begins in 1983, and like every good legend there are several versions of this tale. The villains of the peace in this story are two non-conformist, 'not likely to take it lying down' ranchers named George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre. As George tells it, he and 11 of his closest friends and family decided to embark on what they called an “amateur mountaineering expedition” to climb K2 in the Himalayas. Under-qualified and unprepared, they started their journey with a Sherpa, a donkey, and a suitcase full of contraband. Naturally, half way through the trip the contraband was gone and the Sherpa and donkey had run off, leaving George and his group to fend for themselves. Luckily, everyone managed to make it off the mountain alive, and with a new outlook on life. Horn Dog Denver Colorado BeerLike any good beer drinker would at the end of an experience like that, George and his group found a local Pakistani hotel bar to have a drink in. Now, alcohol is banned in most Muslim nations, but if you sign an affidavit stating you are the son of a Christian, it’s like a license to drink. George gladly signed away and got down to some serious drinking. That’s about the time he noticed a painting in the Flashman Hotel of a Flying Dog hanging on the wall that had been drawn by a local artist. Now, we all know dogs don’t fly, but nobody told this particular dog it couldn’t fly, just like no one had told George and his friends they couldn’t make this extraordinary journey. The Flying Dog became a symbol that George and his group used to describe what had happened to them with the mantra, “it is amazing what you can achieve if nobody tells you that you can't.

name: Rockyard Brewing Company
description: Douglas County, Colorado's oldest, and Castle Rock's onliest Brew Pub. Serving up American Grill and Crafted Beer since 1999.

name: Wabasha Brewing Company
description: St. Paul’s first craft brewery to open on the west side of St. Paul, just a stones-throw from the Wabasha Caves. Come on in, enjoy a pint and take a growler of your favorite brew home with you.

name: Navigation Brewing Company
description: Our passion is brewing quality handcrafted ales.

name: Six Row Brewing Company
description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!

name: Mammoth Brewing Company
description: Mammoth Brewing Co. has been brewing award-winning beers since 1995. We brew in the Whiskey Creek building, but our Tasting Room is about 2 blocks away at 94 Berner Street, behind the Village's parking lot in the second white building. Open daily 10am - 6pm.

name: Rooie Dop
description: Rooie Dop is a craft brewery from Utrecht, The Netherlands. Rooie Dops wants to make awesome beer. Flavorful, sometimes experimental beer. Brewers and craft beer drinkers are passionate about beer and want to have a good time and good beer. And we totally agree on that. We like to brew flavorful, interesting beers. American beer styles, such as a hoppy India pale ale and a full bodied imperial stout, are our favorites. However, we also like to use unconventional ingredients in traditional beers as well. We dont’ care about style guidelines, we care about flavor. Also Rooie Dop does a lot of collaboration brews. We’ve already made collaborations with breweries from the Netherlands, England, Denmark and Brazil. It’s fun to develop a recipe together and to learn from each other.
