name: August Schell Brewing Company
description: The August Schell Brewing Company is a brewing company in New Ulm, Minnesota. It was founded by German immigrants August Schell and Jacob Bernhardt in 1860 and passed into the possession of the Schell family in 1866. It is the second oldest family-owned brewery in America and became the oldest and largest brewery in Minnesota when the company bought the Grain Belt rights in 2002.

name: Hellbent Brewing Company
description: We opened our doors in Lake City, Seattle in 2015. Our goal was simply to contribute to the Northwest’s already sterling reputation for serving great craft beer. We were fortunate to occupy a converted 70s-era Chinese restaurant, which we gutted and re-converted into a 20-barrel brewery and 3,000sf tavern that includes an event space, game room, and patio. Lake City and the surrounding neighborhoods have welcomed us with open arms. We’re proud to be served in some of Seattle’s finest restaurants and its most cherished dives. Thanks to this wonderful community and our masterful brewer, Brian, we have survived our first year and are able to offer an array of delicious ales year-round, as well as seasonal lagers and Belgian styles. Please, check us out when you can.

name: Airways Brewing Company
description: Friendly service and tasty beer make us a favorite of locals as well as beer enthusiasts from all over. Special and seasonal beers make a frequent appearance. Our tap room has bar seating as well as small tables. On sunny days, garden seating is available. Airways opened on March 4, 2010. Founder and brewer Alex Dittmar has had a lifelong passion for 60′s era jetliners. Airways is a combination of his love for airplanes, good beer, and a connection with people from all over the world.

name: Brainerd Lakes Beer
description: Brainerd Lakes Beer. Giving you a taste of the laidback lifestyle found only in Minnesota's lake country. It has long been said that a beer is only as good as the place it was born. (Okay, so we made that up...but that doesn't make it any less true.) So we (and by we, we mean a couple of local guys) set out to create a Minnesota beer that embodies the laidback lifestyle of one of the greatest places on earth. We want this page to be all about you. We welcome your input, thoughts, feelings, tips on fishing hotspots...whatever you feel inclined to share and discuss. Talk to us about beer, Minnesota beer, Brainerd beer, beer making, beer brewing, IPA, wheat beer, lager, stout (can you tell we like to talk shop?) or anything else that comes to mind.

name: Brasserie Fischer
description: The Fischer brewery was founded in 1821 in Strasbourg, in the Alsace region in France, and moved to Schiltigheim in 1854, apparently because of the good quality of water there. In 1922, they took over the neighbouring Adelshoffen brewery and became Groupe Pêcheur (the French translation of the German Fischer). Groupe Pêcheur was in turn taken over by Heineken in 1996. In 2008 Heineken announced that it would close the brewery by the end of 2009 and transfer its production to the l'Espérance (en: hope) brewery, also in Schiltigheim.

name: Cape Ann Brewing Company
description: Visit our brew house, enjoy a pint, and take a free tour! Taste our specialty craft beers on draft and brewed on premise. Growlers and growler refills are available. Beer whose bold flavor and character reflects the spirit and courage of the sailors of the North Atlantic fishing fleet, Fisherman's is a tribute to hard work and a salute to friendships that endure. Cape Ann Brewing Co. is an award-winning, family-owned, microbrewery in the heart of downtown Gloucester on Cape Ann, Massachusetts

name: Lion Brewery
description: With a proud brewing heritage dating back to 1905, The Lion Brewery merges rustic architecture with state-of-the-art brewing technology, a contrast typified by the gleaming stainless steel aging tanks that sit alongside the traditional copper brew kettle. Our brewing process utilizes the traditional English method of upward infusion mashing in our combination mash lauter tun to create lagers and ales inspired by old world values, but with modern quality and consistency. The staff at The Lion Brewery is dedicated to producing true handcrafted beers, made right here in our century-old Brewhouse. All of our premium beers are made using only the four basic ingredients allowed by the Reinheitsgebot, or German purity law. Under the skillful supervision of our Master Brewer, Leo Orlandini, each of our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches using only the finest hops and malts available to guarantee the highest quality and freshness. Each product we brew is an original recipe especially created to deliver a fuller flavor than ordinary beers, yet with an approachable style and character. As a result, our beers have garnered numerous medals from the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Championships in recent years. In 1974 the Lion Brewing Company bought the Stegmaier Brand.

name: Olympic Brewery
description: Olympic Brewery S.A. is a purely Greek and fast evolving company that was set up in January 2010. It owns the lager FIX Hellas brand, the first and most historical Greek beer and the premium lager FIX Dark brand, which created a new category in the domestic market of black beer. The ultra-modern privately owned brew house of Olympic Brewery, where all the products are produced, is located in Ritsona area, in Evia. Since its establishment, Olympic Brewery has demonstrated that, alongside its investment program, it focuses on the development of the beer market in Greece, its great contribution to the national economy, the responsible investment on raw material and the support of the Greek farmers and producers. At the same time, Olympic Brewery is an example of a healthy Greek business overseas as it exports its high quality and tasty Greek beer to several dynamic international markets.

name: Somerville Brewing Company
description: Slumbrew is all about the synergy between craft products and every day consumption. Well conceived, locally-sourced, quality products should be an every day part of our lives – not a unique occurrence. This is the spirit of Slumbrew. Slumbrew is the research & development brand and concept of Somerville Brewing Company. Our mission is to brew unique, ingredient-driven beers that challenge common notions of what a beer should taste like. It is the result of nearly 15 years of beer travel and research by Caitlin Jewell and Jeff Leiter; and a decade of Jeff’s homebrewing recipe formulation. We produce a lot of small-run, pilot beers at the Slumbrew Beerlab, but only a small number make their way to commercial production. The Somerville Brewing Company contracts with regional breweries to make the best recipes for wide-spread commercial release, but each recipe is an evolving process of refinement. This model for beer production provides an opportunity to experiment with innovative local ingredients to produce craft beers that stand apart from typical formulations.

name: Grey Sail Brewing of Rhode Island
name_short_display: Grey Sail Brewing of Rhode Island
description: Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's newest microbrewery. Proudly located in the seaside city of Westerly, Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's premier microbrewery equipped to produce up to 4,000 barrels of handcrafted beer per year.

name: Flatrock Brewing Company
description: Not very many people know about the pre-prohibition brewing traditions of Northwest Ohio. Many communities had their very own brewery selling quality beers to thirsty local customers. Flatrock Brewing Cmopany would like to continue this tradition by offering local high quality micro brewed beers. Flatrock Brewing Company produces beers using fresh grain and locally sourced ingredients including honey and seasonal fruits. With the brewery expansions we also plan on hiring local brewery employees and sales people.

name: Funky Bow Brewery and Beer Company
description: We are a small 6.5 BBL brewery specializing in beer!

name: Drumconrath Brewing Company
description: North Dakota's first small town brewery since 1890. Brewing American beer with an Irish spirit. Bród agus Díograis - Pride and Passion.

name: Cable Car
description: Harkening back to old world brewing styles, Cable Car handcrafts each and every small batch. Take the Cable Car home.

name: Flecks SteirerBier
description: FLECKS: More than beer… In 2014, Vinzenz and Michael Fleck opened FLECKS Steirerbier – the largest and most entertaining private craft-brewery of Austria. Here they brew delicious beer specialties, all of them surprisingly full-bodied and fruity. They use solar energy but no genetic engineering. Thereby the family business applies its extensive experience: FLECKS exports brewing equipment with its own Styrian brewing technology into the whole world for meanwhile 20 years. Furthermore, FLECKS Steirerbier is full of passion for art and culture. That’s why this brewery is also a show brewery which provides a very special guided tour: Lots of unexpected and entertaining moments are ensured, when the so-called “BierVerführer” presents the world of brewing art. It’s a spectacle full of music and poetry which culminates when the brewery systems and tanks come alive to talk and sing a serenade. The show is followed by a beer tasting, which is anything but usual as well.

name: Tin Whiskers Brewing Company
description: Tin Whiskers is the perfect place to be for the beer nerds and non-nerds alike. We bring our electrical engineering backgrounds into our brewery from our beer names, listing our ingredients and aspects of the brewing process, branding, circuit board flight holders and how we create new beers. In the taproom we share the stage the beer is in with so everyone knows where the beer is at in its life cycle development. For the thirsty, we will have seasonal offerings, year-round beers, and prototyped small batch recipes at our taproom. Whether our beers are the creation from the brewing masterminds at Tin Whiskers, or a collaboration with a local homebrewer, we promise to always have something on tap that you’ll love. Come in and enjoy a pint or a flight of our beers on our circuit board flight holders. You can enjoy our beers at our taproom, in numerous bars throughout the Twin Cities or at home with a growler or 22oz bomber. Tin Whiskers Brewing Company has a home in St. Paul in the historic Rossmor building. Our neighborhood isn't quite downtown nor Lowertown. You can find us in our gorgeous space at 125 E 9th St, St. Paul, Minnesota, 55101.

name: Mad River Brewing Company
description: Mad River Brewing company is now in our third decade of operation and even now it is hard to think of what we do as a business and not as a hobby. Brewing is a passion here and we spend a great deal of our time trying to perfect the next great taste. At Mad River Brewing company we pride ourselves on the fact we are still here because of you. Without your support and your love for our passion we would not have made it this far. We love to hear from you so if you have something you wish to say good or bad by all means send us an email.

name: Cigar City Brewing
description: Cigar City Brewing, makers of Jai Alai and Hunahpu’s Imperial Stout, was founded in 2009 by Joey Redner with the goal of creating quality beer that reflected the flavors and history of the Tampa region. This unique perspective resonated with the local and national markets alike and the brewery has quickly grown from 1,000 barrels of beer in 2009 to an excess of 65,000 barrels produced in 2016. The 2016 partnership with Oskar Blues of Lyons, Colorado ushered in a new era of growth for this Florida-based organization, with new markets and technologies on the horizon. Cigar City Brewing. Hecho a Mano. Born in Tampa, Florida.

name: Tampa Bay Brewing Company
description: Our family founded the Tampa Bay Brewing Company in 1996 to satisfy Tampa Bay’s thirst for a better beer and great food at a reasonable price. It’s still a family affair, with mother and son serving as general manager and brewmaster respectively. Our original location was a two-story brick building that used to house horses on 15th Street here in the historic Ybor City district. Needing more space for our ever-growing fan base, we moved to our current location on the plaza level of Centro Ybor in 2006 with both indoor and open-air patio seating.

name: James River Brewery
description: James River Brewery is housed in a historic 19th century tobacco warehouse on the main street of Scottsville, VA (a river town along the James River). Come enjoy a beer in our rustic taproom or in the beer garden alongside Mink Creek.

name: Big Rock Chop House & Brewery
description: djoining the restaurant is a 1,950-square-foot brew house, with custom-designed, state-of-the-art equipment. Award-winning Brewmaster Dan Rogers has created four signature beers to complement the restaurant’s distinctive American fare: Norm’s Raggedy Ass Ale, Raymondo El Rojo, Flying Buffalo Stout and Weizenheimer Hefe Weizen. In addition to the four regular beers, Rogers adds a seasonal and specialty brew, which he changes frequently. A testament to their focus on quality, Big Rock Chophouse has been the proud recipient of Gold and Bronze medals at the annual World Beer Championships. All beer is available to go by purchasing one of our growlers. Tours of the brew house are also available by request.

name: Forbidden Root Restaurant & Brewery
description: Forbidden Root is introducing a new line of craft botanical beer using natural ingredients including herbs, spices, barks, roots, honeys, stems, seeds, nuts, vanilla bean and cacao beans. We brew our beers in Chicago, IL with all natural ingredients and inspiration from early American brewing – when native plants and botanicals were a natural part of the rich, delicious beers of that forgotten era.

name: BrickStone Brewery
description: Hand-Crafted Award Winning Brews!!

name: Draught Horse Brewery
description: Draught Horse Brewery will brew beer for businesses so that those establishments can sell their own branded craft beer, a high-quality signature house brew. This unique concept will be marketed by Draught Horse Brewery as “Brew-4-U”, a program that allows bars and restaurants --- that do not have the manufacturing Facility or brewmaster knowledge --- to brew their own unique beers. These establishments can now offer their own personal house brand tap. DHB will focus on its Brew-4-U Program with both In House and Distributor Keg sales. In addition, the manufacturing location will have a Taproom featuring both DHB craft beers as well as select DHB-brewed restaurant brands. Not only will DHB brew for businesses, owners will actually have the chance to try our product in our taproom!

name: Founding Fathers Brewing Company
description: Did you know that the best selling beers in America are produced by foreign-owned companies? As Americans we believe the values and ideas that motivated our Founding Fathers are worth conserving. By developing a brand name that is associated with these same principles and beliefs, Americans will be able to pave the direction of our great Country with the purchase of the New American beer, Founding Fathers Lager and Light. 50% of all profits will be donated back to the families of our troops. Better Beer, Better Cause. When you see a Founding Fathers label in your local grocery or watering hole, you will associate it with the level of excellence that has made America the greatest Country in the World.

name: Voodoo Brewing Company
description: Brewers of Artisan Beer Styles and is not a brewpub.

name: Franconia Brewing Company
description: With a brewing heritage that dates back to the 1800's, Franconia Brewing Company is more than just a local brewery, it's the essence of the true Bavarian brew. By combining the local accessibility of North Texas with our German/heritage/history we are going to provide the fine people of North Texas with a taste of some of the most genuine and freshest Bavarian beer available. Franconia Brewing Company not only delivers the freshest brews to your favorite restaurants, pubs, and taverns, we also have adopted many green practices to help improve the environmental concerns in North Dallas.

name: Oak Park Brewing Co.
description: Oak Park, Illinois' first brewpub. Located in the heart of the Hemingway District in Oak Park. We brew a broad spectrum of ales, with a focus on sustainability.

name: Cool Springs Brewery
description: Brewpub with a focus on innovation and unique brewing styles. We utilize multiple yeast strains and techniques to develop traditional sours, and Belgian style beer. We also love the hops, and most of CSB's pales represents a PNW hop characteristic.

name: Spaten-Franziskaner-Bräu
description: Spaten has been a leading exporter of German beer for more than a century. We played a crucial role in establishing the present superior worldwide reputation for German beer. The basis of our continuously expanding export figures was a healthy pioneering spirit that led us to set up a network of committed import partners at an early date. Today people all over the world take pleasure in drinking original Spaten beers, not only in the neighbouring states of France, Austria and Switzerland, but also in Italy, Spain, Scandinavia and the United States.

name: Coppertail Brewing Co.
description: Coppertail Brewing Co is an independently owned production brewery and tasting room in the Ybor neighborhood of Tampa, FL. It was founded on the desire to bring more quality, Florida-brewed beer to the thirsty masses. Florida Inspired. Tampa Brewed.

name: Laurelwood Brewing Company
description: Hi, my name is Mike De Kalb, and I’m the co-owner of Laurelwood Public House & Brewery in Portland, Oregon. My wife Cathy and I started Laurelwood in 2001 because we wanted a place where family and friends could meet in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. My restaurants are non-smoking and family-friendly. And the beer? World class. Brewing Portland’s first certified organic beers, and a host of other tasty brews. We’ve received a number of awards including Champion Brewery at the 2004 World Beer Cup. Led by Brewmaster Vasilios Gletsos, our brewers create all our beers using only the finest ingredients. Stop by one of our three public houses and or one of our two Portland airport locations for a pint and a meal. Make sure when you are out and about that you ask for Laurelwood beer at your favorite Oregon or Washington pub.

name: Black Diamond Brewing Company
description: Unwind after a day on the slopes or, more likely, a day in the office, with a hand-crafted Black Diamond brew at our Concord brewing facility. Your taste buds will immediately appreciate the finest of ingredients that go into making our exceptionally refreshing and flavorful beers, and you will feel right at home in our welcoming Tap Room. Sample some of our famous ales and enjoy a tour of our brewery - you will quickly realize why our seasoned Brewmaster is a multiple award-winning brewer. You have worked hard. Give yourself a break. Let Black Diamond Brewing help you and your friends dial down from a day of 'shredding' on the slopes or at the office.

name: Birdsong Brewing Co.
description: In 2010, Chris Goulet grew tired of the corporate grind and Tara Goulet was ready to take a break from managing a bread franchise. One of the other bakers from her company, Conor Robinson, was learning how to homebrew. Chris thought Charlotte was missing a small neighborhood brewery where folks could stop in for a pint or take home a growler of super-fresh, unfiltered, American-style ale. They invited a handful of close friends over to pitch a business plan and serve Conor’s beer, and the Birdsong Brewing Co. was born. Birdsong started in 2011 with just two full-time employees. Since then, we’ve brewed all kinds of exciting beers. Thanks to the overwhelming response, we’ve since purchased a 17,000-square-foot building in the Belmont neighborhood with a new 30-barrel brewhouse and room for up to 1,200 barrels of fermentation capacity. Our new taproom opened at the corner of N. Davidson St & Belmont Ave, just outside of uptown Charlotte in April 2015. The brewery has become what it is today thanks to hardworking, creative and passionate employees. At Birdsong, #CanDoWillDo is the philosophy behind what we brew, how we think and what we believe.

name: American Dream Brewing
description: American Dream Brewing is a craft brewery coming to Simi Valley soon, offering quality, handcrafted, fresh, brewed beers for both wholesale and retail distribution. We will have an on-premise tasting room to experience the full flavor taste of our craft brewed beers. We create both traditional beer styles as well as new styles with unique twists. American Dream Brewing Company understands the passion that surrounds beer. We pour that passion into every drop of our beer. It’s that love to enjoy the best tasting beer that we use the highest quality ingredients. We look forward to inviting you to enjoy the American Dream by drinking our beers and celebrating life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness!

name: Vindication Brewing Co.
description: A Brewery Founded on the Principles of Craft and Precision, with an Obsession for the Details of Quality, and a Belief in the Power of Beer to Bring People Together.

name: Sawtooth Brewery
description: Sawtooth Brewery is Ketchum's local brewery. Come see us in the tap room for a pint from one of our 13 craft beers on draft!

name: Cycle Brewing
description: The beer-making innovations of Doug Dozark at Peg's Cantina have inspired a new venture - Cycle Brewing. Doug, with the assistance of brew team Eric Trinosky and Kristina Kirk, have plans to take the brews he made famous at Peg's to St Pete and beyond.

name: Sociable Cider Werks
description: Sociable is driven by a pretty simple vision. Cider should be much more than the lightly-alcoholic, made-from-concentrate, sweet apple juice boxes that currently dominate the shelf space. Sociable ciders are well carbonated, dry and always made from real apples. Simply put, they should be enjoyed like great draught beer. Sociable is not just hard cider, we're much more.

name: Friars' Brewhouse
description: Friars' Brewhouse is located on the 34 acre grounds of St. Elizabeth Monastery perched on the side of Orcutt Mountain. The Franciscan Brothers of St. Elizabeth of Hungary are the friars that produce these artisan brews. Friars' Brewhouse beer is exclusively available at Bangor Wine and Cheese Co.

name: Het Brouwcafe
description: Brewpub in Scheveningen Harbour

name: Cutters Brewing Company
description: Cutters Brewing Company is a start-up, small scale nanobrewery operated by Emma Inman, Chris Inman, Monte Speicher, & Amanda Speicher.

name: Kinetic Brewing Company
description: Kinetic Brewing Company is the premier microbrewery in Lancaster, CA, located just 50 miles north of Los Angeles in the heart of the historic and newly gentrified downtown, The BLVD. Featuring international pub cuisine and fine American craft beer from Southern California and beyond.

name: Franklin Street Brewing Company
description: As a small batch craft brewery, we believe in providing a rotating range of styles of high quality beers that would not normally be available in the region. Each month we will offer six or more different styles of beer for your enjoyment. With our 20 gallon system (and years of experience), our beers progressed from “drinkable” to award winning! Our IPA recipe won 2nd place in the Iowa State Fair home brewing competition in 2012 in the Imperial IPA category and 3rd place in the IPA category. Our Blonde Ale also took 3rd place in its category.

name: Windy Hill Orchard & Cidery
description: We are the first, and only, licensed and bonded cidery in the Piedmont of the Carolinas. We produce various types of Award Winning Hand-Crafted Hard Ciders with a commitment to sustainable agricultural practices. As an extension of Windy Hill Orchard and Cidery, we are family owned and operated and located in York, SC. Please be sure to visit our facebook page and our orchard website for details about upcoming events, product news, and hours and directions.

name: Quarry Brewing
description: Quarry Brewing, L.L.C., located in historic uptown Butte, Montana, has brought handcrafted beer back to the mining city after a 40-year absence. Chuck and Lyza Schnabel opened the Quarry on September 29, 2007. It has since garnered rave reviews from everyone who has tasted any one of the traditional-style ales produced on site. Chuck, our Brewer, continues to brew rich, flavorful beers with only the finest ingredients available: choice hops, barley, yeast and filtered water. One taste will tell you: We Dig Beer!

name: Galway Hooker
description: We are an independent artisan brewery based in the west of Ireland dedicated to the production of high quality, natural and full flavoured beers. All of our beers are craft brewed by combining the finest ingredients with traditional brewing techniques. The result is a beer that has received numerous awards, including being twice named as Ireland’s Best Beer. We consider beer to be like any other food: the fresher and less processed the better. Our beers are therefore devoid of any preservatives and are brewed using only malt, hops yeast and water. We are passionate about producing exciting and innovative beers that are bursting with flavour and character. Galway Hooker was the first permanent pale ale to be produced in Ireland and is widely regarded as a leading light in the Irish craft beer sector. It has now firmly established itself as a favourite amongst beer enthusiasts. The brewery was established in 2006 by two first cousins, Aidan Murphy and Ronan Brennan. Aidan has over ten years experience in the brewing industry and has worked in several breweries around the world. He also holds a master’s degree in Brewing and Distilling. Ronan knows everything there is to know about craft beer and takes care of all our customers.

name: Central State Brewing
description: Central State explores the delicate art of yeast interaction and cultivation in an experimental process as a third wave brewery dedicating themselves to 100% Brett brewing. Founded by a technically-minded team with an experienced brewer, Central State aims to contribute to the innovation and knowledge-sharing culture that has defined this new generation of American brewing through experimentation, collaboration, and artisanal gypsy brewing. Central State Brewing Co. is part of a renaissance of craft-minded producers helping revitalize small and mid-size cities across the midwest, sharing their inventiveness with small pockets of like-minded drinkers across the country who are looking for unique flavors and textures in their beer.

name: Red Door Brewing Company
description: Red Door Brewing Company opened in Albuquerque in 2014. The company was founded by five original members who came together with the hopes of forming the greatest light jazz/thrash metal fusion band in history. When it turned out most of the members were terrible musicians the team re-evaluated their skills and decided to capitalize on Wayne and Rob’s extensive brewing experience, passion, and education, and open a brewery. Red Door Brewing Company strives to create a warm, welcoming atmosphere where you can grab an ice-cold, delicious beer and relax after a solid day’s work. We absolutely guarantee an environment free of rampaging gangs of rabid badgers which feed off chaos and lust for nothing but a dystopic, badger-ruled hellscape of a future. We are notably the only brewery in Albuquerque who has made that promise.Red Door Brewing Company opened in Albuquerque in 2014. The company was founded by five original members who came together with the hopes of forming the greatest light jazz/thrash metal fusion band in history. When it turned out most of the members were terrible musicians the team re-evaluated their skills and decided to capitalize on Wayne and Rob’s extensive brewing experience, passion, and education, and open a brewery. Red Door Brewing Company strives to create a warm, welcoming atmosphere where you can grab an ice-cold, delicious beer and relax after a solid day’s work. We absolutely guarantee an environment free of rampaging gangs of rabid badgers which feed off chaos and lust for nothing but a dystopic, badger-ruled hellscape of a future. We are notably the only brewery in Albuquerque who has made that promise.

name: Sawdust City Brewing Co
description: Opening in the Spring of 2012 on the boardwalks of the Muskoka Wharf in the heart of Gravenhurst, Ontario; Sawdust City Brewing Co., will be a small brewery with an attached tied-house. Now, for everyone not affiliated with the provincial government, that simply means that Sawdust City will be makin' fresh, tasty beer and will be servin' local, tasty food. Why a "tied-house" you ask? Well, we here at the Sawdust City Brewing Co., we not only love beer, but we also love what beer can do! Beer has the unique ability to bring people together. We love to see people gatherin' together to eat great food, listen to great music or just to simply talk and tell some great stories. So along with makin' some fantastic beer, we set about lookin' to create a place where you could do all those things under one roof. And we wanted to do it right here on the shores of Lake Muskoka. So once the dust flies in 2012, come on down to the Sawdust City Brewing Co. and enjoy some great beer, some great food and some great company!

name: 612Brew
description: In the heart of the Northeast Minneapolis Arts and Brewery District, 612Brew calls Central and Broadway home. 612Brew produces small-batch beers to satisfy both the weekend beer drinker and the craft beer drinker with a discerning palate. Enjoy the local brewing culture while sipping a pint in our taproom, then look upon our mirror-polished tanks or sit in the courtyard amphitheater and rain garden. Come on, Minnesota. I'm Thirsty Already.

name: D.L. Geary Brewing Company
description: The D.L. Geary Brewing Company was incorporated in October, 1983 by David and Karen Geary who shared the vision of producing world class products on a small scale for local and regional consumption. At that time, there were only 13 so-called microbreweries in the United States, almost all of them in California and the Pacific Northwest. In the winter of 1984, David Geary began a period of training and research in Scotland and England. With the help of Peter Maxwell Stuart, a Scottish nobleman and brewer who arranged introductions and itineraries, he worked in a half-dozen small commercial breweries from the highlands of Scotland to the south coast of England.

name: Genesee Brewing Company
description: This is a place where honest people have brewed honest beers for generations. Today, 400 employees focus on crafting and bottling quality beers every day. Founded in 1878, The Genesee Brewing Company, based in Rochester, New York, is one of the largest and oldest continually operating breweries in the United States. The Brewery makes the Genesee line of beers, including the iconic Genesee, the refreshing Genny Light, and the original Genesee Cream Ale. The Genesee Brewing Company is part of North American Breweries, the largest independently owned beer company in the United States. With a focus on product quality, facility upgrades (including the relighting of the iconic Genesee Beer & Ale sign), conservation initiatives and employee safety, North American Breweries has invested in the Genesee family of beers, its employees and the community. With a refreshed sense of pride and purpose, The Genesee Brewing Company will continue brewing the quality beers that people have loved for over a century.

name: Four Saints Brewing Company
description: Four Saints Brewing Company began operations in May 2015 in Downtown Asheboro, NC. Four Saints focuses on Great Beer for Great People through award winning beers and supporting the local community in numerous ways. Andrew Deming and Joel McClosky, the owners and executives, met in 2008 and began working towards opening a brewery in 2011. A successful Kickstarter campaign and tremendous support from the City of Asheboro and community drove the renovation of a century old building into a modern seven barrel brewhouse and English/Irish pub inspired taproom.

name: Walkabout Brewing Company
description: Walkabout Brewing Company was established in 1997 in Central Point, Oregon by founder and head brewer, Ross Litton. A native of Perth, Australia, Ross has been a resident of Oregon for 21 years. Walkabout brews have traditionally been available primarily in Southern Oregon; however distribution has now been expanded to include all Oregon and Southern Washington. The beers can be found on draft in bars and restaurants and in bottles at stores and markets. Walkabout bottles Worker's Pale Ale, Jabberwocky Strong Ale and Point the Bone IPA in 22oz bottles. Walkabout is distributed by Point Blank Distributing in Portland, Bend and the Willamette Valley, Summit Distributing in Southern Oregon, Bigfoot Distributing on the Oregon coast and by Alpha Distributing in Washington State. Walkabout products are brewed in a 7 barrel brew house in Medford, Oregon. The brewery is not only a manufacturing facility but houses a tasting room with a large patio and outdoor area, dock sales are available.

name: Motor City Brewing Works
description: Since our beginning in 1994, MCBW has been committed to producing hand-crafted superior quality beer. Our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized assuring maximum freshness & delicious flavor Naturally! We hope you enjoy our labors as we contribute to the genuinely original exports of Detroit’s Cultural Center. A century of art, literature, music & now Beer! 20 BBL Custom fabricated brewery made from salvaged equipment & scrap of Detroit’s great industrial era, by the hands of Detroit’s finest artists, fabricators & craftsman.

name: Around the Bend Beer Co.
description: There's never been a more exciting time in craft beer. So come join us and let's see what's Around the Bend!

name: Trap Rock Restaurant and Brewery
description: Trap Rock Restaurant & Brewery opened its doors 1997 and combines seasonal craft brews with seasonal, American food. Designed by Morris Nathanson, Trap Rock Restaurant offers a working microbrewery and a comfortable European ski lodge atmosphere.

name: Elk Mountain Brewing
description: Elk Mountain Brewing, Inc., established in April of 2009, is owned and operated by Tom and Marcia Bell. Elk Mountain Brewing is a small scale microbrewery located in the industrial area of Parker, Co, serving truly unique handcrafted microbrews with award winning recipes. Tom Bell is the head brewer with nearly 20 years of experience. Although he brews a variety of beers, his specialty is German beers with a twist. For those non-drinkers we will have homemade Root Beer on tap.

name: Ponderosa Brewing Company
description: Ponderosa Brewing Company was founded in 2014 for the Albuquerque beer drinker. We brew with our hearts in IPA country and our minds in Lager country. You will find a blend of German, Belgian, and good old New Mexican beers when you come down to visit us at our Pub in Old Town. We brew and cook on-site and look forward to sharing our beers and food with you! www.ponderosabrewing.com

name: Ad Lib Brewing Company
description: In 2011 a plan was hatched. Two flatmates Hayden and Fraser decided that they would start their own brewery. A month, and many beers later Ad Lib was born. The first beer UCom was made at the Twisted Hop, but due to the February earthquake this beer was never released. The quake only reinforced Ad Libs' belief, that they should continue, and a new premise and new inspiration was found. The good blokes at Wigram brewery gave them a hand and the magic that is Ad Lib Brewing finally reached you!

name: Gigantic Brewing Company
description: Gigantic Brewing Company is an independent, crafty brewery located in the Southeast quadrant of the Peoples Republic of Portland. Brewer/Owners Ben Love and Van Havig are veterans of the Oregon brewing community. At Gigantic we only do two things: make the best damn IPA in Portland, Oregon and produce seasonal, exciting, flavorful beers, most of which will be brewed only once. Our goal is simultaneously to create new interpretations of classic styles and to ignore those same style guidelines completely and brew whatever our creative natures produce.

name: Rogness Brewing Company
description: Rogness Brewing Company specializes in creating small, handcrafted batches of beer. As decade long owners of a successful homebrew supply shop in Austin, TX, Forrest and Diane Rogness have experimented with many special hops and exotic ingredients. They are ready to share some of their more unique recipes with the world. Look for Rogness beers on draught, in cans, and bottles this Spring. Forrest and Diane have been married for 13 years and have a 7 year old daughter named Anna. Forrest started brewing in 1990 and purchased Austin Homebrew Supply in 1999. He holds a degree in Photography. Diane is originally from Iceland. She met Forrest at the University of Iowa and holds a degree in Art History. The rest of the team is Dan Wheeler, David Heath, David Ebel, Mark Tovar, Tony Bailey, and Daron White. Including Forrest, they have over 65 years of brewing experience.

name: Black Hog Brewing Company
description: Black Hog Brewing started with the story of food, family, and a love for craft beer. Brothers Jason and Tom Sobocinski come from a Polish/Italian family where food and drink is always the focus of every gathering. From Jason’s wedding to his son’s birthdays, roasting a pig has become the favorite way to celebrate any special occasion. Tyler Jones, an old family friend and former brewer of The Portsmouth Brewery in New Hampshire, contacted Jason and Tom with a plan to move to New Haven so his wife and son could be closer to their family. With a plan in the works to form a brewery that would celebrate family and food, they needed to encompass all that they were passionate about. When they celebrate, they roast a hog and the Berkshire hog is the breed of choice, thus Black Hog brewing was born! Black Hog Brewing (BHB) will have a strong tie to local agriculture with a focus on unique craft brews that are pleasant to drink and pair well with foods of all types. Black Hog Brewing will craft year round and seasonal brews with a seasonal Farm Land Series dedicating a percentage of proceeds to support CT Farm Land. 3-4 pig roasts per year, using CT raised Berkshire pigs fed our spent brewing grains will celebrate the release of our seasonal brews. We hope you’ll enjoy Black Hog Brewing Company at one of our pig roasts soon or whatever occasion brings you together for great beer and food with friends and family.

name: McCoy's Public House and Brewkitchen
description: Over 10 house brewed beers on tap at any given time served with American Comfort food with a twist. We have been making beer for over 17 years and are one of the most popular brew pubs in the Kansas City area.

name: Retro Beer Company
description: We are three-retired friends who believe that giving back to others is life's greatest virtue. We were raised on these basic ideals: Love for Community, Importance of Generosity, and the Need for Sustainability. History tells us that the invention of beer inspired the idea of community. When people come together to enjoy beer, amazing things happen: Friendships are sparked, stories are shared, ideas are cultivated. Beer is simply a social vehicle for people to discuss what really matters in life. Together we can be a driving force in giving back to a cause in your community. 20% of this beverage’s proceeds go to [insert charity]. With your help we can shift the purpose behind beer to generously give back to the community

name: Central Waters Brewing Company
description: Brewing since 1998, Central Waters Brewing Company is built on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beer in Central Wisconsin: Ouisconsing Red Ale, Happy Heron Pale Ale, Mudpuppy Porter, and many more. Currently, Central Waters Brewing Company services over 200 retail locations in Central Wisconsin, and has expanded its product line to include 18 beer styles. Moving from Junction City to a new facility in Amherst, Wisconsin in January of 2007, Central Waters can better support the growing demand. CWBC continues to build on the solid reputation of producing the finest quality beers in Central Wisconsin.

name: Shilling Brewing Company
description: Brewpub in Glasgow, UK

name: Globe Brewing Company
description: We don’t brew aggressive ales. In fact if you like high alcohol hopped up expensive beers, you probably won’t like us. Everyone to their own. But if you like great value clean refreshing lagers you’ll love us! We don't spend mega bucks on TV advertising campaigns like the big breweries . And we avoid employing expensive "Communications Directors" to manage social media and Facebook. That's not us. We put our money into quality and price. That’s why we are such great value, great tasting beers.

name: Sleeping Giant Brewing Company
description: The first, dedicated contract brewery in the Western United States. Catering to the craft community, we offer approachable brew lengths, a variety of packaging options and a personal level of customer service unique to the industry.

name: Nickel Brook Brewing Company
description: A family-owned microbrewery, with 30 years of brewing history, committed to producing an outstanding local product with European character.

name: Cognition Brewing Company
description: Cognition Brewing Company is the newest addition to the growing craft beer scene here in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula. We are located right in the heart of the U.P. where the winters are long but enjoyed. We are proud to be located in an area that has such strong appreciation for community and locally made products. It only makes sense that the people that live here have strong work ethics and aren’t afraid to help one another out because that is what it takes to get by up here. It has been a long journey for us at Cognition Brewing Company and we are really excited to be bringing you a product that we have worked hard to produce. Whether you come visit us at the tap room or find our beer on tap somewhere else, we truly hope that you enjoy it to the fullest. Our beers are brewed in small batches in our humble 7 barrel brewery that is located in the historic Mather Inn. We want our beer to be more than just a beverage. We hope that when you sit down to a pint, you do so in great company and experience the beer to every degree.

name: Chatham Brewing
description: Our beer is imported, from Main Street, that is. We were tired of the generic taste of mass-market beers. So we decided to brew our own. At least three times a week. Except when we're on a fishing trip. Our brewery in in Chatham, NY. You will find us right on Main Street.

name: Arch Rock Brewing Company
description: Micro brewery on the Southern Oregon Coast with a 15 barrel brewhouse and 30 barrel fermenters.

name: Backpocket Brewing
description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.

name: Stoudts Brewery
description: Over 26 years, Stoudts Brewing Company has grown and evolved from a small brewery with limited draught distribution, to a packaging regional microbrewery with distribution in 17 different states, producing over 10,000 barrels a year. Even with the growth over the years, one thing has always remained constant, and that is the attention to detail that goes into every batch of handcrafted beer that is traditionally brewed, packaged and sold with passion by our small team of hardworking dedicated employees. A tradition that was started by Ed and Carol Stoudt who both continue to spread the gospel of craft beer!

name: Sudwerk
description: Sudwerk brews and bottles Swiss Beer in Zürich Oberland. Unlike others that brew “Pale Ale Style” Our beer is brewed on an Authentic British Pale Ale Brew House using the finest English Pale Ale Malt, American Hops and Yeast. I have been brewing American Pale Ales since 1982, back in the days when I brewed 20 Liters at a time as a homebrewer. Today I brew 2000 Liters at a time (more friends then back then). I grew up in Northern California during the Microbrewery Revolution and you will taste that in my beers. Of course I never pasteurize our beers or add anything artificial. Trust me when I say, Beer coming from Pfäffikon to your dinner table will taste fresher than beer brought in a container traveling 2 months over the ocean. Don’t just take our word for it, Biergenuss Magazine calls us “The Rothschild of Beer”. Thanks to all of you for making Western Rider the number one selling Pale Ale in Switzerland. Unlike many other brands, we are not brewed in Germany or in another Kanton and then sold as a “Local” or “Swiss Beer”. We are also not a big beer factory, owned by a European neighbor. With every Sudwerk Beer, you are enjoying an Authentic Pale Ale produced here in Switzerland, by a family owned and operated “Kleinbrauerei”/Microbrewery. With every Sudwerk Beer, you enjoy the true meaning of Swiss Quality and the results of good old fashioned hard work. You can find us in larger COOP Stores in the German and French speaking parts of Switzerland, on the Bahnhofstrasse in Jelmoli, Rio Getränke, Drinks of the World as well as in over 100 Restaurants and Hotels. In Zürich, we are distributed by Heineken Distribution, Intercomestibles AG and Schatt Getränke. Quality without compromise. If you are ever in the neighborhood, come by and visit us! And do follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

name: Andwells Brewery
description: Andwell Brewing Company is a true family business, run by Adam Komrower and his wife, Helen. Andwell’s brewed its first beer in October 2008. Since then, Andwell’s has established a reputation for consistently producing beers of the highest quality Andwell's run guided Brewery Tours where you can discover some of the secrets of brewing, touch and taste the floor-malted hand-raked barley, take in the sweet aroma of hops and sample some of Hampshire’s finest beers.

name: Mother Road Brewing Company
description: Driving on a dark stretch of two lane road, founders Michael and Alissa Marquess were pondering how to better live their creed of ‘finding joy in the adventure’. They came up with a plan that brought together their passions of craft beer, travel, Arizona and the enjoyment of life;they decided to create a brewery. We hand craft each of our beers along Route 66 in Flagstaff in a 1920s era building with a small staff. We found craft beer, where does your road lead?

name: Paducah Beer Werks
description: Located in the Old Greyhound bus stations. PBW offers 4 Main beers with seasonal additions along with brick oven pizza, wings and sandwiches.

name: Mustang Brewing Company
description: Mustang Brewing Company was created to makes great, easy-drinking, craft beers. Headquartered in Oklahoma City, OK, our award-winning line-up includes Washita Wheat, Sixty-Six, Golden Ale, Thirty-Three, Harvest Lager, and more. For details, please visit www.mustangbrewing.com.

name: Two Birds Brewing
description: Two Birds Brewing was hatched in 2011, and is the culmination of a couple of friends who had a vision to balance the enjoyment of the finer things in life, with both work and play. They have set out in a small flock of two to make flavoursome, interesting and approachable beers and share their passion with others.

name: Ghost River Brewing
description: In 1887, Memphis first tapped the now famous Memphis Sands Aquifer. Recharged by the Ghost River's fragile wetlands, the aquifer has supplied Memphis with a steady and consistent supply of excellent drinking water ever since. Ghost River Brewing knows that "great water makes great beer." And some of the greatest drinking water on earth is available right here in west Tennessee. Brewing locally guarantees that every handcrafted, full-flavored Ghost River Ale is the freshest beer available . . . and when it comes to flavor, freshness means everything! Ghost River Brewing supports the Wolf River Conservancy by donating a portion of the proceeds of every barrel sold. Help Ghost River Brewing and the Wolf River Conservancy protect our local, natural resources and the quality of our famous drinking water

name: Spoetzl Brewery
description: Spoetzl was founded in 1909, and claims to be the oldest independent brewery in Texas. A group of businessmen incorporated Shiner Brewing Association and placed Herman Weiss in as the company's first brewmaster. In 1914 a German immigrant brewer named Kosmas (or Kosmos) Spoetzl co-leased with Oswald Petzold with an option to buy in 1915. Spoetzl had attended brewmaster's school and apprenticed for three years in Germany, worked for eight years at the Pyramids Brewery in Cairo, Egypt, and then worked in Canada. He moved to San Antonio in search of a better climate for his health, bringing with him a family recipe for a Bavarian beer made from malted barley and hops.

name: Terrapin Beer Company
description: Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE. Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival. Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

name: Triple C Brewing Company
description: In October 2011 Triple C Brewing Company incorporated and our beer dreams started coming true. Triple C are Chris, Chris, and Christina. Chris and Chris met while working at a local bank and quickly realized we weren't cut out for banking and dreamed of owning our own business. While home brewing late one evening, the three Cs had a crazy idea to start a brewery. All of our hard work is finally paying off and we anticipate an early summer 2012 opening of our South End microbrewery! We can't wait to share our beer with Charlotte and beyond and look forward welcoming everyone to our spacious tap room very soon.

name: Roc Brewing Company
description: When Roc Brewing Co. began in the crisp cellaring walls of a suburban Rochester basement, they never imaged the future that was set forward. The ever infectious brewing bug had bitten both homebrewers Jonathan Mervine and Chris Spinelli. From the time the yeast was pitched it was unanimous this was their future. Joined by the emboldened encouragement of Chris’ mom and third partner Patty Spinelli, she was hooked by first sip. The new family began their many trials and tribulations of brewing, three tier law, legalese and to much to their chagrin ROC Brewing Co. was founded.

name: Black Sheep Brewery
description: Since 1992 Black Sheep Brewery has been brewing fantastic beers in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales.

name: Southern Hops Brewing Company
description: We are a locally owned and operated brew pub in Florence, S.C.. Our focus is to use local products, promote local bands and give people in Florence a place to call their own. So if your a local this place is for you. If your from out of town come in and see exactly what Florence has to offer. Southern Hops offers handcrafted beer accompanied by great food and live music, as well as a level of service that defines southern hospitality.

name: Soo Brewing Co.
description: It is the mission of Soo Brewing Company to produce beer that the people of Sault Ste. Marie can be proud of – beer that meets and exceeds the highest standard, our own. Our products will be unique and innovative, yet hold true to the old-world brewing traditions of our ancestors. The product will be affordable, allowing everyday people the opportunity to enjoy great hand-crafted beer. The profits made by Soo Brewing Company will be put back into the community whenever possible. Employees of Soo Brewing Company will be treated like family, paid a livable wage and given the opportunity to advance through hard work. All employees will be fully knowledgeable about the product, the process and culture of beer and will treat customers as they would guests in their own home. Soo Brewing Company will strive to promote beer culture and responsible enjoyment of the product, and will be relentless in our effort to improve the quality of the product and the efficiency by which it is produced. Soo Brewing Company will be a shining example of corporate ethics and social responsibility, and above all, enjoy what we do every day.

name: Arvada Beer Company
description: Arvada Beer Company is located in Olde Town Arvada, CO. Arvada Beer Company is the first Micro Brewery in the city of Arvada. Arvada Beer Company is considered a “micro-brewery”, which produces beer that is wholesaled to pubs, taverns and restaurants in the city of Arvada, throughout Jefferson County, and to the broader regional market. Our tasting room allows you to view the operation of the brewery, purchase beer by the glass, growlers and kegs of beer to go, and retail items such as T-shirts and glassware with our logo. Arvada Beer Company is different than most microbreweries due to our large tasting room. We have approximately 150 seats. We have 14 taps that allow us to have specialty beers as well as our flagship beers on tap at all times. Arvada Beer Company produces beer with a 7-barrel, stainless steel brewing plant.

name: Brasserie des Légendes
description: Brasserie des Légendes combines tradition and technologies to produce high fermentation beers that are rich in flavours, while respecting the strictest quality and hygiene standards. The beers are brewed exclusively using raw materials of the finest quality: malt, hops, pure water and yeast. They are entirely natural and completely free from additives. Bottle and cask conditioning gives the beers a 100% natural carbonation.

name: Amherst Brewing Company
description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

name: Discretion Brewing
description: Discretion Brewing is a family-owned brewery in Soquel, CA dedicated to producing handcrafted organic beer of consistent high quality. Choose Goodness. Have Discretion.

name: Mad Anthony Brewing
description: From the very beginning, Mad Anthony was anything but normal. Steeped in the fun-loving tradition that had been established at the corner of Broadway and Taylor the city’s first craft-brewery was welcomed by friends, customers, and beer lovers throughout the State of Indiana. Today, Mad Anthony boasts four locations in downtown Indiana settings. All are places where good friends can come together over great food, and of course, satisfying, locally-brewed beer.

name: Vail Brewing Company
description: Vail Brewing Company (VBC) is a small 10BBL, independent craft brewery located in the heart of the Rocky Mountains. We chose this area not only for the mountain lifestyle, but to also serve the residents and tourist of the Upper Eagle River Valley and ski areas of Vail and Beaver Creek. Our brews will always have a creative touch from big hoppy beers, traditional styles, blends, and even cask-conditioned ales….We brew what we like to drink! We design handcrafted ales and lagers using mountain fed water and the finest ingredients. When available, we will use locally sourced hops and malts. The selection of fine beers will constantly change and evolve with staple beers appearing over time.

name: Lost Nation Brewing
description: We are located at 254 Wilkins St (Just off Route 100) in Morrisville, VT. Slightly off the beaten path, we are proud to offer some of the most finely crafted beers in the great state of Vermont. Pair any of our fine selections with any of the house made, locally sourced items off of our delicious menu and we have no doubt that you will leave satisfied!

name: Westbrook Brewing Company
description: Westbrook Brewing is a new craft brewery in Mt. Pleasant, SC. Our mission is to make the most interesting, drinkable, and generally awesome beer possible. We love experimenting with different ingredients and brewing techniques, and we hope you’ll have as much fun drinking our beer as we do making it.

name: Bitter Ester's Brewhouse
description: We are a Small Artisan Nano-Brewery! We specialize in English inspired American Ales and Belgian-style Farmhouse Ales. We use only the finest barley, grown and malted all over the world. We use hops that are grown all over the world as well. If you are noticing a theme our beers are unique to each time we brew therefore we need to tap the expert farmers and craftsman worldwide to get these wonderful and unique ingredients. We have six ales on draft at any one time and our Dry stout and Brown Ale are the only reoccurring beers. We brew farmhouse ales that are different every batch we brew.

name: Big Island Brewhaus
description: Loved by locals & visitors alike, Big Island Brewhaus is a family-friendly, community gathering place serving local handcrafted food and beer. Farm-to-table cuisine, including fresh line-caught fish, local beef, vegetarian, vegan and glutenfree items complement their impressive lineup of craft beers – all brewed on-site. Award-winning Big Island Brewhaus is one of only two breweries in the U.S. whose medal count in 2014 U.S. Open Beer Championships placed them on the Top Ten US Brewery list for the past two consecutive years! The Brewhaus has seating indoors and out in their bamboo beer-garden. Beers are available to-go in jars, growlers and in 22oz bottles, which can be found in fine establishments statewide!

name: Celis Brewery
description: Celis brand was established in 1992 in Austin, Texas by the world-famous Belgian brewer Pierre Celis. Pierre Celis is known for reviving the 400-year old Belgian witbier into the brand Hoegaarden. After moving to America, Celis further developed his original recipes of White and other Belgian style beers for the American market. The Celis brand was a great success in the emerging craft beer scene in the USA and it became a renowned craft beer brand with regional dominance in Texas.

name: Barley Forge Brewing Co.
description: Barley Forge Brewing creates robust, unique, and tasty beers inspired by the cultural melting pot of southern California.

name: 101 North Brewing Company
description: Just a bunch of reckless boys who aren’t afraid to put the cart before the horse, twist every arm, break every sweat, and genuinely fake it till we make it. Because in these troubled times, creating and sharing beer with the world just made sense, if we could do it our way... with visual aids and a soundtrack. At 101 North, we believe progressive is a beer style.

name: Brauerei Hofstetten
description: Half an hour's walk north of St. Martin in the heart of Mühlviertel, one sees them on a hill - The brewery Hofstetten Hofstetten is a private brewery and is in the possession of the family Krammer - since 1849th For the production of beers Hofstettner raw materials are used only Austrian. The brewery offers private wells from which water is taken for beer production. This is bedrock water that is filtered through the granite rock, and so only a very low hardness 3-6 ° dH - so the best way to brew beer for good. The special malts, which are important for the quality of the beers come from the Austrian malt Plohberger (Grieskirchen) and the Stadlauer maltings. For the pleasant bitterness in the beer aroma and bitter hops makes Mühlviertler that is planted with care by the hop growers from the region and harvested. There currently are 11 staff employed, they make it possible year 5700 hl best beer brewing and that customer to supply innumerable. Furthermore, as each year about 4,000 visitors a topic of brewing beer and care, as part of a field trip brought closer. Our goal is to bring our dishes closer to the true beer connoisseur.

name: Hard Seltzer Beverage Company
description: Owned by the Boston Beer Company.

name: Ghostfish Brewing Company
description: Washington State's first and only dedicated gluten-free brewery. Ghostfish offers a wide variety of craft beer styles produced from unusual malted grains, such as millet, brown rice, and buckwheat.

name: Blue Ghost Brewing Company
description: Blue Ghost Brewing Company is a brewery located in Fletcher NC. We offer hand crafted ales and promote family, community, and sustainability.

name: Asher Brewing Company
description: At Asher Brewing Company our mission is operate a successful brewery that produces world-class certified organic ales, while utilizing environmentally sustainable and socially responsible business practices. Our brewery is run on 100% wind power! Chris Asher decided that the Boulder market deserved to have locally brewed organic beers. After nearly a year of planning, research, and hard work building a brewery, Asher Brewing Company opened the doors for business on November 20th, 2009. On February 25th, 2010 organic certification was issued for all beers at Asher Brewing Company; making it the first all organic brewery in the state of Colorado. Organic ingredients are better for the consumer, better for the environment, and better for the beer. (Studies have shown that pesticides are detrimental to the shelf-life of beer.) USDA Organic Brewery

name: High Alpine Brewing Co.
description: Located way up in the mountains of Colorado. HABC offers a full food menu and delicious beer pairings. Free beer tomorrow.

name: Newburyport Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2012, the Company is Massachusetts' only exclusive all-can and keg craft brewery. Co-founded by two local Newburyport entrepreneurs, musicians, and home brewers - Chris Webb and Bill Fisher - the company aims to capture the essence of Newburyport's quaint seaside character across a line of great tasting handcrafted ales. Newburyport Brewing Company uses premium quality natural ingredients in its Newburyport Pale Ale™, Plum Island Belgian White™, Green Head IPA™ and 1635 Series™ beers.

name: Wit's End Brewing Company
description: We are an artisanal Denver brewery fueled by dreams and inspired by the limitless potential of craft beer since 2011…Join us on our journey!

name: Green Man Brewing Company
description: The ancient legend of the Green Man influenced our brewery's inception in 1997. As one of Asheville's oldest breweries, we are proud to craft some of the beer scene's most iconic ales. Loyalty to traditional brewing techniques while creating innovative ales is Green Man's constant quest.

name: Armadillo Ale Works
description: A culinary-inspired brewery dedicated to creating unique beers.

name: Brauerei C. & A. Veltins GmbH & Co.
name_short_display: Brauerei C. & A. Veltins GmbH & Co.

name: Pisgah Brewing Company
description: Pisgah Brewing Company is located in Black Mountain, NC about 10 miles east of Asheville. We specialize in brewing hand crafted certified organic beer. Please browse around to learn about our beer, where to find it and what it means to be certified organic.

name: Hawai'i Nui Brewing
description: At Hawai‘i Nui Brewing, we’re passionate about craft beer. We brew small batches of our all-natural ales and lagers from the finest barley malt, wheat, hops and yeast. We are committed to local production in Hawai‘i. Our uniquely well balanced Island Style beer is perfect for your time in Paradise! What is Island Style? To those of us who call Hawai’i home, it’s all about balance. Working hard, sure. But when pau hana time comes, it’s about friends and family. Heeding the call of the sun and sand, surf and sea. Tasting freshness. Celebrating music. Stopping at sunset. Resting easy at night. Appreciating life’s detours–what we call holo holo time. Living life as it should be.

name: Brouwerij Alken-Maes
description: The company ' Alken- Maes Breweries SA " was officially created in 1988 from the merger of breweries and Cristal Alken Maes . However, the roots of these two entities go back much further, to 1880. This year, Egied Maes bought the brewery Sint- Michaël . Shortly after , Arthur Boes founded a brewery in Alken, about 100 km away. Both breweries are growing consistently . In 1928, the first Belgian pils born: the Cristal. Maes Pils follows in 1946. Then Grimbergen , Ciney and others complement the portfolio until the merger in 1988. Having been acquired by Groupe Danone and Scottish & Newcastle, Alken- Maes joined 2008 HEINEKEN Company. HEINEKEN under the wing of Alken- Maes had a difficult period , and the new brewery can fully assume its position as an innovative challenger on the Belgian market . (Re ) launches beers Maes, Desperados and Grimbergen are successful and show the new momentum of the business.

name: Shenanigans Brewing
description: A small brewing company based in Sydney's Inner West.

name: ThirstyBear Brewing Company
description: ThirstyBear Brewing Co. is San Francisco's only certified organic brewery. ThirstyBear hand-crafts beers of every description: ales, lagers, barrel-aged, Belgian-inspired, cask conditioned, wet-hopped, dry-hopped - all inspired by tradition and modern creativity. Our brewery crafts only organic beers, ensuring that the beers you consume are good to you and good for our earth. Our restaurant pairs its beers with Spanish inspired tapas and paellas sourced from the plethora of local and often organic farms that grace our region. As the only San Francisco certified green brewery-restaurant, we promote the business of sustainability. Founded on September 13, 1996, ThirstyBear is now the oldest brewery-restaurant in San Francisco.

name: Groundswell Brewing Company
description: So here’s what you need to know. We are brewers and culinarians. We want our beer to taste good, but we also want it to taste good with food. We don’t want to blow-out your palate, we want you to explore the hidden flavors and understand the complexities of the taste. We love beer. We want you to love beer. We will focus on crafting beers between 4.5% and 7.0% ABV. Our goal is a well-balanced, well-crafted, session beer. We’ll do the hop-thing too, but always with an exciting and culinary-focused angle. Here’s the other thing. We’re adventurous. San Diego is the brew capital of the world (are we exaggerating here… NO!) There’s lots of great brewers. We found a few of them and held them down, twisted their arm really hard and asked them to brew something new and out there for us. Then, we found a few chefs who thought brewing was good sport. We helped them with the technical stuff and set them loose with the brew equipment. You’ll see their brew in our taproom…they may have other gigs in the city, and we support their efforts there too. Beer is beer. Drink it here. Drink it there. Drink it anywhere (with apologies to Dr. Seuss).

name: Headlands Brewing Company
description: Headlands Brewing Co. was founded by people that play outside. We have a sense of adventure and embody the spirit of the place that we live, celebrating the bay, the history, the trails and the mountains that surround us. Outside the brewery you can find us surfing and swimming in the beautiful waters in our backyard or cycling or running through the valleys, parks, hills and mountains surrounding our bay. Patrick Horn (formerly of Pacific Brewing Laboratory) and Phil Cutti (Southpaw BBQ) create classic beers along with seasonal and experimental brews that push the envelope.

name: Escutcheon Brewing Co.
description: As Winchester, Virginia's first production brewery, Escutcheon Brewing Co. excels in traditional brewing methods to create extremely enjoyable brews.

name: Windsor & Eton Brewery
description: For well over 300 years, Windsor ales were famous amongst rich and poor alike. On St Georges Day 2010, seventy-nine years after the closure of Windsor’s last brewery, four friends came together to bring brewing back to the heart of these two famous Berkshire towns. Today everyone who works here is helping to make Windsor beers world famous again.

name: Guinness
description: St. James's Gate Brewery (Irish: Grúdlann Gheata Shan Séamuis) is a brewery founded in 1759 in Dublin, Ireland by Arthur Guinness. The company is now a part of Diageo, a company formed via the merger of Guinness and Grand Metropolitan in 1997. The main product produced at the brewery is Guinness Draft. Leased for 9,000 years in 1759 by Arthur Guinness at £45 per year, St. James's Gate has been the home of Guinness ever since. It became the largest brewery in Ireland in 1838, and was the largest in the world in 1914, covering 64 acres. Although no longer the largest brewery in the world, it is still the largest brewer of stout in the world. During the 19th and early 20th centuries, the brewery owned most of the buildings in the surrounding area, including many streets of housing for brewery employees, and offices associated with the brewery. The brewery also made all of its own power using its own power plant. There is an attached exhibition on the 250-year-old history of Guinness, called the Guinness Storehouse.

name: Andrews Brewing Company
description: Located in the town's first jail at Calaboose Cellars.

name: Fall River Brewing Company
description: At Fall River Brewing Company, we create handcrafted ales and lagers. We brew our beer on a small 1/2 barrel system which allows us to put our personal touch into every pint. We hope you enjoy our beer as much as we enjoy brewing it for you. Cheers!

name: Brouwerij De Ranke
description: The brewery was founded in 1994 by Nino Bacelle under his own name. In the beginning we had only one ale, the Guldenberg, named after the Guldenberg Abbey in Wevelgem, where beer was brewed in the past. With a history in the beer world (since 1930 the Bacelle - Noffels family was active in beer commerce and as a lemonade producer), Nino had started experimenting with brewing ale in 1981. After an education as brewer at the CTL in Ghent in the mid eighties, he kept experimenting and in the nineties he thought his time had come (and his ale was good enough) to commercialize his ale. After a decent study of the possibilities to start his own brewery, he decided to start with brewing in a existing brewery. The good thing about this formula is that it’s possible to brew profitable without big investments. The Deca brewery is Woesten was chosen to do this and in the first year 9000 litres of Guldenberg were brewed.

name: Gun Hill Brewing Company
description: A new brewery located in the Bronx serving hand-crafted beers both on-site in our tasting room and at bars/restaurants throughout the NY Metropolitan area.

name: Willoughby Brewing Company
description: Serving the best food and craft beer in Lake County, featuring live entertainment 3 nights per week in an amazing atmosphere. Come see what's brewing!!

name: Levity Brewing
description: Serious Beer for the Light at Heart

name: Horse & Dragon Brewing Company
description: Work & family, hops & malt, Horse & Dragon. We craft high quality, great tasting beers sustainably and build community in the heart of Northern Colorado, the Napa Valley of Beer.

name: London Fields Brewery
description: Inspired by a drought of craft beer in Hackney – one of the most culturally vibrant areas in London – we thought it was about time Hackney had its very own brewery to provide home grown, handcrafted beers alongside the ever increasing amount of craft products being produced here. In August 2011, London Fields Brewery was born, based in the centre of Hackney, under the railway arches next to the oasis of greenery within the smoke that is London Fields itself. Now a part of a growing number of fine breweries in Hackney and London, we are proud to help spread the word of craft beer around the country and put Hackney on the map as a destination for great beer.

name: Flat12 Bierwerks
description: Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

name: Reverend Nat's Hard Cider
description: With the largest number of cider taps in Portland (12), you’re sure to find something you like. I offer tasting trays, glass pours of old standbys and taproom-only specials including many ciders that never leave the building. Buy a growler to go, or take some bottles home with you.

name: Neighborhood Beer Co.
description: Classic German Beers with an American Twist Based In Exeter, NH, The Neighborhood Beer Co. is a craft brewery specializing in American interpretations of authentic German-style beers made from the finest and freshest ingredients on Earth. Based on a shared passion for flavorful, easy-drinking beers and a commitment to high quality and innovation, Neighborhood beers are designed to help bring people together.

name: Big Oyster Brewery
description: Shuckin' good beer since 2015. Brewed with pride in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware

name: Reaver Beach Brewing Company
description: We are a craft brewery, located in sunny Virginia Beach, Virginia. When we say 'craft', we don't just mean small; we mean our beer is made with great care, using only the purest ingredients and smartest techniques. We don't just aim to create beers that satisfy, but rather to craft brews that inspire. We love what we do and that passion is inherent in every ounce of what flows out of our brewhouse.

name: Glenwood Canyon BrewPub
description: The Glenwood Canyon Brewing Company is Glenwood’s hometown mountain brewery. Located in historic downtown Glenwood Springs next to the Hotel Denver, and a short walk from the world famous Glenwood Hot Springs.

name: Omaha Brewing Company
description: When Dr. Robert E. Lee and family decided to start a brewing company in Omaha, GA, (Yes, Georgia) it wasn't only because we enjoy a good local brew, but because craft beer isn't prevalent enough in South Georgia. With the ideas of family, friends and quality always on our minds, we wanted to make beer that people enjoy. Not just sometimes, but every time you look at the Omaha Brewery label, taste the foam and pour a glass. Our Brewer Nick Fowler, formerly of Atlanta's Red Brick Brewery, uses only the best ingredients (And trust us, there won't be beer unless it's fresh) and a clean, consistent method to boil and ferment a beer the general himself would enjoy.

name: Harpoon Brewery
description: We started the Harpoon Brewery in 1986 because—like today—we loved beer and wanted more quality choices. There was only one problem: we were beer lovers, not brewers. We knew what we wanted to drink, but we needed some help actually brewing it. So we enlisted our first brewer, took over some warehouse space on the Boston waterfront, and began introducing fresh, local craft beer to Boston drinkers. We tried to do it in a way that captured the spirit of fun that had brought us to beer in the first place. From that warehouse, surrounded by fish companies on the docks of South Boston (neighboring what is now the Seaport District), we couldn’t imagine that craft brewing would become what it has today. We still remember our days on the other side of the bar, and have spent as much time spreading the joy of beer drinking as we have focusing on recipes, ingredients, and brewing equipment. Hopefully our sense of gratitude is reflected in both the quality of the beer and the spirit of fun and enjoyment surrounding our beer and breweries. We invite all of you to visit our Boston brewery, where it all began, and our beautiful brewery in Windsor, Vermont.

name: Rumspringa Brewing Company
description: Set between Intercourse and Bird-in-Hand, PA, and located on the second floor of the Lancaster Beer & Wine Gallery, Rumspringa Brewing Company offers the best in craft-brewed beers in the heart of Lancaster County. The area’s first nano-brewery produces tastes to satisfy everyone from a citrusy IPA to a robust Stout. Rumspringa offers the best in craft-brewed beers in the heart of Lancaster County. Located on the 2nd floor of the newly remodeled Lancaster Beer & Wine Gallery, there’s a taste to satisfy everyone from a citrusy IPA to a robust Stout. Visit the Barn Cafe for all your favorite Rumspringa beers on tap, plus Mount Hope Wine flights and delicous Lancaster County favorites. Sow your wild oats at Rumspringa Brewing Company in Intercourse, PA!

name: Salty Nut Brewery
description: Craft brewery in Huntsville, Alabama

name: Ole Shed Brewing Company
description: Ole Shed Brewing Company was founded by Mike Thornburg and Mike Ramsey in 2011

name: Shmaltz Brewing Company
description: Shmaltz Brewing Company is an American craft brewing company that brews He'brew Beer. Shmaltz is known for blurring beer styles and using puns, art, history, and pop culture in every aspect of its products. Founded as the first and still only "Jewish-celebration beer," proprietor Jeremy Cowan established the company in San Francisco in 1996 with the first 100 cases of He’brew Beer hand bottled and delivered throughout the Bay Area in his Grandmother’s Volvo. He’brew now sells across 35 states, through 40 wholesalers and nearly 5,000 retailers. After 17 years of being an outspoken cheerleader for contract brewing, Shmaltz recently broke with tradition and opened its own New York State production brewery in Clifton Park, NY, 10 minutes north of Albany’s capital district. Shmaltz’s new home boasts a 50-barrel brewhouse with 30,000 barrels of annual capacity. The new brewery packages 12 and 22 ounce bottles and kegs of their diverse core and seasonal favorites, and hosts fans and beer tourists in their new tasting room for tours, barrel-aged previews, and special releases.

name: The Unknown Brewing
description: Live Without Boundaries. Man needs job. Man finds a job. Man finds a passion in that job. That passion becomes a life mission written on a napkin (own a brewery by age 30.) That mission becomes: THE UNKNOWN BREWING COMPANY.

name: Fat Head's Brewery
