Most people who visit call it paradise, but at Islamorada Beer Company we simply call it home. It's here on this small island in the Florida Keys that Islamorada Beer was founded, with a goal to make quality local craft beer with the drinkability that complements our lifestyle. Brewing Florida Keys craft beer is our passion and is shown by the quality in our beer. If you’ve ever been to Islamorada then you know about our legendary “Sandbar.” And if you have yet to experience a day wading in the water with a cold drink in your hand we invite you to join the Islamorada Beer group on any Sandbar Sunday for the time of your life. #MySandbar

name: Burlington Beer Company
description: Vermont's first community supported brewery. We're planning to open a Brewery in the Burlington Area featuring hand crafted ales & lagers. Follow our adventures from idea to brewery!

name: Birra Toccalmatto
description: Beer Toccalmatto began producing Fidenza in October 2008 with a facility to be cooked to 550 Liters. This is the culmination of a dream of founder Bruno personnel Carillo, who after several managerial experience in the food and beer in particular, has the idea to start producing craft beer. The passion for beer lives of British and Belgian tradition from a project with three other friends, and the beginning of this new adventure.

name: Almar Orchards
description: This Original Hard-Cider has been made on our family-owned farm in Flushing, Michigan for well over a hundred years. It was first pressed back in the 1850's. Not much as changed in the process since then. We use the same apples from the same orchards as my great-great grandfather did before the time of the Civil War. We are proud of that. It gives us a sense of history. The cider has played an important role in the ongoing history of our farm. The sale of cider actually saved our farm during the Great Depression. And, during the Prohibition people came from far and wide for our "Special Farm Cider."

name: MacLeod Ale Brewing Co.
description: Come enjoy a pint of traditional British ale, brewed fresh right here in Van Nuys!

name: Dostal Alley Brewpub & Casino
description: Dostal Alley - A Brewpub and Casino, serving the best Pizza in the county for over 18 years. Now open 24/7 Never closing!! A family owned and operated business located in the heart of Central City's Historic Main Street.

name: Moonzen Brewery
street_address: New East Sun Industrial Building, 18 Shing Yip St

name: Waikiki Brewing Company
description: Waikiki's first ever brewery!

name: Bent River Brewing
description: Unique neighborhood brewery restaurant in "old" downtown historic district. We offer the midwest's best award- winning craft beers, a great selection of pub grub and one of the coolest beer gardens in the Quad Cities.

name: Three Heads Brewing
description: Ales with character. Characters with ales. Three Heads Brewing is dedicated to one thing…making great beer.

name: Pig Minds Brewing Co.
description: We are a Brew Pub located in Machesney Park, IL., and specialize in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. We use the finest barley, wheat, malts and hops to produce our tasty beers. Join us at our brewery and try as many as seven of our own beers including SOUTHY BITCH SLAP American Irish Red, BLUE COLLAR American Wheat, HOPCORE American Pale Ale or anything else we may be brewing at the time.

name: John Smith's Brewery
description: Founded in 1758 and originally known as the Backhouse & Hartley Brewery, John Smith's Brewery traces it's roots back to Tadcaster, Yorkshire, England. The company is famous for it's Bitter and Extra Smooth Ales, which have been amongst Britain's best selling ales since the 1990s.

name: The Fermentorium
description: The Fermentorium is a microbrewery at 5 Corners, north of Downtown Cedarburg, WI. Serving a wide variety of styles from traditional to experimental, any beer lover should find something to their liking. Our 2500 sqft tasting room offers plenty of seating options from the bar to our lounge area.

name: Moon Dog
description: The Moon Dog brewery is as hand-crafted as the delicious beer it produces. A good chunk of the brewing gear was cobbled together from second-hand farming and dairy equipment. The brewhouse is a four vessel 13hL electric system (hot liquor, mash/lauter kettle and whirlpool). The beautiful and shiny fermentation system is comprised of an ever-growing farm of cylindro-conical tanks. There is a wall of barrels, a painting of "The Big Man" - John Candy, many many chandeliers, a pink elephant (actually, maybe a few..), and most of all a whole lota love. It has been described by one observer as the “oddest brewery” he's ever seen. We like to call it home.

name: Salt Creek Brewery
description: Salt Creek Brewery in Bedford, Indiana is Lawrence County's first and only craft brewery. Located in a comfortable and uniquely converted service garage north of Bedford on East Trogdon Lane. This state of the art brewery was once a popular service garage. The former "alignment pit" at Salt Creek Brewery now serves as what may be the only open pit brewery in the U.S.

name: Bandon Rain
description: Oregon Coast's first cider-only fermenter, specializing in Cranberry blended ciders, sourcing local ingredients. Bandon Rain is located on a Cranberry farm in sunny Bandon, Oregon.

name: Kamenitza
description: Top selling Bulgarian beer company from city of Plovdiv. Company offers lager and dark beers. Established in 1881.

name: Oy Sinebrychoff AB
description: Sinebrychoff, the leading manufacturer of beers, ciders, soft drinks and energy drinks in Finland, also offers a comprehensive selection of international beers as well as a wide range of other alcoholic beverages through its partners. The company’s net sales in 2014 totalled EUR 342 million. Sinebrychoff began its brewing operation in 1819 and is today the oldest brewery in the Nordic countries and the oldest foodstuff producer in Finland. Sinebrychoff is part of the international Carlsberg Group.

name: Brouwerij Van Honsebrouck
description: Amandus Van Honsebrouck, born in 1811, farmer and mayor of Werken, starts the first brewery around 1850 in Werken. Emile, his son, takes over and moves to Ingelmunster in 1900 and founds the St-Josef brewery. Emile’s sons, Paul and Ernest, take over and expand firmly. In 1930 they build a new malt house and a foeder room and in 1937 a new brewing room, a fermentation room, a tank room and a bottling hall. Their focus still is on the traditional low fermentation beers: bock, export and lager. Luc, the son of Paul, goes to brewery school and learns the trade as an apprentice in Germany and Wallonia. Luc takes over in 1953, changes the name in brewery Vanhonsebrouck and decides to stop brewing lager and focuses on ‘old Flemish brown’, Bacchus. In 1957 he starts with lambic and later on with Gueuze and Kriek under the name Saint Louis. Brewery Vanhonsebrouck becomes the second largest brewery of Gueuze, thanks to the shirt sponsoring of FC Bruges, European soccer finalist in 1976 and 1978. The production of Gueuze Saint Louis booms to a record in that time of 1 million kg of malt. In 1980 Luc responds to the growing demand for heavy blond beers and launches Brigand, named after the farmer’s uprising against French occupation in 1798. In 1986 the family buys Ingelmunster castle and 3 years later, the famous Kasteel(bier) is launched. It starts with ‘Donker’, than ‘Tripel’, ‘Rouge’ and ‘Blond’. In 2009, the 5th generation, Xavier Van Honsebrouck, takes over. His first achievement is the ‘Cuvée du Château’. In 2012 the high exclusive Trignac follows and in 2013 Kasteel Hoppy. In commemoration of a 100 years World War I, ‘Passchendaele’, a Belgian Top Blond, with only 5.2° alcohol is launched in 2013. A donation is offered to the community of Zonnebeke, to contribute in the preservation of its remnants of the Great War. Due to the fast growing export, the actual brewery is almost on its full capacity. A delocalisation to a brand new castle/brewery is scheduled for 2017.

name: Katabatic Brewing Company
description: Katabatic Brewing Company is ready to take craft beer in Montana to the next level. Katabatic was founded by Montanans that are passionate about crafting full-bodied beer and building a local beer culture based on Montana traditions. Our beers embody Montana's individualistic pride, majestic scenery and tough past. Our tagline, "Rugged, Yet Refined," captures the rugged mountains that surround Livingston and the refined quality of our beer.

name: Gilded Otter Brewing Company
description: Gilded Otter Brewing Company

name: Alltech Lexington Brewing and Distilling Company
description: Welcome to our little microbrewery in the heart of downtown Lexington. People often ask us why a global company that’s in the business of science also owns a brewery. Well, to make a long story short, my forefathers in Ireland had their hand in the brewing business and crafting beer casks when barrels were made out of wood. Today, my own family is in the business of making yeast that happens to also go into the making of beer. So, it was a natural for us to revive the brewery that has been in Lexington since 1794. Welcome and enjoy.

name: Lorelei Brewing Co.
description: Well, this is our family heritage. Varian's family is from Wiesbaden, Germany approximately 2 km from the Rhine River (Varian is the owner and brewer). The Rhine has a very large rock towering over the river known as the Lorelei. Many sailors have heard a woman's beautiful voice singing, luring them to the rock where they inevitably wreck their ship. As the legend goes, a beautiful woman stricken with grief of a lost lover at sea, threw herself from the top of the rock, plummeting to her death. She haunts the Lorelei rock singing her beautiful song, luring sailors to their watery graves. In reality, what these sailors are hearing are the sounds of a very small waterfall at the bottom of the Lorelei rock, accompanied by the sound of the wind whipping around the bend in the river where the rock sits, making the false sounds of a woman singing.

name: Ass Kisser Ales
description: Ass Kisser Beverage Company is based in Fort Worth, Texas. We are a family owned company from South Australia. It is operated by Rocland Wine Imports. The Ales are brewed at our brewery in San Jose, CA. The Line includes a Double IPA, Smoked Porter, Vanilla Pale Ale, Hefewiezen and a Strawberry Wit. Ass Kisser Ales is a state of mind. Just as you contemplate the flavors and aromas of this fine ale, you can comtemplate sharing it with your friend or your boss. Maybe they are one in the same or maybe not! We are Just Sayin!

name: Chafunkta Brewing Company
description: Chafunkta Brewing Company is a Mandeville, LA based Nanobrewery and was formed by Josh & Jamie Erickson in June of 2011. The word 'Chafunkta', aka 'Tchefuncte', was an early Indian settlement located in what is now the city of Mandeville, LA. As a family run, Mandeville, LA based brewery, we believe that passion and personal attention is the key to providing you with a fresh, complex, full of flavor taste that you deserve as a craft beer consumer. By focusing on small batch brewing, we’re able to put our love and attention into each and every batch, giving you the quality and consistency that we demand and expect from EVERY CBC brew. Louisiana owned, Louisiana brewed, Louisiana loved, YOUR Chafunkta Brewing Company is raising the bar, one brew at a time.

name: Kissmeyer Beer & Brewing
description: Kissmeyer Beer and Brewing was launched in 2010 after ten years at Nørrebro Bryghus. The company spans over three main areas of business: Kissmeyer Beer: My personal beer brand offering my own and collaborative beers at home and abroad. Kissmeyer Brewing: My consultancy business offering services related mainly to the brewing industry. Kissmeyer Beer & Brewing: I offer a wide range of communication services including beer tastings and presentations.

name: Beaus All Natural Brewing Company
description: Beaus is located inside an old tannery in an industrial park, and makes some of the best craft brews in Canada, showing ingenuity in their craft, but also in marketing and distribution. From their website: We’re fiercely independent. Our beer and our brewery is a labour of love from start to finish. There were no deep pockets behind us when we launched and there aren’t any now either. Our success is derived from hard work, unbridled passion and the support from customers who appreciate these qualities and a well made beer. While we take great care in making the best beer possible, we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We go out of our way to take any pretense out of our beer. We believe in rustic, natural quality over fancy-pants snobbery. Our marketing and branding efforts try to reinforce this and we choose to market by talking to folks instead of blaring messages through mass-market advertising.

name: Barnhouse Brewery
description: We are a small brewery that focuses on making great beer for our local community. We make every effort to use locally grown ingredients from our home grown hops to fruit and honey from our local farmers. Barnhouse Brewery opened in October 2012 and operated for two years steadily growing a loyal following of folks that enjoyed our easy drinking beers. We use fresh ingredients (locally sourced when available) and traditional processes to bring you truly hand crafted beers. Last year we moved the operation to an 18 acre property and are currently working to reopen the brewery by the end of the year. We will be starting back up on our original 2 barrel system while our new 7 barrel system is being manufactured. We expect delivery of the new system by early spring. The new location will give us the opportunity to grow ingredients on site for use in the brewery and to provide our customers with that “rural“ atmosphere that keeps our customers coming back time and again. Come by when we are open for a tasting, a pint or two, or a growler fill! www.barnhousebrewery.com

name: Tibet Lhasa Brewery Company
description: The Tibet Lhasa Brewery Company Ltd. in Lhasa, Tibet is the world’s highest commercial brewery located at 11,975 feet in elevation and it is the only one in the Tibetan Autonomous Region. The brewery is a joint venture equally owned by a domestic corporation and a Danish investment led by The Carlsberg Group, one of the world’s largest brewers. It produces 85% of all beer sold in Tibet. It is the sole source of Lhasa Beer, “Beer from the Roof Of The World.”

name: Eastern Shore Brewing Co
description: Eastern Shore Brewing opened it's doors September of 2008 by owners Adrian and Lori Moritz. Both had an entrepanerial passion, but never thought of a microbrewery as their business. "The decision was made for us. Make a business out of something you love to do and you will never work another day in your life" the couple states. A lot of hard work and a love for good beer motivates the business. We decided to open Eastern Shore Brewing after talking with friends from St. Michael's Winery, and were told that the town was in need of a microbrewery. After some discussion (less than you may think), we agreed and were on our way. With some trials along the way in year one, year two proved to be the pinicle of change. An increase in brewery size promoted an increase of staff. Randall Marquis came on board as brewmaster in March of 2009 and has made his presence known. An undergratudate of Franklin Marshall College, and a brewing certificate holder from UC Davis, Randy is a large portion of the success of Eastern Shore Brewing. Three beers took home medals in the Maryland Govenor's cup competition (Bronze for Lighthause Golden Ale, Silver for the Duck Duck Goose Porter and a Silver for the St.ichael's Amber ALe) on October 9th. And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products. Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland. A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further. There is more to come....

name: The Knuckle Brewing Company
description: The first and only brewpub in legendary downtown Sturgis, SD. We opened our doors in July 2014 and are open 7 days a week. We are brewing on a 10 BBL system and distribute kegs throughout SD. We offer 5 year round beers as well as several rotating selections. The kitchen is open thru lunch and dinner and serves up some great food.

name: Huss Brewing Company
description: We are a Quality Lager and Aleworks Brewery with focus on American Craft Beer. We are located in the now defunct Rio Salado Brewery in South Tempe. We have a Tap Room with 20 revolving handles of the beers made on site along with the best beers available in Arizona. Two people with a lot of passion for Craft Beer. Owned and operated by husband and wife team Jeff and Leah Huss. Together they have 20 years experience in the Craft Beer Industry. Jeff “Ginger” Huss graduated from the Siebel Institute of Brewing Technology and was the Head Brewer for BJ’s Brewery in Chandler Arizona for over Seven years. Leah Huss graduated from Scottsdale Culinary Institute with a degree in Culinary Arts and has been the Managing Partner at the Papago Brewing Co. in Scottsdale since 2001. Both share a love and passion for American Craft beer and it’s culture, and look forward to sharing their knowledge and experience with you!

name: Columbia Brewery
description: Purchased by Labatt in 1974, and therefore now part of AnheuserBusch-InBev.

name: River's Edge Brewing Co.
description: River's Edge is Milford, Michigan's, microbrewery and gathering place! We're located in a distinctive building on the Huron River and across from downtown's Central Park. We'll be providing several delicious craft beers on tap, as well as cask-conditioned ales, and a selection of our house-made wine! Come on in and pull up a chair at our bar or a seat on our patio overlooking the park and river. We're looking forward to seeing you!

name: White Squirrel Brewery
description: The White Squirrel Brewery and Taproom will be opening in Bowling Green, Kentucky in 2015.

name: Hellbender Brewing Company
description: Hellbender Brewing Company was created out of a true love for the art, culture, history, and science of craft brewing. Just taste the beer we produce, and you will see the difference. We have created every recipe as an artistic interpretation of an existing style, and refined it with years of tasting and fine tuning. All of our flagship beer ingredients come from American brewing supply companies that source ingredients from the American midwest and northeast. The majority of the hops that we use are grown in Oregon and Washington State, but some of our specialty beers will be brewed with hops from our very own farm in upstate New York.

name: Portside Brewery
description: Portside Distillery is a micro-brewery and artisan distillery located Downtown Cleveland. Our location boarders the East Bank of the Flats and the Historic Warehouse District, and overlooks the Port of Cleveland and Lake Erie. We are a producer of small batch artisan spirits and craft beer made from the highest quality ingredients. We use time honored traditional distilling techniques along with modern brewing technology to create offerings for both the beer and spirit enthusiast. We are now distilling white rum and expect it to be in stores towards the end of November. We will start brewing beer in the next few weeks and plan to open a restaurant in May of 2013.

name: Krombacher Gruppe
description: The brewery was founded on 4 February 1803 by John Haas. His father, Johann Eberhard Haas chatted in Krombach an inn. As for a Regulation of 25 July 1618 serving of beer was only allowed if the restaurant also had its own brewery and a malt kiln, John Haas set up a brewery in the family business. The water for the brewery ("Hasbrauerei") they picked first in barrels from a spring at the foot of the Grumbergs in the west of the village by bullock carts to brewery. 1854 had a brewery owner Haas church annual 17 Gulden (Florin) pay rent that the water pipeline was conducted on church land to the village.

name: Birra Forst
description: Just outside Merano, on the way to the Val Venosta, a complex of buildings perfectly in keeping with their surroundings catches the eye. They are decorated in a graceful, highly tasteful manner and almost blend in with the flourishing local vegetation. Anyone who is curious enough to ask the name of this “village” – because that is what it looks like at first sight – will simply receive the answer “That’s FORST”. It is not called the “beer factory” or the “brewery”, but “FORST”. The name is inherently linked with the local area. It stands for tradition and love for nature, but also striving to ensure that the quality of its products remains consistently high. Traditional and modern values go hand in hand, making positive contributions to each other: this is the guiding concept of FORST.

name: Andean Brewing Company, Inc.
description: Imagine a place where ancient knowledge meets modern concepts, where tradition meets the distinct, a place where two elements fuse as one, a place so exhilarating it escapes the imagination. This union is only possible because of the long-standing tradition of the Andean people committing themselves to the Pachamama - Mother Earth.

name: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project
description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.

name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company
description: Wicked Weed Brewing is based in Asheville, North Carolina. Opened in December 2012, the original brewpub (91 Biltmore) consistently hosts 25+ beers on tap including hop-forward, West Coast-style ales, open fermented Belgians, and barrel-aged beers. With the opening of the second location, The Funkatorium, in October 2013, Wicked Weed is striving to become one of the leading producers of barrel-aged sour and wild beers in the Southeastern United States. Wicked Weed Brewing was awarded a gold medal for both 100% Brettanomyces Serenity in 2013 and Mompara Honey Ale in 2014 at the Great American Beer Festival. Wicked Weed most recently opened 50-barrel production brewery that will allow for wider distribution in the Southeast.

name: Fossil Cove Brewing Co.
description: We're proud to call Northwest Arkansas and the Ozarks home!! Formed in 2012 and based in the rolling Ozark mountains of Fayetteville, AR. Find us across NWA or visit the Tasting Room to experience our year-round, seasonal and limited releases.

name: Brasserie La Baleine
description: La Brasserie La Baleine est une micro-brasserie proposant des bières artisanales brassées de façon traditionnelle (à la main), ce qui permet de vous offrir des produits authentiques, vivants et naturels. Les bières qui y sont fabriquées ont ce goût caractéristique des pur malt. Les houblons, les levures, les plantes aromatiques et les épices sont sélectionnés afin d’obtenir des produits de qualité et des recettes uniques.

name: Brouwerij Huyghe
description: The oldest brewery in activity in Ghent.

name: Archibald Microbrasserie
description: The two microbreweries restaurant Archibald have become essential in Quebec! They are more than ever THE appointment of people connected to a drunken evening with friends or a delicious dinner head to head. On the beautiful terrace of one of the two microbreweries, there is no reason not to take the opportunity to come and offer an excellent meal while sipping a beer brewed on site. In addition, Microbrewery Archibald welcomes evening groups and singers who give the final touches to a friendly atmosphere among the most in Quebec!

name: Borealis Fermentery
description: Belgian-style inspired ales Small batch, bottle conditioned artisan ales made with fresh ingredients and artesian Lake Superior water.

name: Wynwood Brewing Company
description: Wynwood Brewing Company is Miami’s first craft production brewery in the heart of Wynwood Art District, featuring a tap room. We are family owned and operated with the simple objective of bringing fresh, delicious, and creative beers to thirsty South Floridians and tourists alike. We operate a 15-barrel brewhouse and distribute our blond ale, IPA, Porter, barrel aged Strong Ales and seasonal offerings.

name: Top Rung Brewing Company
description: Top Rung Brewing is a 10 barrel production brewery with tasting room at the brewery. Top Rung Brewing is a destination for craft beer drinkers to enjoy their beverage and view a production brewery facility. Our tasting room is family friendly and while we will only offer snacks, we partner with local food vendors and food trucks as well as allow patrons to bring in their own food of their choice or have it delivered. Top Rung Brewing.....bringing quality craft beer to Lacey.

name: 961 BEER
description: 961 Beer began during the dark days of the July 2006 siege on Lebanon. Tired with the lack of quality beer in Lebanon, Mazen Hajjar and his friends started to brew beer in his very own kitchen. The first batches were brewed in 20 liter kettles. Granted that war and blockades are not the ideal conditions to start a company, alongside everyone telling them they were mad to even consider it, they went ahead with it anyway. They decided that brewing a good beer for a great country was what they wanted to do the most. When 961 Beer officially began brewing they were one of the smallest breweries in the world, and the only microbrewery in the Middle East (and still are). Although 961 Beer now brews nearly 2 million liters per year, they still insist upon making beer using the very same principles: traditional techniques, quality ingredients and love.

name: Dovetail Brewery
description: Continental European Styles. Traditional Methods.

name: 51 North Brewing Company
description: Attention Beer Lovers, what you've been hearing is true! Lake Orion is about to have its very own microbrewery – 51 North Brewing Company. We will be located at 51 North Broadway, hence the name. Mary and Don Gindhart lead a small group of beer-loving, business-minded individuals that share one purpose – to create a microbrewery like no other. We will have an amazing lineup of hand-crafted beers, wines and meads, all made in-house. Along with this diverse group of drink selections, we will offer unique food pairings to complement these libations and provide high-quality entertainment and service. All these ingredients add up to a destination perfect for individuals, couples, families and friends.

name: Lake Placid Pub & Brewery
description: It began, like many microbreweries, with a homebrew kit and a love of beer. Not just a love of drinking beer but a real respect for the craft, the history, the art, and the industry, as well as a love for the brewing process itself. Today, Lake Placid Pub & Brewery has been brewing award-winning ales for 14 years and has expanded rapidly due to its popularity and quality, earning the respect of the brewing community. In 1996, Christopher Ericson and a college friend purchased P.J. O'Neill's, a pub in the small, Adirondack village of Lake Placid. They renovated the upstairs into a pub and restaurant, installed a seven barrel brewery, and began brewing. Chris' brewing experience included Federal Jack's / Shipyard Brewing in Kennebunkport, ME and The Shed Restaurant and Brewery in Stowe, VT. The Lake Placid Pub & Brewery soon became a popular spot both for locals and visitors to the Lake Placid area.

name: Lakemaid Beer
description: Wherever anglers gather, you’re bound to hear great stories. One of the better known and sworn-to-be-true is the story of the Lakemaids. Long ago, these freshwater mermaids found their way inland from the oceans, down the St. Lawrence Seaway and up the Mississippi, to summer in the cool, pure waters of the North Country. Each year, on the night of the Summer Solstice, they reward anglers who have kept their lakes pure, with ice cold Lakemaid Beer, made fresh from the deepest, purest water they can find.

name: Crystal Lake Brewing
description: We love craft beer, and Crystal Lake Brewing is all about the beer. We love drinking great beers, we love making them, and we can't wait to share them with you. Our goal is simple, to produce world-class beers right here in Crystal Lake. Starting this summer, you'll be able to enjoy Crystal Lake Brewing Co. beer at restaurants and bars throughout Illinois, but we'd also like you to come visit us in person in our on-premises tap room. Here, you can sample our beers in an open, relaxed space, then sit back and enjoy a pint or two of your favorite, all while admiring the brewhouse. The Crystal Lake Brewing Co. is a production brewery, and we're totally focused on producing top-notch beers. We won’t be serving any food in the tap room, but you'll be welcome to bring it in with you or order delivery from one of the nearby eateries. From time to time, expect to see a food truck parked just outside the front door, where you can grab a casual bite. The tap room will always be pouring our best known beers, but you'll always find "pilot" brews, too. These unique beers will be brewed in smaller quantities and will be available only here at the brewery. Something new will always be on tap. Of course, brewery tours will be offered, too. Look for "CLB" beer at your favorite tavern or restaurant this summer, or at a local summertime festival. Don’t forget to come on in and visit us in the tap room. We’ll have a pint waiting for you. Cheers!

name: Brauhaus Niederlauer
description: For several years, the married couple Federlein brewed their beer at home in their cooking pots. Just as a hobby, for fun. In their small Lower Franconian village of Niederlauer there still existed the house of an old brewery, built in 1880, but not used since the 1980s. Family Federlein of course knew about it, but just hadn't thought much about it. Some day however, a chummy master brewer wanted to visit that old brewery. And as it happened, once the Federlein's got the key and entered the old building, they knew: The brewery has to get used again! Since 2006 beer is getting brewed again in the brewery in Niederlauer. Just one beer. Just five times a year. Just 18 hectoliter per brew. A true microbrewery. But the enthusiasts work hard for it.

name: Open Door Brewing Company
description: Packaging brewery based in Lafayette, CO.

name: The Oak Brewery
description: The Oak Brewery is a pico brewery located just outside Brussels, in Tervuren. Started 8 years ago by two beer geeks, it has resumed activity in 2012.

name: Finnriver Farm & Cidery
description: The Finnriver crew farms and ferments on an 80 acre family farm and orchard in Chimacum, along a restored salmon stream on the north Olympic Peninsula of Washington. While our farm is remote, we're honored to be on the forefront of the Pacific Northwest hard cider revival and we are committed to producing both traditional and innovative hard ciders using premium, organic ingredients while maintaining an authentically farmcrafted and land-based operation. We source organic apples from across Washington state and grow our own organic orchard of over 3000 trees, with 20 varieties of heirloom and traditional cider apple varieties. We aspire to serve the land with cider, by caring for our soils, watershed and community while crafting award-winning premium ciders. Our ciders are a tribute to old hard cider traditions but also offer an approachable, fresh perspective on the possibilities of the fermented apple.

name: Ten Fifty-Five Brewing
description: Ten Fifty-Five Brew Works was founded in 2011 by a couple of local Tucsonans, who share a few core beliefs. We'd like to share those with you. So...we like beer, and we really like good beer. We want to put good beer in reach of those that want to enjoy it, and help nurture the developing brew culture in Tucson. We want to make beer for beer drinkers like us; adventurous beer drinkers that are just as likely to try something new as they are an old favorite. We are committed to the idea of the local nano-brewer; a small batch company using fresh ingredients and open minds to make some great tasting brew. Look for us soon, we'll be looking for you.

name: Elk Valley Brewing Co.
description: Just a simple home brewer who is inspired to turn his passion into a career.

name: Le Trou Du Diable
description: The Devil's Hole is a place of culinary discovery. Here you will have the chance to enjoy unique beers that will satisfy your taste buds as well as your appetite will be filled by the merits of his dishes.

name: Whiner Beer Company
description: Whiner Beer Co. focuses on barrel-aged beer, a tradition common in Belgium and France that is gaining foothold in the US. Industry veterans and partners Brian Taylor and Ria Neri aim to make beers for people with a wanderlust palate, a curiosity for the strange and unknown, and those who take their beer seriously, but never themselves. Housed in The Plant, a net-zero energy business incubator located in Chicago’s Back of the Yards neighborhood, Whiner aims to promote environmentally responsible brewing. The brewery will play a major role in the operations of The Plant’s anaerobic digester. Once up and running, Whiner’s spent grain will help fuel the digester, producing energy for the entire building. Whiner Beer co-founder Brian Taylor has more than 15 years of experience in the brewing industry and a Brewing Science degree from the Siebel Institute and World Brewing Academy in Munich, Germany. He has worked for Flying Dog Brewery in Denver, CO and Boulevard Brewing Company in Kansas City, MO. Most recently, Taylor worked at Goose Island Beer Company in Chicago, IL, where he played a key role in launching a wine barrel aging program that ultimately led to the development of multiple award-winning beers. Taylor’s partner, Ria Neri, is a Certified Cicerone and craft beer enthusiast who also studied at the Siebel Institute of Technology in Chicago and completed the Master of Beers Styles Program and the Sensory Analysis courses. Neri has developed beer programs for acclaimed bars and restaurants in Chicago, including Bangers & Lace, Trenchermen, Lone Wolf and Pleasant House Pub.

name: Notch Brewery & Tap Room
description: There is a myth born of the craft beer movement that flavorful beer is synonymous with high alcohol. The art of brewing great beer in the US without a debilitating ABV had seemed all but dead. Not anymore. Myths are simply myths, and beers of great flavor and quality have been brewed for hundreds of years in every great brewing nation except ours. Chris is not out to change the US craft beer world, but to simply brew the beers he loves to drink, and he thinks he is not alone. Chris has been brewing professionally since 1993, first as an apprentice at Kennebunkport Brewing, then at the Tremont Brewery in Boston MA starting in 1994. Today, Chris is an independent brewer – he owns no facility – instead brewing and collaborating with other breweries. He currently brews his beers at two locations, the Ipswich Ale Brewery (Bottles & Draft) and Kennebunkport Brewery (Cask).

name: Delafield Brewhaus
description: The Delafield Brewhaus features in-house brewed craft beers and original menu selections. We can accommodate up to 200 guests in our Banquet Facility. We are conveniently located between Milwaukee and Madison.

name: Partizan Brewing
description: We intend to start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and eventually we hope to be doing the impossible.

name: Montavilla Brew Works
description: Brewing balanced low-gravity beers, strong ales and seasonal lagers with integrity, diligence and a passion for freshness!

name: Daredevil Brewing Co.
description: Daredevil Brewing Co is a production brewery & taproom located in the Speedway neighborhood of Indianapolis. Our goal from the beginning was to simply have fun and make craft beers that we enjoy and that we enjoy sharing with others. We started the brewery with one year round beer, Lift Off IPA, a West Coast Style IPA inspired by many of the classic American IPAs from California that we enjoy. Lift Off IPA quickly grew to become one of the best selling craft beers across Indianapolis and Indiana. Due to market demand we reached capacity at our original production-only brewery on the southeast side of Indianapolis in mid-2013. To expand we purchased a 2.0-acre site in the Speedway neighborhood of Indianapolis in February 2014. We relocated all of our operations to the new location in May 2015. While we are most known for our flagship Lift Off IPA since relocating to the new brewery we also now distribute year round on draft and in cans our Vacation Kölsch, Muse Belgian Golden Ale, and Rip Cord Double IPA and we have a quarterly special release program with a focus on traditional German-style lagers, American IPAs and flavorful ales.

name: Little Egypt Beer
description: A tiny start up brewery in Southern Illinois (Egypt) specializing in recognizable stylistic beers.

name: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse
description: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse is a craft brewery in Loveland, Colorado! They feature German style beers and other unique flavors. Grimm Brothers Brewhouse is devoted to the art and science of beer and brewing. A passion for brewing and sharing of exciting flavors of beer are at the heart of this brewery’s values. Grimm Brothers Brewhouse was founded by avid home brewers and beer enthusiasts who love producing quality, flavorful beers.

name: Door County Brewing Co.
description: Door County Brewing Company is inspired by our surrounding; our friends, our families, our landscape. Our mission is to create beers that lead to a gathering of community and friends where ever you are. We promise to create only the best tasting, thought provoking, carefully sourced, eco conscience beers that are constantly pushing the edge of imagination and senses. What you will find in our beers is music, food, friends, family, travel, trees, soils and flowers—not just ingredients.

name: Ahnapee Brewery
description: From the loose horses and fires, to the ice houses and fermentation vaults, Ahnapee Brewery owns an integral part of beer-making history in Wisconsin as far back as 1868. Fast forward 150 years to find Ahnapee Brewery re-imagined by Head Brewer, Nick Calaway. True-to-style small craft batches of full-flavored beers are produced in the old Carnival Guernsey Dairy northwest of Algoma, and are served in a two-stall-garage-turned-tap room. A sip on history. Our American Amber Ale, Little Soldier, is named after Henry Schmiling our 1800s head brewer of short stature and once Civil War veteran. Or try our Gray Wolf, the English translation of Ahnapee, a Vienna Lager. This brew is our brewers representation of the 1800s Ahnapee Lager which was at that time, malted on premise and brewed by Henry himself.

name: Firefly Hollow Brewing
description: At Firefly Brewing, our mission is to express our collective pursuit of happiness through our shared passion for beer. We are a conglomerate of creative minds who believe we can make the world a better place by providing an atmosphere and a product conducive to creative expression. It is our sincerest hope that the beer we create helps you further your own creative journey and propels you down your own road to happiness. Our slogan, “Get Lit” is a testament to spreading our inspiration, because it takes more than one firefly to enlighten the world.

name: Pipeworks Brewing Company
description: Pipeworks began, as many breweries do, in the stove top kettles and plastic-bucket fermenters of the home brewer. Beejay Oslon and Gerrit Lewis met while working at Chicago's famous West Lakeview Liquors, a haven for beer geeks in search of new and exciting brews from around the world. While working there, the two got to thinking it was time to turn their passion in to a business. The first steps in that long journey took them to a the small town of Lo in the Belgian countryside. It was there that the Pipeworks boys lived and worked with Urbain Coutteau owner and brewer at the De Struise Brewery. While working there the boys honed their craft, learned the ins and outs of running a brewery, and had the opportunity to create their first commercially available beers. The success of these brews fueled their passion and prepared them for the work ahead of them. Upon coming back to the States the two began experimenting with pilot batches, formulating a business plan, and developing an image for Pipeworks. Now we are ready to bring what we've learned to the craft beer world!

name: Iechyd Da Brewing Company
description: Local microbrewery/pub. Brew house on premise with a 70 seat pub. 10 rotating taps and 2 handpulls. Simple and delicious menu includes fresh made pizza, oven-baked sandwiches and snacks made in house! Get some Great Local Beer!!!!

name: Bull Durham Beer Company
description: The Bull Durham Beer Company is located in the Durham Bulls Athletic Park in downtown Durham, NC. BDBCo is the first-of-its-kind in Minor League Baseball as the only craft brewery owned by a Minor League team. We offer the freshest beer during the minor league season at the Bullpen Taproom, and year round at the shaded beer garden just outside the stadium. Our beers will also be served at restaurants and events on the American Tobacco Campus all year around.

name: Quigley's Pint and Plate
description: Quigley’s Pint & Plate opened in November of 2007 under the ownership of Josh Quigley & Michael Benson. A local’s favorite, Quigley’s is a family-friendly restaurant with friendly service and a touch of warm, Southern hospitality. Lunch and dinner entrees are moderately priced and are anything but ordinary. Each meal at Quigley’s is unique and is inspired by traditional low country dishes. Quigley’s Pint & Plate is the only brewery in the Litchfield Beach & Pawleys Island area. Eight beers are always on tap at Quigley’s and fresh beer is available "to-go" in half-gallon growlers. Waterfront dining is also available on our patio during warm weather.

name: Logboat Brewing Company
description: Here at Logboat we brew the beers we like to drink. We constantly try to innovate and push ourselves to brew new, unique, and interesting beers to keep things fresh and exciting. Beer is meant to be enjoyed with friends and family in a social setting. We try our best to provide both a great atmosphere for enjoying our craft, as well as an engaging, educational experience to become better acquainted with the Logboat brand. Explore…Dream…Discover

name: Woodstock Inn Station & Brewery
description: The Woodstock Inn opened in 1982. The Woodstock Inn Brewery began brewing beer in 1995 on a 7 barrel system. We started as a Brew Pub with 8 different beers. As demand for our beers grew we added a 30 barrel production facility in 2012. We have two breweries on our property. The seven barrel brewery brews for our restaurant and does limited releases. The 30 barrel does all of our production and bottling. We do Brewery Tours every day at noon, seven days a week. There is a $5.00 charge, a pint glass a tasting is included. We also have a cask ale always on in the Brew Pub. The Brewery is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, 7 days a week. We also have 33 well appointed guest rooms, we also have a function room for 165 for weddings and gatherings. Please stop by for a visit.

name: Haas Innovations Brewing LLC
description: Small Microbrewery primarily doing hop trials for brewer evaluations. We sell draft only in the Yakima Valley of Washington State.

name: Third Street Brewhouse
description: The Third Street Brewhouse is a state-of-art craft brewery. Great facility, great brewers, great ingredients combine for great craft beers.

name: Jackalope Brewing Company
description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

name: Ranger Creek Brewing & Distilling
description: Ranger Creek is a combined brewery/distillery proudly located in San Antonio, TX. We make beer and whiskey in our “brewstillery”, and we make it by hand one batch at a time with lots of love and attention. As a combined operation, we use much of the same equipment to make both our beer and our whiskey, and we can do this because there are a lot of similarities between the two processes. It’s actually a really cool process to see, and we invite you to come take a tour and learn about it for yourself.

name: Maine Beer Company
description: Maine Beer Company is a very small micro brewery located in Portland, Maine. We don’t concentrate on any particular style of beer. We don’t do just big beers or small beers or light beers or dark beers. Our production is limited and our process is slow (our beers are 100% bottle conditioned) but our dedication to brewing really good beer and doing what’s right always comes first.

name: LauderAle
description: Established in January, 2013 LauderAle is a small batch, electric fired brewery located just outside of Port Everglades in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Founded by natives, LauderAle is the first and only Nano Brewery in Southeast Florida. We pride ourselves in cultivating authentic ales centered around local culture and influence. Our beers range in a wide variety of rotating styles from Blondes to Imperial Stouts along with seasonal's and special releases. We also serve several guest taps from local Florida breweries.

name: St. Francis Brewery
description: Saint Francis Brewery opened in the Spring of 2009 to great popularity and success. Known for our hand-crafted beers, Brewmaster Scott Hettig has built upon our foundation of five beers: Kolsch, Amber Ale, Nut Brown Ale, Weiss and Oatmeal Stout to feature a Bohemian Pilsner, Double Red Ale, Belgian Triple and many more. These wonderful beers are complimented by the great food Executive Chef Ron Wolf creates. When you stop in, make sure you try our ribs! They are made with our signature Oatmeal Stout BBQ Sauce

name: Bunker Brewing Company
description: Housed in an old brick scrapyard building in the East Bayside neighborhood of Portland, ME, Bunker Brewing Co. crafts small batch ales and lagers by hand, 1BBL at a time. Malt, Water, Hops, Yeast, Time, Temperature and the Passion to make a damn fine glass of beer.

name: Purity Brewing Co
description: One of the fastest growing craft breweries in the UK, producing three award-winning beers.

name: Twain's Billiards and Tap
description: We are a full service brewpub, restaurant, and poolhall located in downtown Decatur, GA. Open since 1996, we have been brewing our own crafted ales since November 2006, with Jordan Fleetwood on board as our brewmaster. Join us soon for a pint or two, some fresh, tasty grub, and few friendly games. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Cornel's Brewing Company
description: Beaumont's first Mirco Brewery, located in Bevil Oaks. Look for our tasty brews in a restaurant or store near you!

name: Skull Coast Ales
description: Incorporated in December 2011, the Skull Coast Brewing Company, Inc., is a new entity formed for the express purpose of brewing and distributing handcrafted artisan ales, and whose history has yet to be written. Prior to its formation, Dave Fox launched and operated the Skull Coast Ale Company, a limited liability company (LLC.), located in Fort Mill, South Carolina, organized in 2009. Without the investment dollars needed to start his own brewery, the Skull Coast Ale Company operated as a “Contract Brewing” or “Beer Marketing” company, in craft beer terms. For those unfamiliar with the terminology, the company contracted with other breweries to produce its beer recipes, and marketed the products under the Skull Coast name. After months of recipe development and searching for a brewery to contract with, Dave Fox brewed Skull Coast's first beer on St. Patrick's Day, 2010, in Virginia. The result was Maelstrom IPA; a true west coast style India Pale Ale, aggressively hopped with seven different Northwest hops. After months of traveling back and forth between South Carolina and Virginia to brew and transport kegs (roughly seven hours each way), Dave sought out a second contract brewing relationship closer to home. Unfortunately, every Carolina brewery Dave approached was at or near capacity. Undeterred, Dave created his own capacity. In the first of its kind contract model, Dave purchased his own 60bbl fermenter and bright tanks, and placed them in another brewery. The Skull Coast Brewing Company is the continuation of a lifelong dream. The brand was born in a small Charleston library after looking at a local map drawn in the 1700's, during the Golden Age of Piracy, with the words "Skull Coast" etched along the Carolina coastline. The Skull Coast products matured and our understanding of the beer business was developed during our contract brewing experience, under the Skull Coast Ale Company. Now, with a new entity, our own facility and unrestricted in our growth, the Skull Coast Brewing Company hopes to become a lifelong part of your history.

name: The Terminal Brewhouse
description: The Terminal BrewHouse is a locally owned and operated business; as such we go to great lengths and expense to utilize local products and services whenever available. It is our goal to be a contributing member of our neighborhood and city for years to come. In order to achieve this goal, we have instituted many green practices and initiatives. That being said, the kitchen and brewhouse are the heart and soul of what we do and why we are here. Only the freshest foods and finest hops make it into the Terminal and our passion is that only world-class beer and exceptional food make it to your table. We sincerely thank you for coming and promise this is as serious as we will ever get. Cheers, The Terminal Gang

name: Aquanaut Brewing Company
description: Aquanaut Brewing Company is the creation of brewer and graphic artist, Eric McNeil. In 2006, Eric McNeil moved to Chicago where he brewed his first beer in his apartment on Addison Street. Eight years later, with the help and partnership of Philip Tadros of Doejo, LLC, Aquanaut Brewing Co. was formed and found its home in the Bomanville/Edgewater neighborhood. We are dedicated to the entire package, inside and out. We produce fresh, locally brewed beers that have a seasonal flair; beers that are engaging to the palate while complimenting a wide range of foods. In embracing the entire craft, we have gained attention by concocting distinctive beer styles wrapped in original label art. We are passionate about producing well-balanced beers that are an exclusive example of that style

name: Faustino - Microcervejeira, Lda.
description: Faustino Microcervejeira is a production and trading company of Craft Beer. It produces several beers under various brand names that come to you with the utmost care and quality that we can. As we only use particular beer ingredients, barley, hops, yeast and water, we obtain an end product which distinguishes itself from the soda flavor, the aroma, the gas and until the foam. We also do not filter out our beer as it removes the same properties and with sterilization eliminates any living yeast. Did you know that in ancient times beer was the safest way to drink water? This is because beers have a long duration without spoiling due to microorganisms responsible for fermentation yeasts. These can overlap with agents that invade their surroundings, beer, killing them. Due to the lower alcohol content does not lead to dehydration as much as other alcoholic beverages. Thus one Brew is valid for drinking from about 1 year. The most interesting is that adequately conditioned beers, depending on the style, last up to five or even more years in the most extreme cases. Our all beers last more than 1 year but because the properties change with time, to better almost always guarantee only that period to enjoy what described on the label. How do fermentation in the bottle always guarantee that the beer will live yeast to the consumer, which on the one hand clears the beer and the other creates gas in it. Because of this fermentation in the bottle our beers have always deposit. These beers should have deposit, because besides any indication of handmade process demonstrates that there has been fermentation in the bottle.

name: Idyll Hounds Brewing Company
description: Idyll Hounds is a small craft brewery located in northwest florida. The white sand beaches forever blue sky and warm waters of florida give inspiration to the carefully crafted fresh tasty brews. Whether it's the tropical crispness of the Divide N Conch'r DIPA, the refreshing beachablility of our Man O' Wheat or the unique flavors of our seasonal line you can know our beer is responsibly brewed with the freshest and finest ingredients. At Idyll Hounds we brew for the beer enthusiasts and the novice beer drinkers alike. With a local first mind set concoctions are brewed with poetic attention to detail and memories that easily inspire lines of prose.

name: Eagle Rock Brewery
description: As the first brewery with operations based in Los Angeles in over 60 years, we're dedicated to the production of unique artisanal beers using the best ingredients to promote the ongoing development of the beer community in Los Angeles. Our microbrewery is attached to our public tap-room, where fellow beer lovers can gather to relax, refresh, and enjoy our unique beers. As we do not serve food, we encourage patrons to bring your own food or make a visit to the local food trucks/vendors that we have outside. Guests visiting our taproom need to be *21 and over to enter - no exceptions.

name: Mankato Brewery
description: Our goal is to bring craft brewing to Mankato Minnesota. Brewing great beer consistently and with the highest quality. Our plans are to have the brewery ready for production in the fall of 2011.

name: The Mermaid Tavern & Grille at The Great Deep Brewing Co.
name_short_display: The Mermaid Tavern & Grille at The Great Deep
description: Located in the heart of Hagåtña, the Mermaid Tavern & Grille is Guam's only brewpub restaurant, serving daily specials and Guam's only locally brewed beers.

name: Abbaye de Maredsous
description: Beer Maredsous is a beer Belgian of high fermentation brewed by Moortgat. Curiously, this beer has never been produced at the site of the abbey Benedictine of Maredsous. to Denéein Namur province. However, we can enjoy the on-site in earthen mugs. Since 1963, the abbey has entrusted the production and marketing at the brewery Duvel Moortgat located Puurs (province ofAntwerp), (which also gives us the Duvel) under the control of the monks. The beer is filtered before bottling, giving it very clear.

name: Herslev Bryghus
description: Herslev Brewery is a microbrewery located on a farm with its own farm in the village Herslev near Roskilde Fjord. We produce hand-brewed beer without computer automation. We use instead the eyes, nose and palate, and follows the beer from day to day. The key words of our production is quality, pure ingredients and full traceability. We make beer, we can enjoy, and let the seasonal time inspire us in the development of new, intense flavors.

name: Bad Martha Beer
description: At Bad Martha, we believe in three things: great beer, getting bad and doing good. Every sip of our premium craft beer is a reminder that there’s a paradise out there where you can kick off your boat shoes, let your hair down and leave it all behind. That paradise is Martha’s Vineyard. Don’t hold back. Don’t bring your off-island worries. Don’t be too good. Drink it all in. And while there’s a bit of bad in every drop of beer we brew, there’s also a whole lot of good that comes with every bottle we sell. That’s because Bad Martha is built on a simple idea – community first. We bring this idea to life by donating the first portion of profits to a local hunger relief charity. What’s left goes back into brewing more delicious Bad Martha. We’re proud of our beer. We’re even prouder of the island that inspired it. We hope you enjoy both as much as we do.

name: Angry Erik Brewing
description: A new craft microbrewery set to open in early 2014. "Passionate about beer, serious about our passion!"

name: W Brewing
description: We are bringing back the Craft in German Lager's here in the United States. Keeping it exclusive and tasty per every batch we create.

name: Lost Kingdom Brewery
description: Our tasting room and production facility are located within the old firehouse and municipal building on Main Street in Ovid. Our renovations have transformed the main floor into a tasting room with a gift shop featuring local and handmade gifts from the region, and bottles of local wines. Patrons can enjoy beers brewed in house, spirits produced on site, and select regional wines by the glass.

name: Mashcraft Brewing
description: We are happy to bring a variety of consistently great ales and lagers to all of our neighbors in Central Indiana. Brewing and serving from our Greenwood tap room, we strive to provide high-quality and hand-crafted beers for everyone to enjoy.

name: Une Année Brewery
description: A Chicago Craft Brewery focused on making great beer with an emphasis on Belgian and French styles.

name: Mayflower Brewing Company
description: Mayflower Brewing Company is a craft beer microbrewery located in historic Plymouth, Massachusetts. Founded in 2007 by a tenth great grandson of John Alden, beer barrel cooper on board the Mayflower, we are dedicated to celebrating the history and legacy of the Pilgrims by creating unique, high-quality ales for the New England market.

name: The Livery
description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.

name: Cervecera de Puerto Rico
description: The first brewery in the Island, Cervecera de Puerto Rico is Puerto Rico’s premier brewing company and a market leader in the non-alcoholic beverage industry. Cervecera de Puerto Rico is a quality driven company, supported by almost a century of brewing experience and a strong commitment to investing in the future.

name: Arcade Brewery
description: Arcade Brewery is a prospective production brewery. We want to create a deeper connection between our customers and their beer. Our goal is to create amazingly delicious craft beer with the help of our customers. With design challenges posted on our website, our customers will create and choose most aspects of beer creation from packaging/label design to even the ingredients that go into some of our seasonal beers. We want our customers to have greater control over the beer that they drink. Plus, we like to have fun and want to deliver you an amazing experience through your beer. Arcade Brewery is also collaborating with amazing comic book artists and writers to bring label and packaging design to a whole new level of awesomeness. We are currently working with the talented Tony Moore (The Walking Dead), Eisner-nominated writer Jason Aaron (Scalped, Wolverine, PunisherMAX), and graphic artist Seibei. Arcade Brewery is fun. We don’t believe in pretentious brews, but we do believe in great beers that satisfy our customers educated palette. Arcade Brewery is only limited to your imagination. Make the next beer your beer.

name: Cumberland Brews
description: Giving new meaning to the term microbrewery, Cumberland Brews may be one of the smallest eateries in town, with a half-dozen four-top tables and a short bar with nine stools making tight quarters of what used to be the White Mountain Creamery. (Techically, it's not a microbrewery but a brewpub - a restaurant that makes its own beer on the premises - but I'm not one to quibble in the face of a good pun.) It's usually packed, too, earning its crowds the old-fashioned way by providing very good food, friendly service, and the sine qua non for a brewpub: extremely high-quality hand-crafted artisan beers. Hand-crafted offerings are produced by Head Brewer Cameron Finnis.

name: Michelob Brewing Company
description: The Michelob Brewing Co. is a small, state-of-the-art brewery where some of the world's most skilled brewmasters have access to anything they need to craft new beer recipes. Admittedly, not every experiment works. But then, you only ever drink our finest results.

name: Mikes Hard Lemonade - Mark Anthony Group
name_short_display: Mikes Hard Lemonade - Mark Anthony Group

name: Alvarado Street Brewery & Grill
description: Our 10 barrel brewpub specializes in West Coast-style, hop-forward ales & lagers, Belgian inspired ales, and a variety of experimental styles. On the hoppy side, we particularly like showcasing the intensely tropical, citrusy, and earthy-green aromas and flavors of newer varieties from the Pacific Northwest and the Southern Hemisphere. We also like experimenting with Belgian yeast – the floral, fruity bouquet and soft, peppery spice created during fermentation make Belgian ales truly unique, and are often the best styles to pair with food. AND they make excellent barrel-aging candidates, some of which can be seen on display in the brewpub.

name: Pryes Brewing Company
description: Pryes Brewing Company (pronounced "Prize") was founded in 2012 by Jeremy Pryes, a home brewer who spent years perfecting his recipes before launching his first beer to the public. Jeremy’s passion for brewing came from his love of building things from scratch, his culinary arts background and his first hand experiences with the local brewing scene, first as an official beer judge and then as a board member for the local Community Hops Garden. Driven by the process of creating and understanding how things are built, Jeremy’s time working in the technology industry also helped him create a meticulous brewing methodology, tracking, measuring and honing his recipes. Pryes Brewing Company is committed to creating balanced, stand alone beers. Each style grounded in it's history, but inspired through an exploration of techniques and ingredients.

name: Erie Brewing Company
description: Erie Brewing Co. is a microbrewery that offers award winning craft beers to the Erie community and along the East Coast. You can stop in for a tasting and tour or find one of our 10 beers at your local bar, 6 pack shop, or beer distributor.

name: Wild Onion Brewing
description: Handcrafted Lagers & Ales, Brewed on Site! Available by the Pint, Growler, Can, or Keg!

name: Mississippi Brewing Company
description: Mississippi Brewing Company LLC plans be pouring beer in late 2013. What sets us apart from the rest is that we understand the need for local “Light Drinkable Beers” as well full flavored Craft beers.

name: Moa Brewing Company
description: Moa beer is the beer that comes from Marlborough, which is nice, because mostly Marlborough just makes wine, which is a bit boring. Moa uses the same deep bore water locals use to grow grapes and put out house fires. Moa Beer is also made the way beer used to be made before everyone started making it differently. So if somehow someone from 1950 travelled in time to go to the pub and had a Moa today they wouldn’t be surprised by its full bodied taste. This is because Moa beer is made by lots of people and not many machines as opposed to lots of machines and not many people. They would however, be surprised by the cost as Moa is quite expensive and they’d be used to only paying two and six. Whatever that is.

name: Bent Brewstillery
description: Craft brewery and small batch distillery located in the great state of Minnesota. We've got great ideas for unique, beer-centric whiskeys and bourbons.

name: Pilot Beer
description: Pilot was born when Matt Johnson and Patrick Jones met while studying for masters degrees in Brewing & Distilling at Heriot-Watt University in 2012, and it’s still just the two of us. A shared view that there was something different to be done in brewing – not traditional real ales, but not just another U.S. craft beer clone either – led to home-brewing together, which eventually led to buying a second-hand brewhouse and moving to the heart of cosmopolitan Leith, commencing brewing right at the end of 2013. We’ve never done things the easy way. We dismantled the plant ourselves. We moved it to Leith and rebuilt it ourselves. We dug out the drainage (pro-tip: pay real men to do that), installed the flues and built the cooling system ourselves. We design, brew and drink the beer ourselves. We even did the logo, artwork and THIS BLOODY WEBSITE ourselves. We are Pilot. Not taking the easy road runs through everything we do. The coffee in our Mochaccino Stout isn’t supermarket instant, but beans roasted and ground to our exact specifications, the cocoa a mix of raw and roasted organic nibs. The 50% malted oat mash for Blønd is, frankly, a swine. There are no shortcuts to the results we want. It’s hard work, it takes time and it’s expensive. But it’s worth it.

name: Golden Mongoose
description: Golden Mongoose offers unique high quality beer and alcoholic beverages. We strive to give our customers upscale products featuring a distinct and flavorful taste.

name: Kulmbacher Brauerei AG
description: We, the Kulmbacher Brewery, oblige ourselves day-in, day-out to ensure that we live up to the expectations of Kulmbach, the quintessential beer town. We both challenged ourselves to be and promise to genuine beer lovers that we will continue to make Kulmbach the secret capital of beer. We are beholden to the lovers of our beers. For them we mobilise our whole competence, knowledge and centuries-long tradition and experience of our brewmasters, in order to brew a first-class beer.

name: Port Brewing Company
description: Opened in 2006, Port Brewing (and it's Lost Abbey Brand) continue to produce an extensive line-up of continental and American- inspired ales and lagers. Under the direction of visionary brewmaster and co-founder Tomme Arthur, the brewery has garnered dozens of awards in its seven-year history including the 2007 Great American Beer Festival Small Brewery of the Year, The 2008 world Beer Cup Champion Small Brewery and the 2013 Champion Brewery at the San Diego International Beer Festival. The company’s beers, many of which are aged in oak barrels for 12 months or longer, are universally recognized for their complexity, unique flavors and bold boundary-pushing styles.

name: Abbey Brewing Company, LLC
description: Abbey Brewing Company, located in Abiquiu, New Mexico, is the producer of Monks' Ales starting with Monks' Ale released in 2005. The brewery is located on the grounds of the Benedictine Monastery of Christ in the Desert. The monks do not allow visits to the brewery.

name: New Glarus Brewing Company
description: Welcome to our quaint little brewery nestled on the outskirts of New Glarus, Wisconsin. The brewery is run by an enthusiastic couple, Daniel & Deb Carey, who have successfully combined business management and brewing professionalism. Our philosophy is based on individuality, cooperation and the employment of 100% natural ingredients to produce world -class, handcrafted beers for our friends in Wisconsin. Cheers!

name: Bottle Logic Brewing
description: Bottle Logic's mission is to brew the highest quality craft beer available, without compromise. Our state-of-the-art tasting room enhances our customers' knowledge and appreciation of our high quality beer.

name: Ingeniero Microbrewery
description: Small brewery dedicated to production and distribution of craft beer.

name: Morgan Territory Brewing
description: Morgan Territory Brewing is a new 15,000 ft2 brewery established in August 2015 in Tracy, CA. It started out as Schooner's Grille & Brewery and after many years the decision was made to share the beer with the rest of the world and pursue a production brewery. Same GABF award winning beer, brewer, and ownership. New bold name!

name: The Shed Brewery
description: Brewed Fresh Since 1965. Established in Stowe, Vermont! The Shed has been a Vermont staple for generations. Brand owned by Otter Creek Brewing

name: The Collective Brewing Project
description: The Collective is Fort Worth's first franken-monster of a brewery. We're an unholy marriage of production brewery and badass taproom. Ride your bike down to the near southside and hang out in our taproom, talk beer, play jenga, eat some chips and sample some of our beer you can't get anywhere else. You can also hop in your gas guzzler and check out the beers at your favorite watering hole.

name: Tioga-Sequioa Brewing Co
description: Tioga-Sequoia Brewing Company was founded in 2007 with a mission of producing world class beers that could bring awareness and resources to the preservation of the Southern Sierra Nevada Mountains in California. In 2010 we planted our flag in Downtown Fresno, CA and decided to take our journey of becoming the San Joaquin Valley’s local brewery a step further. Our beer and brands reflect the greatness of the region we brew in. We highlight the beauty of the Southern Sierras that run along the Eastern side of the San Joaquin Valley that include landmarks such as Yosemite National Park, Sierra National Forest, Sequoia National Park, Kings Canyon National Park, and Sequoia National Forest. We also integrate and feature local flavor, creativity, and culture in our products to give our valley residents a sense of pride in what they drink and support. Our award-winning Brewmaster, Kevin Cox, has been spent over 20 years in the brewing industry. He began his career as a cellar master/production manager for Heitz Wine Cellars in the Napa Valley from 1979-1989. He then moved to Fresno to help in the founding of Butterfield Brewing Company, a San Joaquin Valley favorite for many years. Butterfields Brewing Company evolved into Sequoia Brewing Co in 2003 and during his tenure with both breweries he won five gold medals at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver, Colorado, as well as numerous regional and State awards. In 2010 Kevin became head brewmaster at Tioga-Sequoia Brewing Co. and helped to build our current downtown brewery. All Tioga-Sequoia products are brewed in downtown Fresno, California. We recently renovated our grain warehouse to become a tasting room in a Beer Garden style fashion. Our hope is that the #TSBeerGarden will bring new life to our city’s downtown with an outdoor venue that provides a unique variety of fresh, local craft beer with an urban atmosphere. We host numerous types of events monthly that include live music, art shows, and food trucks. The Beer Garden has regular hours for onsite consumption with bottles, kegs and growlers to go.

name: Butcher's Brewing Company
description: Butcher's Brewing™, located in Barrio Logan near the Padres ballpark and trendy East Village, is scheduled to open in September, 2010. We are focused on our own unique interpretation of historical styles as well as creating innovative new styles such as our Hawaiian Style Pale Ale. Butcher's™ beer will be available locally through regional distribution and internationally in Japan, and will also develop proprietary brands for SoCal based restaurants and pubs. As an independent local brewer we are committed to innovation, involvement with our community and the integrity and independence of our products.

name: Emmett's Brewing Company
description: Established in 1999, Emmett's Brewing Company is comprised of three brewpubs in the Chicago suburbs. Tradition, craftsmanship, and the highest standards in beer and food are our passion. We believe in using only the finest ingredients in what we make, whether they are destined for your pint glass or your plate. Our original pub is in West Dundee and houses our copper-clad, seven barrel JV Northwest system. There, we produce about 600 barrels per year, including all of the company's barrel-aged and cask-conditioned ales. We opened Downers Grove in 2004 and brew on a 15 barrel Specific Mechanical system to make about 850 barrels per year. The 10 barrel DME system at Palatine is our newest brewery and is also the home of our bottle and draft packaging operations. Our beer can be found in chain and independent retail stores, bars, and restaurants throughout the Chicago-land area.

name: Ale Syndicate
description: Ale Syndicate Brewers is one of Chicago's newest breweries. Located in the Logan Square community, Ale Syndicate is dedicated to making craft beer worthy of Chicagoans. Ale Syndicate's founders, brothers Samuel Evans and Jesse Edwin Evans, aim to produce their unique take on traditional styles of beer, such as IPA, porter and session ale. Learn more at alesyndicate.com

name: Cottrell Brewing Company
description: Cottrell Brewing Company is a Connecticut-based micro brewery, manufacturing delicious craft beers a fine New England tradition. Our flagship brew is Old Yankee Ale, which is a medium bodied, American Amber Ale, that has a great up-front malt taste with a refreshing hop finish. More recently, we launched Mystic Bridge, which is a great example of a year ‘round New England IPA. A mild earthy IPA with hints of citrus, this beer is great for paring with foods or for session drinking. We believe in drinking local and thinking global!

name: Southern Oregon Brewing Company
description: Then we invite you to sample the hand-crafted brews of the Southern Oregon Brewing Company. Brewed with uncompromised standards in Medford, Oregon, we’re dedicated to producing a full line of tantalizing brews using old-world brewing techniques and only the finest natural ingredients. Served at discriminating restaurants and bars, one sip and you'll know that you've discovered something quiet extraordinary… beer that has been crafted by beer lovers for beer lovers. As a Southern Oregon owned crafted brewery, we’re dedicated to the highest standards of quality and returning a percentage of our profits to the local community.

name: Carolina Bauernhaus Ales
description: Carolina Bauernhaus™ is a farmhouse brewery in Anderson, SC. Our hand crafted ales pay homage to the rich agricultural resources of the Upstate by using locally sourced malt, grains, yeast, and hops. While our brewing techniques may be Belgian inspired, our beers are not reverent to tradition. We create unique flavor combinations through locally sourced yeasts, various species of brettanomyces, local herbs and spices; and, of course, lots of locally grown hops.

name: Narragansett Brewing Company
description: Narragansett Beer is New England's oldest beer, founded in 1890. It was the #1 beer New England from 1919 through the 1970's and the official beer of the Red Sox for over 30 years. It's now one of the fastest growing beers in New England and was winner of the Bronze Medal at the 2008 World Beer Cup. Narragansett has always been for New Englanders. That's why in these especially troubling times, we want to build a brand new brewery in the heart of New England. The brewery would provide a slew of new jobs and help stimulate New England's economy. We need to sell 7.5 million cases of beer a year to be able to make it all happen. And to do that, we need you! So Drink your part! You buy a case, we build a brewery.

name: Nashville Brewing Company
description: Nashville Brewery began operating in 1859; opening its doors to a blossoming city. Located just outside the city center on High Street, which is now 6th Ave South, the hand-crafted local beer quickly satisfied the thirst of the hard-working citizens. Though operations halted briefly during the Civil War, the brewery overcame the disruptions and re-opened in 1865. With a focus on German style lagers, the then named Nashville Brewing Company continued to brew quality beer through the end of the 19th century. We are proud to continue this brewing tradition and create the next chapter in this brewery’s history.

name: Kinky Kabin Brewing Company
description: Kinky Kabin Brewing Company LLC, Founded in October 2011, is a microbrewery that combines the love of craft brewing with the love of seduction and naughtiness. We promise that it "goes down good". Our beer celebrates lowering inhibitions of people, so that they get into a frisky, naughty, seductive, flirty, sexy mood. Both men and women will love it. The taboo of keeping sensuality hush-hush is being overwritten. We encourage people to become lustful yet classy, and our marketing strategy will be seductive and classy as well.

name: Pacific Brewing Laboratory
description: Pac Brew Lab started in a garage as a place for Patrick and Bryan to experiment with new beer flavors, styles, and brewing techniques. What started out as a place to share new creations with friends grew into a bi-monthly, totally free event with hundreds of our “new” friends and great local street food vendors. Patrick and Bryan brew small batches which allows for constant beer experimentation. They have been known to create exotic beer styles such as their Hibiscus Saison, Squid Ink Black IPA, Chamomile Ale, Lemongrass IPA, and Szechwan Peppercorn Red ale, wine soaked oak aged Brown Ale. Pac Brew Lab is always on the lookout for new ingredients and inspirations that will help them create new and tantalizing yet pleasing and palatable beers for the public.

name: Penrose Brewing Company
description: Art, Science, and Belgian-Inspired Brewing in Geneva, IL. This began with a shared obsession for skillfully brewed beer, and the starved need for cultural redirection of our lifework. Blissfully content with an opportunity to help refine a discerning palate, preferably with beer in hand, a deeper passion and commitment to the cause has evolved into Penrose Brewing Company. The cultural shift already underway is a by-product of intention and specificity. You will want to be involved.

name: B. Nektar Meadery
