It’s a sad tale, the closing of the venerable Brakspear brewery in Henley-on-Thames, where the most famous and surely the best bitter in England had been made for centuries. The brewery, in operation since 1779, was sold off in 2002 in parts to make room for an upscale hotel, and everyone who worked there was let go. For beer lovers, the closing was not a complete disaster. Thankfully, Brakspear’s master brewer, Peter Scholey, was determined to strike out on his own. He set up shop as Ridgeway Brewing, not far from Henley, and has been putting out beers so good they could almost make you forget Brakspear altogether.

name: Riley's Brewing Company
description: A bunch of guys and gals that have been brewing for years together decided to go for it. They brew like true craft brewers on what would seem like a giant home brew system. You can tell its all made with love and hard work.

name: Beaver Island Brewery
description: At one time, St. Cloud was the home of six local breweries, but with the closing of the last one in 1939, local brewing became a thing of the past. Until now. Nick Barth and Matt Studer, two avid homebrewers and passionate entrepreneurs, have teamed up with local professional brewmaster Chris Laumb to launch Beaver Island Brewing Company—a venture that will revive the rich tradition of brewing in St. Cloud.

name: Blue Diamond Brewing Company
description: Premium Handcrafted Beer by Blue Diamond Brewing Company of Minnesota use only the highest quality hops, grain and yeast to brew its craft beer - because of these high quality ingredients, we can guarantee you a premium hand crafted product with a consistent taste that you deserve and respect.

name: Draft Line Brewing
description: Draft Line Brewing Co. was founded by Scott Palmieri and Scott Wood. Sharing a passion for great beer, we began like most home-brewers several years ago brewing five gallon increments in the Palmieri family kitchen. Soon enough we realized that we needed to make a lot more beer. The home-brew setup morphed into 40 gallon increments... Once the operation began to resemble a nano-brewey we decided to forge ahead with creating a microbrewery in the heart of North Carolina. We like getting friends together and having a great time. Let us share our vision for what a great beer can be -- stop by our taproom in historic Fuquay-Varina, NC, now open!

name: Two Henrys Brewing Company
description: The Two Henrys Brewing Company brews modern and traditional hand-crafted beer styles in small batches in Plant City, FL. Because local and small is just better. With our beers we celebrate Florida’s short history and people that made our great state possible. We strive to make great beers and sneak in a Florida history lesson whether you want it or not. Our beers can be found at our tasting room starting on or about October 1, 2013 and select bars and restaurants in the Tampa Bay area. In the meantime, read about our coming beers and namesakes ,the Two Henrys, below…or don’t.

name: Rochefort Brewery (Brasserie de Rochefort)
description: Belgian trappist brewery. The brewery is located inside the Abbey of Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy, near the town of Rochefort, and has been brewing beer since 1595. There are approximately 15 monks resident at the monastery. The monks are very secretive about the brewing process, and the brewery is not open to the public, therefore much of the information publicly known about the brewery comes from only a few sources. As with all other trappist breweries, the beer is only sold in order to financially support the monastery and some other good causes. The monks will not increase production based on demand or profit motives, but only enough to support themselves, resulting in a fairly limited supply of beer availability. In practice, there is currently no shortage through regular channels. (Brewery Abbey of Notre-Dame de Saint-Rémy)

name: Galactic Coast Brewing
description: We are excited to join the beer revolution in Texas that is changing the state's beer culture as more Texans graduate from pale, watery swill to the new wave of rich, hand-crafted brews full of flavor, personality & creativity. We are avid, if not aggressive, craft beer enthusiasts and proud to return commercial brewing to Galveston County, which has a tradition of famous breweries dating to the 1800s although none in more than 30 years. Our model is as different as our self-built brewery, which features a 100% electric (Green) brewhouse. We leveraged enthusiasm and revolutionary thinking to overcome our unwillingness to burn extensive capital.

name: 3 Daughters Brewing
description: 3 Daughters Brewing is located in the art district in St Petersburg and we offer bold and innovative craft beers. With our 30 barrel (1 barrel = 31 gallons) brewhouse, we have the capacity to serve the Tampa Bay market and surrounding areas amazing beers such as our Beach Blonde Ale, Stern Line Oatmeal Stout, Bimini Twist IPA, Rod Bender Red Ale and other seasonal options. Our taps rotate often in our tasting room, over 90 recipes! There's plenty to do with access to board games such as oversized Jenga, ping pong, corn hole, darts, chess, checkers, life sized Connect4, tabletop shuffleboard, and much more.

name: Brouwerij Rodenbach
description: In 1821, the four Rodenbach brothers (Pedro, Alexander, Ferdinand and Constantijn) invested in a small brewery in Roeselare, in the West Flanders province of Belgium. The brothers agreed to a partnership for 15 years. At the end of this period, Pedro and his wife, Regina Wauters, bought the brewery from the others and Regina ran the business while Pedro served in the military. Their son Edward later took over the brewery (1864) and, it was during his directorship that the brewery saw great growth. Edward's son, Eugene, took over in 1878 and, in preparation for this position, travelled to England where he learned how to ripen beer in oak barrels and then mix old and young beers. It was this that became the method of producing beer that Rodenbach became famous for. As Eugene produced no male offspring, a public limited liability corporation was created and most shares remained in the hands of descendants of the Rodenbach's until 1998 when the brewery was sold to Palm Brewery.

name: Naples Beach Brewery
description: The Naples Beach Brewery is a family owned craft brewery founded with the sole purpose of helping beer drinkers who are disappointed with their current beer selection and are also frustrated with not being able to drink high quality local craft beer. We will make it a point to source local ingredients and products for use along the path from grain to glass. The brewery will begin brewing on modest sized equipment handcrafting small batch ales for the local community and surrounding areas.

name: Brew Hub
description: Brew Hub provides an entirely new business model for the craft brewing industry. With the right products and partnership opportunities, we’re putting the power back into the hands of the brand holder—without the capital exposure. With our first brewing and packaging facility in Lakeland, Florida, we will become an incubation center for partner-brewers looking to capitalize on the fast-growing craft segment. Our unique, turnkey solution will help craft brewers overcome production and distribution barriers to brand profitability.

name: Rooney's Beer Company
description: Pittsburgh is a city steeped in a rich history, climbing up from numerous hillsides, to spanning and wrapping around the banks of the three rivers. With the northern banks of the Allegheny and Ohio rivers serving as the background, the Rooney Family opened their first family pub on the corner of Corey and General Robinson Streets, later to be home to Three Rivers Stadium. The Rooney family is famous for their Irish roots, football, racetracks and soon will be known for another part of their storied past: BEER! Their roots go back to the turn of the 20th century when Dan Rooney (Father of Art Sr. – “The Chief”) opened their family pub on the corner of Corey and General Robinson Streets, later to be home to Three Rivers Stadium. In 1933, the family would expand the business to brewing at the General Braddock Brewing Company, in Braddock, Pennsylvania. Four Beers were produced: Rooney’s Irish Red Ale, Rooney’s Lager, Rooney’s Pilsner and Veterans & Civilian Pilsner / Lager blend. The handcrafted family brewing heritage continues today, at the historic Pennsylvania Brewing Company. The Rooney’s celebrate both its Celtic and Pittsburgh Pride with the next generation of brews with Rooney’s Old Irish Ale and Rooney’s Lager.

name: Roscoe's Hop House
description: Harkening back to old world brewing styles, Roscoe’s Hop House uses the highest quality malts and hops to bring forth this smooth, bright-flavored Amber Ale. With a nod to the past, this nicely balanced, true ale is brewed using traditional brewing methods for a unique flavor profile. The password to our best kept secret is found inside the bottle. This is brewed by Genesee Brewing Co.

name: New Boswell Brewing Company
description: The New Boswell Brewing Company started business on St. Patrick's Day, 2010. The brewery, owned by Rodrick and Kiera Landess began as a project at the IU East Center for Entrepreneurship. While majoring in Fine Arts at IU East Rodrick took classes in the Business Department studying Entrepreneurship and participated in Students in Free Enterprise. After completing his degree, the project took on a life of its own, slowly inching its way towards becoming a reality. In 2010, with the help of a matching funds grant from the Eastern Indiana Regional Workforce Board and the GrowthStart Project, New Boswell Brewing Company was able to purchase the required equipment to begin operations and work towards becoming a functional brewery. After a couple of months of practice and creating procedures, New Boswell hosted their Grand Opening at the 4th Floor Blues Club.

name: Angry Chair Brewing
description: The ultimate plan at Angry Chair Brewing is to brew beers that we like to drink. Right now we like to drink more sessionable styles: hoppy pale ales, Berliner weisses, low ABV saison, and other easy-drinkers. We plan to lean on these styles for our core beers. However, one thing we absolutely believe to be true is that the public will be choosing our “core” beers for us: if you like the beer, we will keep brewing it. We’re going to have an extensive barrel-aged program as well, especially for sour beers. We definitely hate being boring and doing boring stuff so you can look forward to experimentation and unique projects.

name: Rousal Brygghus
description: A microbrewery on the Rosal Island in Finnish archipelago. Quality beer for quality times.

name: Berkshire Brewing Company
description: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. is a regional brewery located in South Deerfield, MA, established in 1994 by Christopher T. Lalli and Gary A. Bogoff, a pair of homebrewers with the vision of being Massachusetts’ local brewery. Our goal is to produce clean, fresh, well-balanced ales & lagers in small batches. At the present time we are capable of producing 580 barrels (17,980 gallons) of fresh beer each week. All of our beer is unfiltered, unpasteurized and contains no chemical additives or preservatives. As craft brewers, we are now producing nine styles of beer year round and seven seasonals.

name: Abigaile Brewery
description: Abigaile is an effort by Hermosa Beach local Jed Sanford to bring a distinctive take on the American brasserie experience to Hermosa Beach; all in a communal setting that celebrates the location’s rich history as a gathering place for locals from all walks of life.

name: Denver Beer Company
description: Denver Beer Co. was born in our garages with a few batches of homebrew and a love for the craft of brewing. Serving only premium artisan ales and lagers, we utilize fresh ingredients and embrace both innovative and old world styles of beer. Similar to a farmer’s table, our beer selections change with the seasons. By brewing in small batches, we can ensure that a few old favorites are always on tap, but new goodies greet visitors each month. Our brewery is founded on passion for high quality, flavorfully crafted beer and the belief that the best pints are those shared with good company. Drawing inspiration from beer gardens of Bavaria, we designed Denver Beer Co. to be a place where new and old friends can share a table and pint out of doors.

name: Lady Justice Brewing
description: A philanthropic brewery that donates 100% of profits over cost to nonprofits supporting women and girls. Founded by three women who share two crucial connections: a commitment to social justice work and being a positive force in their communities and a love of great beer.

name: Sociedade Central de Cervejas
description: Sociedade Central de Cervejas was established in 1934, with the aim of selling the beers produced by the former breweries, Companhia Produtora de Malte e Cerveja Portugália, Companhia de Cervejas Estrela, Companhia de Cervejas Coimbra and Companhia da Fábrica de Cerveja Jansen. Centralcer – Central de Cervejas, E.P. is incorporated in 1977 following the merger of Sociedade Central de Cervejas, S.A.R.L. (incorporated in 1934) with Cergal - Cervejas de Portugal, S.A.R.L. (incorporated in 1972). Centralcer – Central de Cervejas, S.A. was therefore created as a result of the above-mentioned company’s conversion into a joint stock company, regulated according to Decree-Law no. 300/90 of the 24th September. The Company’s total share capital is privatised in 1990, and it is the first operation of this kind to be undertaken in Portugal. The Bavaria Group purchases a shareholding in Centralcer - Central de Cervejas, S.A., and becomes one of its main shareholders. Based on a strong leading position and the establishment of a winning team, Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas strategic objectives are an increased focus on its brands, consumers and clients, the creation of an atmosphere of success, operational efficiency and innovation.

name: Casey Brewing & Blending
description: Troy Casey created Casey Brewing and Blending in the fall of 2013 after years of experimenting with oak barrel aging and wild yeast and bacteria. He realized these types of beers were his true passion and decided to create a place where he could focus solely on 100% oak barrel fermentations using saccharomyces, brettanomyces and lactic acid bacteria, all while using local Colorado ingredients. Casey Brewing and Blending is the idea of bringing back old-world brewing techniques to the modern day consumer. Our beers are created with over 99% local Colorado ingredients. We ferment and age our beers in vintage oak barrels with a mixed culture of saccharomyces, brettanomyces and lactic acid bacteria. Time is one of the most important elements to us, as the barrel aging process creates flavors that are impossible to create any other way. Our beers are unfiltered and 100% bottle conditioned.

name: Bruery Terreux
description: Wildly Traditional Bière. The Bruery is excited to announce the formation of Bruery Terreux, a new brand that will focus solely on farmhouse-style ales fermented with wild yeasts as well as oak-aged sour ales.

name: Redemption Alewerks
description: Redemption Alewerks is a brewpub in Fishers, IN. Our goal is to provide a complete experience from unique brews to a great atmosphere. Our hope is that you will come to believe, as we do, that it is a revelation in indulgence.

name: San Diego Brewing Co.
description: We are a multi-tap brew pub/sports bar, pouring 7-10 house beers along with 40 guest beers. We offer a pub style menu to accompany our great tap list.

name: Harviestoun Brewery
description: The brewery was founded in 1984 by Ken Brooker on a farm just outside Dollar in Central Scotland. Due to the growing success and demand for Harviestoun Ales, the brewery moved to a new purpose built 60 barrel plant, 5 miles away in Alva, in 2004. Alva was chosen as the location as this allowed us to carry on using the outstanding soft water from the Ochil Hills. Harviestoun Brewery was later bought by Caledonian Brewery in 2006. However, in the wake of the acquisition of Caledonian brewing Company by Scottish & Newcastle UK, the brewery became independent once again in 2008 by three noble shareholders who sought to preserve the status as an independent award-winning micro-brewery. Currently, Harviestoun is going through some new and exciting changes to expand the brewery. We are working hard to increase production, while insuring that we still outputting nothing but quality beer. Please look forward to keeping up to date with us on our progress and exciting new changes to our product range.

name: Schlappeseppel
description: In 1631, King Gustav from Sweden took the city of Aschaffenburg. Legend has it, that the sweedish troops soon found out, that there was no single drop of beer in the barrels, while preparing the Johannisburg castle for the royal court. As it happened, there was a foot soldier by the name of Joseph Lögler amongst this troops, who was proficient in brewing beer. The short form of Joseph is “Sepp” or “Seppel” for “little Joseph”. Obviously, by making beer the brave soldier Seppel was of much better use to the King of Sweden, because he was going lame due to an old battlefield injury to the leg. The injury was the cause for his nickname “Schlappe-Seppel”. The beer of the brave soldier was very well received because of its excellence and very soon after the first brew, he had to make more beer. In the end, he stayed behind in Aschaffenburg, after the Swedish troops had left. He settled as a cooper and brewer. The Schlappeseppel Beer was born.

name: Stroh Brewery Company
description: A name as important to the success of Detroit as Ford or Chrysler, the Stroh family began with humble roots, brewing beer in a family-owned inn during the 18th century in Kirn, Germany. In 1848, during the German Revolution, Bernhard Stroh, having apprenticed at his father side, immigrated to the United States. He established his own brewery in Detroit in 1850. Stroh named his new company Lion's Head Brewery, adopting the Lion's Crest logo from the Kyrburg Castle in Germany – the same crest that adorns Stroh beers today After establishing the brewery, Bernhard's son, Bernhard Jr., continued its expansion. A firm proponent of tradition and quality, he introduced the European method of fire-brewing to America. The fire-brewing process uses a direct flame rather than steam to heat beer-filled copper kettles. The resulting higher temperatures intensify the aroma and body of beer, resulting in a more flavorful brew. During Prohibition, the Stroh family operated the business under the name The Stroh Products Company, producing near beer (beer with its alcohol extracted), birch beer, soft drinks, malt products, ice cream, and ice. Though production of most of these items ceased when Prohibition ended in 1933, Stroh Ice Cream can still be enjoyed at parlors today. The Stroh Brewery grew alongside the other titans of Detroit industry. In 1964 the company made its first move toward expansion when it bought the Goebel Brewing Company, with an eye towards national distribution. As other national brands began to enter the Detroit market, Stroh began to aggressively pursue other markets. In 1973, Peter Stroh's willingness to depart from years of tradition enabled Stroh's to survive, but the changes were hard to swallow for many Stroh's employees. Stroh broke the company's tradition of family management and recruited managers from other companies. He also introduced a light beer, Stroh's Light. Though the brewery encountered many difficult times, the tradition and quality of Stroh's has never changed, and the quality of Bernhard's family-owned beer continue today, with Stroh's and Stroh's Light.

name: Sea Dog Brewing Company
description: Today, Sea Dog Brewing Company operates brew pubs in two locations. The Sea Dog in Topsham occupies a scenic spot on the Androscoggin River. The Bangor location overlooks the historic Penobscot River. Both locations serve a full menu of handcrafted ales and creative pub fare with a flair. Being authentic is important to us. Our beers are brewed in a traditional style using only the highest quality ingredients like imported English two-row malted barley and British top-fermenting yeast. Our English brewing style results in brews with a distinctive, refreshing taste and crisp finish unique to top-fermented beers.

name: Fire Island Beer Company
description: Fire Island Beer Company has emerged from the handiwork of two brothers and a cousin who developed their taste for craft beer and home brewing during the summers they spent on Fire Island, the naturally beautiful barrier island just off Long Island's south shore. The relaxed island has attracted families, artists, partiers, weekend beach-goers and outdoor sports lovers for generations, yet it refuses to allow cars, pretention and the frantic pace common to NY-metro area culture. This led us to coin it “The Other New York”, a concept we find very refreshing.

name: Logsdon Farmhouse Ales
description: Small farm brewery located in the upper Hood River Valley, OR. We strive to create unique and intriguing beer. In the farmhouse brewery spirit, we use certified organic ingredients such as whole leaf hops, barley and wheat malts, groats(whole oats), and several strains of yeast. These are combined to make a product of uncompromising quality.

name: Birrificio Rurale
description: Il Birrificio Rurale nasce nel 2009 dall'idea di cinque appassionati birrofili che hanno voluto ritrovare le origini agricole della birra in un territorio a forte vocazione rurale. ​Per questa ragione il Birrificio vede la luce ospite di una realtà agricola, valorizzando quella struttura che un tempo immagazzinava il raccolto annuale: il silos.

name: Indiana City Brewing Co.
description: It’s our mission to brew innovative beers for craft beer lovers in Indy. And that is that. We’re focused on Indy. We’re doing all we can to add to the beer culture right here. We’re filling growlers at our taproom near downtown, and we’re on tap at select craft beer bars in Indy.

name: Kalona Brewing Company
description: We, at Kalona Brewing Company, are passionate for quality, are uniquely offbeat-but substantial, creative, warm and inclusive. We believe you will find that reflected in both the products we brew and in the restaurant atmosphere we create for your dining and drinking enjoyment. One of our goals is to be Kalona’s living room – a place where people can come to relax, relate, and have some recreation playing scrabble or dominos by the fireplace in the sofa area of the restaurant. Plus we have a fantastic beer garden to enjoy during the warmer weather. Kalona Brewing Company and Eatery is strategically located in beautiful downtown Kalona at 405 B Avenue, a half hour drive south from Iowa City. The brewery is home to a fifteen barrel brewing system from Newlands Systems Inc., which includes a three vessel brew house, four 15bbl fermenters, two 30bbl fermenters and two 15bbl bright tanks.

name: Winchester Brewing Company
description: Good Beer for Good People

name: Boom Island Brewing Company
description: Boom Island Brewing Company opened fall 2011 on the shores of the Mississippi, a hops throw away from of our namesake island. Inspired by traditional Belgian recipes and brewing techniques, our beers are handcrafted using pure Minnesota water and the freshest, natural ingredients. Head Brewer Kevin Welch has won numerous awards for his creations, including our flagship beers, Thoprock, Hoodoo, Silvius and Brimstone.

name: Blackfoot River Brewing Company
description: Blackfoot River Brewing Company was founded in 1998, and began producing their line of handcrafted beers in January of 1999. The Brewery is located in the heart of historic Downtown Helena and near the headwaters of both the Big and Little Blackfoot Rivers. The founding partners established the brewery to produce the finest, handcrafted, traditional beers to be found in Montana. All Blackfoot River beers are brewed with the highest quality traditional 2-row malts, hops, and yeasts, individually selected to produce each particular style of beer. Each of our specialty beers are carefully handcrafted 14 barrels at a time. Blackfoot River's beers are never pasteurized, normally unfiltered and are available exclusively on draught. Blackfoot River Brewing was founded and is operated by three partners: Brian Smith -Head Brewer and General Manager Greg Wermers - Off-Premise Sales Brad Simshaw - Brewer and Regulatory/Tax Manager Fourteen barrel, three-vessel, steam-fired brewhouse (3) Fourteen barrel fermentation vessels (5) Fourteen barrel conditioning/bright tanks (3) Seven barrel conditioning/bright tanks Packaging: draft Capacity:1,850 barrels (annual)

name: Martinsbräu
description: Im Spessart family brewery Martin is firmly rooted in Marktheidenfeld. The company is family owned and is celebrating its 130th anniversary in 2013. Even when passing over the bridge over the Main to Marktheidenfeld each is clear: the Martinsbräu and the city Marktheidenfeld are closely related. Brewery and city for generations could provide an important impetus for the development of urban and rural areas. Founded in 1883 by Henry and George Martin, sons of gypsum and oil Georg Müller David Martin, now heads Mary Martin as manager in the 4th generation of the brewery. Beer has always played in the history of the city Marktheidenfeld an important place. Thus, the Martinsbräu evolved over the past 130 years extra initial five other breweries to a fixed size in terms of specialty beers. Prudently, a keen awareness of the environment and a clear commitment to Spessart region describe the most excellent way of the brewery to a traditional economy size. We call a friendly "Cheers" and look forward to be able to prepare you with our very high quality and award-winning drinks pleasure and enjoyment. Originality is our unique beer before mixing trends in juvenile look. . Under the umbrella brand Skt Martinus all varieties are: Pils and wheat exports over to the dark land of beer for fresh, palatable and genuine Franconian beer consumption. That to remain, name guarantees Martin. Currently, with Mary Martin and the future certainly one of their three sons - because tradition obliges especially in a family brewery.

name: Bauhaus Brew Labs
description: Bauhaus Brew Labs is a family of musicians, scientists, artists and above all, beer lovers, aiming to reinvigorate the spirit of the family brewery. At Bauhaus, we take a unique look at classic German-inspired beer styles, skewed slightly by a sense of play and adventure. Our flavor-forward, sessionable beers are crafted to surprise and delight without taxing the palate.

name: Lazy Hiker Brewing Co.
description: Deep in the mountains of North Carolina, just off the Appalachian Trail, sits Franklin, NC. In the old Town Hall on the end of Main Street we're crafting beer and community that's fresh and honest. Untie your boots and enjoy the view - no matter how hard you hiked to get there.

name: Darling Brew
description: During a 9 month road trip through Africa, owners Kevin and Philippa stumbled across the idea of micro breweries and instantly knew that Darling would be the perfect home for one. 'Slow Quarter' is the Darling Brew taproom located in Darling. Here we aim to marry our beers with a selection of light tapas styled meals.

name: Glacier Brewing Company
description: The Glacier Brewing Company is located at 6 Tenth Avenue East in Polson, Montana. We are a production microbrewery with an attached tasting room. We produce seven beers and three sodas. Several are available in western Montana in six-packs!

name: Flying Monkeys Craft Brewery
description: The Flying Monkeys Craft Brewery is locally run by a few beer-lovin’ friends and a family of unwavering Beer Disciples right in the heart of downtown Barrie, Ontario. We’re brewing towards a day when Ontario beer lovers won’t have to look south of the border for artisanal beers made with enough hops to rip your tongue from your mouth; for edgy brews with alcohol contents that rival spirits; for rich beers aged in bourbon barrels; or creative ales brewed with strange and interesting ingredients. Our philosophy? Keep the Microbrewery Revolution going --and let the Brewscape of Ontario show how complex and versatile craft brewing can actually be. Bottoms up, and Release the Flying Monkeys!

name: Seaside Brewing Company
description: We are brewers, musicians, surfers, lovers, fighters, gardeners, mechanics, star gazers, dog lovers, tide watchers, loud laughers, fish catchers, and triple dog dare-ers. We also have the best bonfires on the planet. We believe that the only thing in the world better than drinking Oregon brewed craft beer is drinking Oregon brewed craft beer in an awesome place like Seaside.

name: Mike Hess Brewing Co.
description: Mike Hess Brewing holds the distinction of being San Diego’s first licensed nano-brewery. Thoughtful branding, a great team and well crafted beers - most of which are now award-winning - led to growth into a beautiful, world-class brewery and tasting room in the heart of North Park, San Diego's most craft-centric and hippest neighborhood.Stop by our tasting room and taste it for yourselves. Great Beer. No Exceptions. No Excuses.

name: Indslev Bryggeri
description: Here at the first Weissbier brewery in Denmark, we focus on innovation with respect for tradition. In developing the best beers and brewing techniques. With roots going back to 1897 Indslev Bryggeri on Funen reopened as a modern brewery in April 2006. The equipment and the raw materials we use are selected to achieve the very best quality. Weissbeer from Indslev Bryggeri has great taste. Every week shops, cafes and restaurants across the country get freshly tapped beer from Indslev - so you can enjoy the best beer in your glass. Weissbeer is classic Belgian and German beer tradition dating back to ancient times. And the right person to introduce the German weissbier tradition of Indslev Bryggeri is Brewmaster Stefan Peter Stadler. He has 30 years of experience with Weissbier and the art of brewing beer for the senses. Stefan Peter Stadler was born and raised in Munich, where he is graduated master brewer at Hofbrauhaus in Munich. He has experience in both German and Danish breweries. Discover our interpretation of Danish Weissbier that is hand-brewed by Bavarian tradition. We believe that hand-brewed beer tastes better. The entire brewing process is controlled by hand, and we treat for all the details and the best ingredients. There is no additives - only malt, hops, yeast, water and a few spices.

name: Southern Brewing Company
description: The Southern Brewing Company 231 Collins Industrial Blvd., Athens, GA 30601 706-548-7183 sbcadmin@sobrewco.com

name: Bristol Beer Factory
description: BBF Beers like Bristol itself seamlessly blends the modern and historical. Tried and trusted styles of beer with modern interpretations, brewed in a hundred year old brewery building that harks back to an industrial age gone by, drunk in the modern surroundings of Bristol’s bars and pubs. Today’s finest ingredients, malt from Wiltshire and hops from Herefordshire, in Award Winning beers made by people who care. We are constantly trying to pack as much flavour into our beers as possible; we don’t cut corners, and always seek to improve the beers we brew. Enjoy Bristol Beer Factory beers in the pubs, bars & cafes from a cask, or at home from our new range of bottle-conditioned beers available throughout the southwest and online here.

name: Lion Co
description: Lion is a leading beverage and food company with a portfolio that includes many of Australia and New Zealand’s favourite brands. Lion was formed in October 2009 under the name ‘Lion Nathan National Foods’, when Kirin Holdings Company Limited completed its purchase of Lion Nathan and merged the business with National Foods – which it has owned since 2007. In 2011, we became known as Lion.

name: The Spencer Brewery
description: Spencer Trappist Ale, America's first and only Trappist beer.

name: Chaos Mountain Brewing
description: Chaos Mountain Brewing opened it's doors April 2014. We are dedicated to producing the finest beer possible with the best available ingredients. Chaos Mountain has a 30BBL brewhouse and a 7BBL pilot system that allow us to produce six production beers, seasonal beers and a constantly changing variety of limited release products. Visit us in Callaway, Va. at the base of Cahas Mountain in the Blue Ridge Mountains.

name: Great Waters Brewing Company
description: Independent brew pub, since 1997, specializing in cask-conditioned ales served straight from the firkin. Serving lunch, dinner, full bar, and wine list as well.

name: Lost Winds Brewing Company
description: Established in Fall 2016, Lost Winds is a San Clemente, CA brewery focusing on American and Belgian ales. 14 beers on tap in the thoughtfully designed tasting room just two miles from the beach.

name: Brewery Rickoli
description: We are proud to announce the recent opening of Brewery Rickoli, The Premier Brewery in Wheat Ridge Colorado, serving freshly brewed craft beer and offering a relaxed and friendly space to gather. We are located by the Southwest corner of 44th Ave. and Wadsworth Blvd. Our take on beer is simple – Use great ingredients and brew for flavor! Rickoli’s respects the liquid in the glass and wants to help elevate beer to a refined drinking experience. That’s why we use the finest ingredients and brew in a leisurely manner. The beer tells us when it’s ready. We refuse to be a slave to production deadlines. Wheat Ridge Colorado is a relaxed community just west of Denver with easy access from I-70. Wheat Ridge was one of the few remaining enclaves along the Front Range without a microbrewery. This changed in November 2012! We are dedicated to providing our local neighborhood with a place to relax and have a pint close to home. Our Brew master, Rick Abitbol has been professionally brewing award winning beers along the Front Range for over a decade. Rick is respectful of beer styles and traditional brewing technique. And has long been an innovator of style and not afraid to color outside the lines. He was one of the first brewers to explore the Black IPA which has since come to be regarded as a new style in judging guidelines. We love hops! That’s not to say you won’t find any wonderfully malty creations on tap there are many, but what you will notice is the variety in our hoppy selections. Be on the lookout for Rick’s special brews! We’re Talking Much Better Beer! We are pleased to feature a great selection of Gluten Reduced Beer. All Rickoli’s brews that do not contain wheat are considered gluten reduced. Making great craft beer more accessible to everyone. Our glass rinsing stations insure a beer clean glass every time! We want you to drink beer not sanitizer! We hope you will stop by for a pint or two!

name: Epicure Brewing
description: Epicure Brewing is a 15 BBL craft brewery in the Historic Norwich Harbor district. Enjoy a delicious beer in their taproom that offers a lofty industrial vibe with views of the brewing operations.

name: Steam Whistle Brewery
description: The Steam Whistle story begins in the spring of 1998 when three friends were on a canoe trip in the Ontario heartland. Greg Taylor, Cam Heaps and Greg Cromwell had all been colleagues at one of Canada's premier microbreweries producing quality beer in the late 1980's and 90's - before it was bought out by a national brewer and closed down. As they sat around the campfire, the self-named "Three Fired Guys" dreamed of running their own brewery one day. To make a Pilsner that would compete with the best in the world. They wrote a plan and quickly attracted investors with their vision and passion.

name: Brouwerij Artois
description: At Stella Artois, we are extremely proud of our Belgian roots. Our story can be seen on every bottle of Stella Artois. If you look closely, hints of our origins are proudly displayed. By 1366 roots of our brewing tradition had been established in the city of Leuven, Belgium– which is also where the original Den Hoorn brewery was founded. Den Hoorn laid the foundation for the quality taste and standard Stella Artois is known for. The symbol of the Den Hoorn Brewery is proudly displayed in Stella Artois' cartouche to this day. Sebastian Artois was admitted to the Leuven Brewer’s Guild as a Brew Master in 1708, and only nine years later purchased the Den Hoorn brewery. In memoriam, you can find his last name on the brewery and every bottle of Stella Artois around the world. The Artois Brewery was so beloved internationally and locally, a special batch was created as a Christmas gift to the people of Leuven. That special batch was the first to officially include "Stella" in its name. "Stella", meaning star in Latin, pays homage to this original occasion, accompanied by a star on every bottle. So next time you see a bottle of Stella Artois, take note of the rich history paired with the rich flavor on and in every bottle.

name: Stiegl Brauerei zu Salzburg
description: Since 1492, we brew here at our single site brewing beer with the Salzburg best spring water from the nearby Unterberg. As the largest private brewery in Austria, which is as independent and successful independent family business, we want to continue to be the most popular beer of the Austrians. Therefore, we focus on the art of brewing at the highest level of quality and so consistently. In order to brew good beer, it requires a lot of brewing experience and the right G'spür in dealing with the raw materials. That's why we talk about the art of brewing!

name: By The Horns Brewing Co
description: By The Horns Brewing Co. began its humble start with two friends brewing beers they loved on a homebrew kit in their garage. Beers were brewed on Sunday mornings, where biscuity malt and hop aromas would waft through their house waking up their two other housemates. Before too long they realised they wanted to brew these beers every day of the week and share their passion of brewing and drinking good beer with the rest of London. Recipes were put together, brewing vessels were purchased, an industrial premises was let and the brewery in Summerstown, London, was born. Alex Bull and Chris Mills, the co-founders, had put together a microbrewery based in South-West London which created small-batch full-flavoured ales. Initially, four flagship ales were brewed for cask ale and bottles, with new on-off limited edition beers being created every month. Within 18 months of operation the brewery was expanded with new vessels installed and a Brewery Tap was added. The expansion enabled keg beers to be produced, including a variety of lagers and stronger craft keg beers, with our Brewery Tap serving our beers directly from where they are brewed. We now produce four flagship ales and at least three varying seasonal ales every month. We also produce five flagship bottle beers which are sold to many of London’s finest beer bottle shops and also have two flagship keg beer(our Crafty Lager 5.3% & Wolfie Smith Amber Ale 5.2%) with four seasonal kegs beers.

name: McCashin's Brewery
description: Welcome to McCashin’s Brewery, home of New Zealand’s finest beverages. Our distinctive range of beverages is lovingly handcrafted from traditional recipes that have been the pride of the McCashin family for almost 30 years. We use only the finest natural ingredients, sourced mainly from the Nelson region of New Zealand, a region renowned for its organically rich soils and perfect climate. Our Palaeo water is amongst the purest in the world. And it is this water – along with our fresh, 100% pure ingredients – that give our beer, cider and spirits that uniquely refreshing flavour, which McCashin’s is famous for. Please take a tour of our website, and if you have any questions please contact us. We’d be delighted to hear from you.

name: Belfast Bay Brewing
description: Our mission is for EVERYONE to try Belfast Bay Lobster Ale and McGovern's Oatmeal Stout from Belfast Bay Brewing Co. in Belfast, Maine We are a family owned Micro Brewery in Belfast, Maine. We currently distribute two beers, Lobster Ale and McGovern's Oatmeal Stout, in 12oz bottles, 1/6 barrels and kegs in 13 states and 4 countries!

name: Post Falls Brewing Company
description: Microbrewery on the banks of the Spokane River in Post Falls, Idaho.

name: Stoup Brewing
description: Stoup Brewing – The Art and Science of Beer At Stoup, our craftsmanship is a testament to our commitment to the art and the science of beer. As scientists, we hold the microorganisms and chemical processes that create beer in the highest esteem. As artists, we revel in a good pour. The dual disposition honors traditional styles perfected by earlier brew-masters as well as elevates craft brewing by continually seeking a better pint. Our brewery will communicate a respect for both the art and science of beer by cultivating a warm and communal environment – a place for friends to gather and for enthusiasts to chat with the brewers over a well-fashioned, delicious beer.

name: Baxter Brewing Company
description: Baxter Brewing Company is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine. Founded by company President & CEO Luke Livingston (who is joined by Director of Brewing Operations/Head Brewer Michael LaCharite), Baxter Brewing Co., LLC is the first craft brewery in New England to can its entire line of beers. Located in the historic Bates Mill in Lewiston, Maine, Baxter beers are currently distributed throughout the state of Maine and are expected across the rest of northern New England in the summer of 2011. For more information, please visit www.baxterbrewing.com.

name: Straub Brewery
description: Straub Brewery is one of only four remaining American Legacy Brewery's in the United States that began brewing before prohibition and remains owned and operated by descendants of the founding family. In 2017 we are celebrating 145 years of brewing heritage.

name: Angry Hank's Microbrewery
description: Old time service station turned brewpub, Angry Hanks is in very close proximity to the other brewpubs in town, making it very easy for a pubcrawl. With garage doors that open onto their wood-fenced patio, Angry Hanks has a unique service station ambience. Head brewer, Mohr worked at Red Lodge Ales for five years before moving to Billings and opening his own brewery. Providing outstanding selection and quality with 8 ales on tap including Anger Management Belgian-style Wheat, Angry Hank's Blonde, Street Fight Imperial Red, Dog Slobber Brown and Head Trauma IPA as well as seasonal beers.

name: Bulmers Cider
description: H.P. Bulmer, otherwise known as Bulmers Cider, was founded in 1887 in Hereford, England by Percy Bulmer, the 20 year old son of the local rector at Credenhill, taking his mother's advice to make a career in food or drink, "because neither ever go out of fashion". Bulmers cider can be found worldwide and Strongbow is sold across Europe, Scandinavia, USA, Australasia and the Far East. The company is owned by Heineken.

name: Kenai River Brewing Company
description: Kenai River Brewing Company is a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted ales. Compliment your adventure, whether fishing, hiking, snow machining, or just relaxing, with freshly brewed beer. Support locally brewed beer by asking for Kenai River Brewing Company at your favorite bar or restaurant.

name: The Ale Apothecary
description: Producing the finest hand made beer using our own innovative brewing process, which melds the ancient art of brewing with traditions of wine & champagne production. With great ambition and intention, we open the window to mystery with every fermentation!

name: Modist Brewing Company
description: At Modist, our aim is to modify beer and how it is perceived by defying rules and expectations. We don’t abide by established style guidelines and refuse to bend to preconceived notions. We will push past traditional brewing by embracing creativity and unconstrained experimentation, taking an innovative approach to ingredients and techniques in order to harness raw inspiration and create a new beer experience.

name: Gravity Brewlab
description: The brainchild of owner Diego Ganoza, Gravity Brew Lab is designed to be the answer to the question Miami has been asking for the past several years: "why can't we have creative, top quality, locally made craft beer; like most other metropolitan cities in the U.S.?" Originally, the concept was to open a really cool beer bar, bringing beer from around the United States and Belgium and making it available for the local enthusiasts to enjoy. However, we soon realized we were somewhat limited and constrained by which beers were actually available in the Miami market -due to distribution and other factors. And since we're all about unfettered drinking and out of the box thinking, the concept soon changed to: "let's brew our own!". This way we would be free to experiment with both well known and more obscure styles and experiment with flavor profiles and combinations. The possibilities, which once looked constrained, now appeared limitless. Enter Robert Tejon and Seth Hammond! After meeting and networking within Miami's local brewer community for the better part of a year, Diego met Robert and Seth. They decided to start making some test batches, which eventually led to making one-off pilot batches for nationally-renowned events (please see our "events" section). As momentum gathered, we realized that there was great potential in this concept and decided that the brewpub was definitely the way we wanted to go. As Gravity Brew Lab, our mission is to bring you uncompromising, top quality beer. Our true purpose, though, is to give you a new experience every time you sit at one of our tables and ask for a glass of beer.

name: Devil's Purse Brewing Company
description: Devil's Purse Brewing Co. is a small craft brewery located on Cape Cod in South Dennis dedicated to the pursuit of making exceptional handcrafted beers. Many of our beers are American styles heavily influenced by their older European cousins. While our beers reflect the elegance of simplicity we enjoy the creativity and experimentation that can occur in the brewhouse. Above all is our commitment to using only the highest quality ingredients and great care in making our beer.

name: Beach City Brewery
description: The Beach City Brewery team is proud to be located in Orange County. Our flagship beers were created with the characteristics of Surf City in mind and seasonal offerings will reflect and represent all of OC. Being immediately accepted and brought into the Craft Beer community by its brewers was both humbling and a privilege. Come and enjoy a beer with our team at the Tasting Room soon!

name: Big aLICe Brewing Co.
description: Big aLICe Brewing is a licensed New York State farm brewery dedicated to crafting innovative, locally-sourced beer. Proud to be located in Queens, New York City, we love our borough. We believe that beer supports and builds community, and we want our beer to start conversations about what it means to be local and about the process of making great beer. Come visit and explore the awesome potential of craft beer with us!

name: Hopewell Brewing company
description: With a nod to tradition as well as innovation (we love the future), we are committed to making the beer that we want to drink. Unpretentious, fresh, good beer.

name: Switchback Brewing Company
description: Located in Burlington, Vermont, Switchback Brewing Company was founded in 2002 by a formally trained master brewer and his friend, the vision was to concentrate limited resources into making just a few beers to achieve the highest quality possible. The success of Switchback Ale beer has driven constant expansion for over 7 years and made the release of three Rotating Specials, Roasted Red Ale, Porter, and Slow-Fermented Brown Ale possible. Thank you for your support! As in the beginning, Switchback continues to rely on word of mouth to increase sales, which have expanded into New York, New Hampshire, and Southern Maine. Switchback now brews several thousand barrels of beer each year, but its beer is only available on draught or in 1/2 and 1/6 barrel size kegs.

name: Søgaards Bryghus
description: Restaurant Søgaard Bryghus is Aalborg's micro-brewery, which also houses a restaurant. Søgaards Bryghus is divided into two floors with its restaurant on the ground floor and brewery in the basement. In the brewery, you have the opportunity to follow the brewing process. Restaurant Søgaards Bryghus serves well-prepared food made ​​from seasonal ingredients, which means that the menu follows the seasons. For dinner, you can enjoy the brewery's own beer and if you wish guidance on what beers to match the food, this is also possible. On Sundays Søgaards Bryghus offers sn great brunch buffet with freshly squeezed orange juice, scrambled eggs, bacon, charcuterie, pâté, fruit, brownies, homemade jams and much more.

name: Solid Ground Brewing
description: Solid Ground Brewing is a 30 barrel production brewery founded in Diamond Springs, CA. Brewers, KC Sare and Scott Johnson are both foothill natives who wish to use their backgrounds and passion to craft quality lagers, ales, innovative beers, and wine for the enjoyment of our community, friends, family, and beyond.

name: DC Brau Brewing Company
description: The fact that D.C. has become a world-class beer town is undeniable. The choices available to the local beer nerdery are staggering and ever expanding. The neighborhood corner stores continue to add microbrews to their stock and it seems that a dynamite draft selection is essential to any new bar that opens. Restaurants regularly hold beer dinners featuring multi-course food and beer pairings and for seven days in the spring, during DC Beer Week, the number of beer-themed events can make the head spin. At a handful of downtown brewpubs the beer enthusiast can sample a variety of house made brews. What D.C. has not had in over 60 years, however, is a brewery whose product is available in local stores and on tap outside of its site of production.

name: The Brewer's Cabinet
description: Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers. Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers. With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is. The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!

name: Saddle Mountain Brewing Company
description: Goodyear, AZ first full production craft brewery and full service restaurant. Founded in 2011 honoring our countries military and first responders.

name: NoCoast Beer Co.
description: Rooted in Midwestern pride, NoCoast playfully rejects the pretension of the coasts and celebrates the fuss-free simplicity and down-to-earth attitude of flyover country. NoCoast is a nation of individuals that respect hard work and good beer, PLAINS SIMPLE.

name: Lab Brewing @ Twisted Oak Tavern
description: Twisted Oak Tavern was established in 2015 in the heart of Agoura Hills, California. Bringing a modern take on the traditional tavern along with Lab Brewing producing our very own craft beers on site. Serving an extensive menu with each dish prepared from scratch with locally-sourced ingredients. Voted Best Beer Bar In California!

name: The Quarter Barrel Arcade & Brewery
description: The Quarter Barrel in Cedar Rapids, Iowa is a video game and pinball arcade, pizzeria, and brewery. We operate a 7 bbl brewing system.

name: Big Bend Brewing Company
description: To give West Texas a brand of beer that embodies the qualities of liberty and persistence that make the people of Big Bend exceptional.

name: Tent City Beer Company
description: Brew with only the finest ingredients. Drink with only the best of people.

name: White Pony microbrewery
description: White Pony is a micro-brewery located in Padova (Italy). We brew our beers in Belgium and Italy. All our Beers are handmade, unfiltered & unpasteurized

name: Fort Bend Brewing Company
description: Fort Bend Brewing, Fort Bend's First Craft Brewery, combines creativity, the Texas state-of-mind, with high quality ingredients to make exquisite craft beers.

name: Societe Brewing Company
description: Societe Brewing Company is a production brewery founded in San Diego, California by fellow professional brewers Travis Smith and Douglas Constantiner. In 2012, Societe Brewing Company began production and opened its doors to a warm welcome from the San Diego craft beer community. The brewery and tasting room occupy a 16,000 square foot facility in Kerney Mesa, in the eastern part of San Diego. Societe Brewing Company focuses on hoppy Out West ales, Belgian-inspired Old World ales, and dark and flavorful Stygian ales. The brewery also features a 3,000 square foot barrel room, and there are intentions to release a line-up of barrel-aged sour beers in the future. Societe’s beers are available locally throughout San Diego, and also available at the tasting room.

name: 2 Towns Ciderhouse
description: Damn Fine Cider. Boldly Crafted in the Pacific Northwest. Fresh-pressed 100% NW apples. No added sugar. Nothing artificial.

name: Stillmank Beer Company
description: We are an independently owned Wisconsin family beer company. We have been brewing beer for well over a decade now, and are very excited to finally be able to legally bring you our favorite. Wisco-Disco is a deep amber colored beer, with rich malt and hop flavors. We brew this beer with a small amount of milk sugar (or lactose). This gives Wisco-Disco its smooth body, and makes it a perfect match to pair with your favorite cheeses. Wisco-Disco is brewed with five different malts, and four giant hop additions for huge flavor, then cold filtered for perfect clarity and refreshment!

name: Frecon's Cidery
description: Frecon's Cidery is a family & friend owned estate cidery located in Berks County, Pennsylvania. We make traditional cider using classic techniques & use apples from our family orchard, which as been growing quality tree fruits since 1944. Using a blend of dessert, cider & aromatic apples, both heirloom & modern, our cider makers select the best balances to ferment into the final product. We're proud to continue an American tradition of fine ciders that feature great aroma & flavor, recently recognized with a bronze medal by the Great Lakes Cider & Perry Association.

name: Abbey of the Holy Goats
description: Abbey of the Holy Goats is a small-scale craft brewery located in Roswell, Georgia and is focused on brewing gastronomically designed beers that are meant to be enjoyed with favorable company and exceptional food. We are devoted to make you feel like you are a part of our family and provide you with gratifyingly, great tasting beer.

name: Anspach & Hobday
description: Anspach & Hobday has crafted a range of core beers. These are complimented by our Experimental Series of beer styles we’re working on and one off specials like our recent Oktoberfest beers.

name: The Old Fashioned
description: Inspired by the traditions of Wisconsin taverns and supper clubs, The Old Fashioned exists to pay tribute to the foods and spirits that make our state famous. Here, that means so much more than beers, brats, and cheese. Don't worry, we take all those things very seriously, but we're equally committed to preserving the unique heritage that defines our way of life. When you walk through our doors, you'll not only experience what Wisconsin was, you’ll taste what it always will be.

name: Noble Cider
description: In Asheville, NC just 2 miles from Patton Ave Noble Cider specializes in unique ciders, cysers and meads. Noble Cider is "True to the Core"!

name: Saku Õlletehas
description: The brewing traditions of Saku Brewery reach back to the beginning of the 19th century. Then the Saku estate was owned by count Karl Friedrich Rehbinder who built a distillery and a brewery on his estate. The brewery was first documented in October 1820. It is believed that the production of beer, for the purpose of sale to pubs and taverns begun during the autumn of that year. From the end of 19th century onward Saku has remained among the leading breweries in Estonia. In 1991 joint venture Saku Õlletehas was established. Since January 27, 1998 the shares of Saku Brewery were traded in the list on the Tallinn Stock Exchange. On September 20, 2008, the shares of Saku Õlletehase AS were delisted from Tallinn Stock Exchange. Today 100% of the shares are owned by Carlsberg Breweries. Through large investments, Saku Brewery has become the market leader on the Estonian beer market. According to market research by ACNielsen in March 2009, Saku Brewery held 38,7% of the local market share. The total sales of beer by Saku amounted to 59 million litres in 2007. Beverages of Saku Brewery are exported amongst other countries to Sweden (the only Estonian beer in the Systembolaget is Saku Kuld), Finland, Netherlands, England, Germany, Ireland and Canada. Saku's exports during the first five months of 2009 amounted to 3,12 million litres.

name: Mother's Brewing Company
description: Mother's is a growing family that's all about heady craft beers. So we started our own brewery, and we're producing as much love per barrel as we possibly can. In the short time that we've been open, we've made a helluva lot of different, fun, and innovative beers. Stop by and see what we brought with us. Cheers!

name: Double Barley Brewing
description: Big, bold, hand-crafted beers in a unique setting featuring a 70+ seat tap room beer garden and kitchen.

name: Hydro Street Brewing Company
description: Our brewery is in central Wisconsin just outside of Madison, which is thankfully vibrant with craft breweries, and now even distilleries. (the Napa valley of micro beer? love it) Our goal as a small business is first to provide high quality food, beverage, and service to all; and second to support our community.

name: Florence Brewery
description: The Florence pub is a major South London landmark and home to the Florence Brewery, which is home both to beers produced under the Florence name and the A Head In A Hat range. The Florence Brewery is looking forward to building a name for itself as part of the vibrant life of South London and let’s face it, what we do is . . . Too good for North London!

name: Portner Brewhouse
description: Brewery restaurant and Craft Beer Test Kitchen inspired by South's largest pre-Prohibition brewery - The Robert Portner Brewing Company which was headquartered in Alexandria, VA from 1869 until 1916 when the State of Virginia enacted the 18th Amendment. Portner Brewhouse offers classic German and contemporary cuisine paired with pre-Prohibtion beers, brewmaster seasonal selections and recipes accepted in the Craft Beer Test Kitchen program. Join us in celebrating the pursuit of the American Dream!

name: Nomad Handcrafted Cider
description: We are a Summerland, BC craft cidery passionate about making cider the way it was traditionally made, by hand and with fresh pressed apple juice. We are devoted to producing the highest quality cider made from local Okanagan apples, grown by dedicated and hardworking farmers. We are nomads, endlessly exploring food, drink and culture. Our thirst for knowledge and new experiences continually inspire us to create great tasting ciders.

name: Danny Boy Beer Works
description: Danny Boy Beer Works is a family friendly brewery and pub located in the heart of the Village of West Clay, located just 15 miles from Indianapolis’ Circle Center. We are proud to feature 10 taps dedicated to Danny Boy Beers and 30 guest taps.

name: Westvleteren Abdij St. Sixtus
description: The Westvleteren Brewery is a Belgian brewery founded in 1838 inside the Trappist Abbey of Saint Sixtus of Westvleteren in the Belgian municipality of Vleteren, not far from the hops-producing town of Poperinge and the medieval city of Ypres. The brewery and its beers are usually referred to as Westvleteren. The brewery's three beers have acquired an international reputation for taste and quality, being considered by a percentage of beer aficionados and judges to be "the best beer in the world" (for Wesvleteren XII, a Quadrupel) as well as the limited availability of the beers which are not brewed to normal commercial demands, but are sold in small quantities weekly from the doors of the monastery itself, to individual buyers after reservation only.

name: Treehorn Cider
description: Treehorn Cider started with a conversation among friends in Fall 2013. We all love craft beer, good wine and great food – especially from local producers. Hard cider began popping up in the craft beer cases around town. Local hard cider production in North Carolina and across the country was starting to take off. So we asked ourselves – why not Atlanta? Our home city has a vibrant farm-to-table restaurant scene, and more than 60 farmers markets. North Georgia has robust apple production. Craft cocktails, small-scale craft breweries and local restaurants dominate growth in the city. We would jump on the chance to taste a locally made hard cider, so why didn’t we make it ourselves? So it began. We carefully considered where in Atlanta to base our business, and ended up just where some of our partners grew up – Marietta. We leveraged years of home-based cider making, and started figuring out how to make the best cider – clean, refreshing and pleasantly sweet, while avoiding the cloying taste and heavy back-sweetening found in most national brands. Treehorn Cider is available in restaurants, bars and growler shops throughout Georgia. We love talking and thinking about cider, and above all making cider that you can drink with any meal, any time. It’s become our passion, and we couldn’t be more excited about the opportunity to share it with you!
street_address: 1395 S Marietta Pkwy SE, Bldg 100, Ste 130

name: Trophy Brewing Company
description: A 3 barrel nano brewery in downtown Raleigh with a 20 bbl production facility just outside of downtown, both of which offer growlers & package to go. The brewpub features a full service pizza restaurant and bar with an outdoor patio, and the larger brewery on Maywood has a spectacular view of the brewery and food trucks regularly.

name: Two Coast Brewing Co.
description: German Beers made fresh in California

name: Tyskie Kompania Piwowarska
description: Kompania Piwowarska is a brewing company established in Poland in 1999 as a result of the merger of two SABMiller owned Polish breweries, Lech Browary Wielkopolski S.A. in Poznań and Browary Tyskie Górny Śląsk SA. in Tychy. Browary Tyskie Górny Śląsk was founded in 1629. The company also owns the Dojlidy Brewery in Białystok. The three breweries have a total capacity of 15.1 million hectolitres. SABMiller purchased a majority share in the Lech and Tyskie breweries in 1995.

name: Down the Road Beer Co.
description: An up-and-coming Metro Boston beer crafter. We are committed to making top-quality beer and getting it to you at the peak of freshness. Get Thirsty!

name: Waterline Brewing Company
description: Located in an historic 1940s era warehouse beneath the Cape Fear Memorial Bridge, we distribute keg beer locally, give tours, and welcome you to sit and enjoy our brews in our expansive tasting room. Original concrete floors and rough cut heart pine beams throughout the spaces make for a wonderful place to brew and taste craft beers!

name: Ursus Breweries
description: Ursus Breweries owns three breweries in Romania, Brasov, Buzau and Timisoara and a mini-production facility in Cluj-Napoca. One of three beers consumed by the Romans is a trademark of Ursus Breweries portfolio, which says a lot about the quality of our beers and appreciation that they enjoy among consumers. Ursus Breweries regulations on the use of the Facebook pages: By using this site, you agree to the Terms and Conditions Facebook and regulations below. Comments and other material posted by fans and Facebook users do not reflect the views of Ursus Breweries and Ursus Breweries does not validate their accuracy. Users will post relevant comments and polite to the community. Ursus Breweries will moderate all comments and reserves the right to remove any post that violates these regulations and will block any user who violates regulations repeatedly. In particular, we will delete comments: What defame, abuse, harass, threaten or violate the rights of others in any other measure. What are racist, sexist, homophobic, sexually explicit, abusive or in a any other way unacceptable. Which contain offensive words or defamatory language. Which we know or suspect that violate the law or encourage any illegal activity. This includes publishing, posting, distributing or disseminating any material or information that are defamatory, infringing, which are indecent, misleading or illegal. Promoting products or services for profit. What are posted to appear on behalf of another person. What are posted repetitive or not relevant to Ursus Breweries - spam comments. Including personal contact information such as phone numbers, e-mail or postal addresses. Describing or encourage activities which could endanger the safety of others, including comments on the abuse of alcohol. These regulations were designed to help ensure a pleasant our fans. Please respect the regulations every time you enter into dialogue with Ursus Breweries.

name: Ambachtelijke Vechtdal Brouwerij
description: Since the end of October 2016, the craft brewery in Dalfsen has been taken into use. Before that we brew our beer at Admiral Brewery. Starting in early December, the staff of the Learning Center will start working at the brewery weekly. There is also cooperation with the municipality of Dalfsen and "workplaces" offered to people from the WMO.

name: Declaration Brewing Company
description: Dedicated to constantly challenging what is possible in craft beer, Declaration Brewing Company will strive to write its own chapter in the celebrated history that humanity and beer share. Through continual evolution of the status quo, Declaration Brewing Company aims to expand upon established craft beer culture, practices, and expectations.

name: Beer Engineers
description: We are Alabama's newest Craft Beer Company. We are dedicated to making the South's finest high gravity beers. We are experimental. We are new. We are better by design.

name: Ohio Brewing Company
description: Ohio Brewing Company is an award-winning microbrewery located in downtown Akron in the historic Selle building. Our brewery produces a wide array of styles, form German ales to Irish Red ales to Stouts and even Oktoberfest lagers. The original Ohio Brewing Company was founded in 1997 in Niles, Ohio by current owner Chris Verich. Our current operation is a new venture by Chris in Akron, Ohio to produce these award-winning beers in a craft production brewery setting.

name: Blueprint Brewing Co.
description: Harleysville’s first brewery invites you to enjoy beer (Gluten Free and Gluten Full) with us and help us “Draw Up” a revolution for our town and our fellow beer lovers. Blueprints require a team to bring what is on paper to life. Someone to hammer a nail, lay a line, and make it all happen. It’s not just us but also our neighbors and friends that will bring what we love about beer to life – community!!! We want to give people great beer, gluten free and gluten full, and to those that have lost it, bring back the joy of beer. God’s greatest creation!

name: Voortsche Bieren
description: Voortsche Bieren is our local brewery of traditional and regional beers. We are five friend brewing over 25 years and now share our best beers with everybody that love special beers. By doing so we continue the brewing tradition at Voorthuizen started around the year 1453.

name: Asgard Brewing Company
description: Located in Columbia, Tennessee, with a taproom operating since 9/01/16, currently contract brewing. Norse mythology based names and themes and strives to make beers in the "Nordic Style" We view Nordic Style in much the same way brewers refer to ther beer as farm to barrel. Nordic brewers would have use anything growing around them to make beer. We are working to make more of our beers in this manner.

name: Crooked Hammock Brewery
description: Crooked Hammock Brewery - Restaurant - Backyard Beer Garden delivers the Beach Life- Easy Going – Flavorful - Lively – backyard cookout craft brews

name: Blue Earl Brewing Co.
description: Delaware's 7th microbrewery located in The Historic Town of Smyrna. Brewing extra special beer offerings! Crafting beers that are brewed for the soul. Now open! Cheers!

name: NorthGate Brewing
description: Focused on session ales from the classic British styles. Small batch and fresh delivery.

name: Weldebräu GmbH & Co. KG
description: Welde represents authentic, independent brewing and the pleasure of exclusive beer. For over 260 years, our brewery in Baden has used the best raw materials, traditional craftsmanship and innovative ideas to create first-rate beers. Beers as they should be: perfectly crafted and with a unique taste.

name: Wells and Young's Brewing Company
description: Wells and Young's Brewing Company is the epitome of all-round business excellence, demonstrating sustained growth for its beers and stockists whilst combining traditional family values with innovation and development. Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.

name: Brouwerij Abdij der Trappisten van Westmalle
name_short_display: Brouwerij Abdij der Trappisten van Westmalle
description: For more than 200 years the Westmalle Trappists have chosen a life of prayer and work. That is their true vocation, entirely in accordance with the rule of Saint Benedict. Monks, he stipulates, have to provide for themselves. thus there is also a brewery within the abbey. The monks deliberately keep production small, with special care for man and the environment. And because profit is not their motive, they spend the surplus from it on charity work and on people in need.

name: Whetstone Station Restaurant and Brewery
description: Restaurant, Brewery, Bier Garten and Craft Beer Bar. All with beautiful views, great food and beer in a fun atmosphere on the water in downtown Brattleboro Vermont.

name: Holgate Brewhouse
description: Holgate Brewhouse is an independent craft brewery run by a small team passionate about hand-crafting fresh, full flavoured beers. Located 45 minutes from Melbourne in the picturesque village of Woodend, visit the brewery inside our iconic, restored 19th century hotel with restaurant, accommodation and eight Holgate beers on tap. Check our stockists page for the Holgate retail outlet or Holgate tap nearest you!

name: Moonlight Pizza & Brewpub
description: Every Monday we donate 10% of our sales to programs in Salida we believe make this town amazing. We support anything from school groups to ski clubs to horse rescue to the mentors program because, well, they support us and honestly it’s the right thing to do. Dough. We like dough. It fits well in wallets and tastes good under cheese. We like to think we’ve got some good dough. We make pizza crust, we make sandwich bread, and we make finely crafted dog sweaters. Alright, we don’t make the last one, but we COULD if we wanted to. We take pride in the freshness of our dough and veggies. Our dough was made today. It wasn’t made in Topeka, frozen, shipped here, and warmed up. Ask who made it and he or she is probably in the kitchen. Why no Straws? We know you didn’t get one. You’ll use them for about seven minutes and then we have to throw them away. It’s nothing personal. If you absolutely need one we’re happy to oblige, but we’re trying to reduce our non-recyclables, keep our landfills at a minimum, and keep plastic out of our oceans. Find a kid and ask them about plastic. Plastic pollutes our oceans and air, so we serve our beverages in glass. If you want to bring a kid cup from home, we’ll fill it up! What, no Coasters? You’d be amazed at how many coasters we pick up off the floor. If our tables were Peruvian mahogany, inlaid with reclaimed oak from an historic church in New Brunswick, we’d say “heck yeah, give that pizza patron a coaster!” Let’s conserve together. Hopefully you’re now thinking, “Wow Henrietta, these are some globally concerned restaurateurs.” But, then again, maybe you’re wondering about the lack of ice in the sodas? Are we trying to conserve ice bergs? Nope. We don’t even know any icebergs. Our soda’s are handmade with the finest extracts available, fantastic water and cane sugar. They’re served at cellar temps just like our beers, so you get a full flavored beverage that doesn’t need to be watered down. There’s a saying in Colorado, Whiskey’s for drinking, water’s for fighting. (We also have Whiskey, no fighting). If you want ice, just ask. We’ll not think less of you. Becoming a soda pop connoisseur takes time. From all of us at Moonlight Pizza: Kick back, order another beer, enjoy the sunset, and don’t forget your leftovers! Peace.

name: Pete's Brewing
description: Founded by homebrewer Pete Slosberg and Mark Bronder in 1986, helping to pioneer the craft beer movement. Exclusively brewed under contract by Matt Brewing Company of Utica, NY, best known for their Saranac line. Sold to the Gambrinus Company in 1998. Sadly, ceased production in spring 2011 after declining sales under Gambrinus ownership.

name: El Paso Brewing Company
description: El Paso Brewing Company’s mission is to become a recognized regional brewery that provides an outstanding variety of high quality specialized and seasonal beers. While crafting our beer recipes we also strive to craft a unique space where visitors will share their vibrant borderland experiences in the best of friendships.

name: Great Basin Brewing Company
description: Great Basin Brewing Co. makes fresh hand-crafted beer right before your eyes using the finest American & European grains, hops & yeast. The rugged beauty and free spirit of this region have inspired the creation of the brewery and the beers that you enjoy. We invite you to celebrate our heritage with us.

name: Little Mountain Brewing Company
description: Brew your own beer, taste ours, or grab a couple bombers or growlers to go. We have kegs, and brew hand crafted beer for parties, graduations, weddings, re-unions, and other events.

name: Defiance Brewing Company
description: Defiance Brewing Company is a soon to be up and running production craft brewery (not a restaurant/brewpub) located in Hays, KS. The brewery will offer a wide variety of new and fresh beer that we have all been craving.

name: Wind River Brewing Company
description: Wind River Brewing Company is located at the base of the Wind River Mountains in downtown Pinedale, Wyoming. Our brewery is the spot for those who appreciate the art of handcrafted superior brews with a wide range of flavors and notes. We brew award winning beers, created in-house using only the finest ingredients and pure glacier water. "We are known for having legendary beer and the best food in town." If you're looking for a quick bite to eat or want to relax and sample our entire selection of beer we welcome you to join us at Wind River Brewing Co.

name: Bad Weather Brewery
description: Bad Weather knows the beer-lover's calendar is one that changes with seasons. BWBC offers unique beers with Midwestern Edge to them. These beers complement and celebrate the shifting summer sun and frigid winter winds.

name: Dru Bru
description: Our beers are European-inspired and uniquely sessionable – designed to showcase deep flavors in an approachable package. Using unfiltered Snoqualmie Pass mountain water, imported German malts and Yakima Valley hops we craft beers that are distinctly Dru Bru. We offer a warm welcome, a wealth of beer knowledge and wide variety styles brewed in our adjoining 15 barrel brewhouse. Our taproom is open year round so park your skis, boards, bikes, packs or cars and gather around something great. All ages welcome.

name: Turtle Mountain Brewing Company
description: The Story Behind Turtle Mountain Brewing Company TMBC is the end result of way too much dreaming (and drinking) on the part of the proprietor, Nico Ortiz. Starting with a student exchange to Germany when he was 16, he has dedicated his life to the pursuit of good beer. This brewpub is the result of over 23 years of "market research" in hundreds of bars, brewpubs, breweries, garages, and beer festivals all over the world. The name " Turtle Mountain" comes from the Tewa name for Sandia Peak. Alfonso Ortiz (Nico's father) was born and raised at Oke Owingeh, north of Espanola, and one of six Pueblos that speak Tewa. Nico's father's Indian name was "Oku Pin", which translates as " Turtle Mountain". As a tribute to his father, who provided the inspirational and financial means to open the pub, Nico has named it Turtle Mountain Brewing Company.

name: Apocalypse Ale Works
description: Apocalypse Ale Works is the first brewery in Forest, Virginia since Thomas Jefferson brewed in the 1800's at Poplar Forest. In addition to a brewery, we also have a tasting room, where the public can try our products. We are located in the old Forest Volunteer Fire Department, beside Pints O'Plenty. The brewery will sell kegs all over the state of Virginia, with an emphasis on supplying the local restaurants first. Eventually we will expand to bottling our beer. Our mission is to brew quality beer for all palates. The end of bad beer is here!

name: Beijing Yanjing
description: Yanjing Beer has been the largest selling beer in China for ten consecutive years now. It currently maintains 85% market share in Beijing and was one of the major sponsors of the 2008 Beijing Olympics. Yanjing Beer is brewed with pure mineral water collected 300 meters beneath the Yanshang Mountain and is certified “Green Food”.
